description: Get the latest news and updates from the FOX Sports - home to the 2018 FIFA World Cup (TM), MLB, NASCAR, NBA, NHL and more.

name: Pennsylvania Hunting Seasons
description: Returns random lists of when hunting seasons for deer are in Pennsylvania. Right now its limited to only a few deer seasons, but soon I hope to allow control of type of season and to pull that data live from the PGC's website.

name: Biking Wizard
description: Biking Wizard checks the weather for you and tells you if the conditions are right for a bike ride today!
review: It should say why? Like the temp is 65° and partly cloudy and the winds are from the south at 8 mph...

name: ESPN
description:
Get your sports radio fix with the ESPN skill. From Mike and Mike to Dan Le Batard and Stu Gotz, this skill brings you live ESPN Radio, several ESPN affiliate stations, and hourly news updates.  

Say, "Tell me the news," "Play the radio," or ask for your local ESPN radio station to access the best in sports radio content.

Supported radio stations include:
- ESPN Radio
- ESPN Deportes Radio
- ESPN Chicago (WMVP 1000 AM)
- ESPN Los Angeles (KSPN 710 AM)
- ESPN New York (WEPN 98.7 FM)
- ESPN Deportes New York (WEPN 1050 AM)
review:
As I said, too many
Ads

name: Bama Hammer
description:
Are you a huge Alabama Crimson Tide fan? Then you need the Bama Hammer Flash Briefing Skill by FanSided to get the latest news, opinions and rumors on the Crimson Tide. 

Bama Hammer is the Alabama Crimson Tides news and opinions site brought to you by the FanSided Network. Bama Hammer is dedicated to providing top-notch Crimson Tide news, views, and original content. This site also serves as a community for like-minded fans to come together to catch up on the latest news and to discuss their passion.

name: World Series Champs Trivia Game
description: Ten possible questions.  Alexa will ask who won in a particular year.  You'll hear multiple choice answers and you respond with the number corresponding to the correct answer.  Try to prove you know the World Series champs.
review: Fun!

name: Josh Allen Facts
description: Get to know the potential #1 overall pick in this year's NFL Draft. Josh Allen Facts includes over 50 facts about the former Wyoming quarterback.

name: Locked On 49ers
description: The Flash Briefing for San Francisco 49ers fans need from Locked On 49ers. Follow your team every day with on-demand insights, news, interviews and perspective from insider Brian Peacock. Locked On 49ers is part of the Locked On Podcast Network, the #1 local daily sports podcast network. Locked On covers every NFL and NBA team with a growing list of MLB and major College teams too. To listen to the daily podcast, just ask Alexa to play the Locked On 49ers podcast. Get Locked On and follow “YOUR TEAM. EVERY DAY”.
review: This is super.  I feel so lucky as a 49ers fan to have this update.  It is 1st stop after the weather on my flash briefing. Brian gives me the big stories with a little extra detail and all in about 90 seconds.  It is great.  Every team wishes they had one of these.  Love the Locked on 49ers podcast for my longer dives into 49ers news.

name: RollTide
description: Say Roll Tide to Alexa and she will respond like a proper Alabam fan.

name: RollTide
description: Say Roll Tide to Alexa and she will respond like a proper Alabam fan.
review: RTR

name: Tachiai Sumo News
description: Sumo news from the team at Tachiai, now in your Flash Briefing. We bring you the latest from the world of sumo: covering events from every Grand Sumo tournament, the Jungyo tours, and daily practice sessions. Match scores, daily previews, the latest injury reports, your one-stop source for any sumo fan.
review: Easy to set up and convenient for sumo news bilingual support & needs improvement. Alexa's UI has issues as I cannot see what I am typing.

name: NCAA March Madness
description:
NCAA March Madness for Alexa delivers real-time tournament scores, schedules, information about your Bracket Picks, and live radio for each game.

Example Phrases:

“Alexa, ask March Madness what games are on right now?”

“Alexa, ask March Madness for today's scores.”

“Alexa, ask March Madness for today's schedule.”

“Alexa, ask March Madness what games can I listen to on the radio?”

“Alexa, ask March Madness for the score of the North Carolina game.”

“Alexa, ask March Madness to play the Duke versus Kentucky game.”

“Alexa, ask March Madness what time the Kansas game starts.”

“Alexa, ask March Madness how my bracket is doing.”

“Alexa, ask March Madness who I picked to win it all.”

“Alexa, ask March Madness which teams I picked today.”

To ask for help or give feedback on this skill please contact mmlivehelp@turner.com

*Note: The live radio feature is currently not supported on Fire TV.

*Note: Must sign-in with a valid Capital One NCAA March Madness Bracket Challenge account in order to get information about your bracket picks.
comment heading: Alexa says playing game now...but nothing happens
review: Boo!

name: E Sport Odds
description:
E Sport Odds gives the game lines or odds based on the spread. E Sport Odds gives the lines for up to 10 games currently on the roster for the next 24 hours. E Sport Odds are updated hourly for all games, unless they are currently in play, or have been played, then information will not be given. This information is taken from an average of online sports books and is not guaranteed to be accurate. Please check your betting odds or game lines before placing your wagers.
 
This information and skill is sponsored by TheVegasBook.win
review: If you are looking for sport odds that are not run of the mill, look no further than E Sport Odds. The newest latest betting, get your game and odds on with this skill!

name: FantasyMetrix
description:
Alexa will provide past and present, weekly and season-long, statistics along with advanced metrics derived from NFL players using the Yahoo Fantasy Sports API

How To Use For Metrics:
1. Name of a current NFL player who has played in at least one game
2. Valid football metric pertaining to that player's position (See list below)
3. Year of an NFL season ranging from 2001 – Present
4. Week number is merely optional (Week 1 – 17)
5. Target metrics are only available beginning from year 2014 – Present

How To Use For Schedule:
1. Name of an NFL team
2. Year of an NFL season ranging from 2002 – Present
3. Week number ranging from Week 1 – 17

Quick Example Phrases:
Alexa, ask FantasyMetrix Rob Gronkowski, season stats, 2010
Alexa, ask FantasyMetrix Julio Jones, yards per reception, 2011
Alexa, ask FantasyMetrix Marshawn Lynch, rushing yards, 2012
Alexa, ask FantasyMetrix Russell Wilson, completions, twenty thirteen
Alexa, ask FantasyMetrix Oakland Raiders, week 10, twenty fourteen

Football Metrics:
Carries
Catch Rate
Completions
Completion Percentage
Fantasy Points
Fantasy Points Per Game
Fumbles
Game Log
Games Played
Half PPR Points
Half PPR Points Per Game
Interceptions
Passing Attempts
Passing Attempts Per Game
Passing Touchdowns
Passing Yards
Passing Yards Per Game
PPR Points
PPR Points Per Game
Receiving Touchdowns
Receiving Yards
Receiving Yards Per Game
Receptions
Receptions Per Game
Return Touchdowns
Rushing Attempts
Rushing Attempts Per Game
Rushing Touchdowns
Rushing Yards
Rushing Yards Per Game
Season Stats
Targets
Targets Per Game
Total Touchdowns
Two Point Conversions
Yards From Scrimmage
Yards From Scrimmage Per Game
Yards Per Attempt
Yards Per Carry
Yards Per Reception
Yards Per Target

name: UGA Roster
description:
UGA Roster is the perfect gameday companion! If you have ever wanted to identify a player by jersey number or name, the answer is now just one Alexa command away. 

UGA Roster lets you ask questions like "Who is Jacob Eason?", or "Who is number 27?". You can also ask about a player's position, height, weight, class, and hometown. 



*This skill pulls information from ESPN. The skill was created by a UGA student who is in no way affiliated with ESPN or UGA Athletics.
review: Information is NOT current!

review: The volume , especially of the initial music, was way too loud. They must have responded to other complaints and "fixed" it such that the volume was so low I thought Alexa had gone off line. Now completely useless.

description: This skill uses data provided by the city of Fort Collins and Larimer County to provide information on which natural areas are open to biking and hiking.  The information is updated every morning.

name: Calling the Hogs
description:
Have Alexa call the razorbacks hogs by saying

"Alexa, start calling the hogs"

Optionally "and let's beat the {mascot}" or "and let's beat {college}"  can be included at the end of the launch command.

"Alexa, Start calling the hogs and beat the bulldogs"
"Alexa, Start calling the hogs and beat Alabama"
review: Go Razorbacks

name: NBA
description:
Welcome to the new NBA Alexa Skill! You can interact with me in several ways:

(1) Open me by saying "Alexa, open NBA." You should always start your conversation with me this way.  This will trigger the welcome menu and tell you how to listen to live NBA action, check scores, and get schedule info. 

After you’ve opened the NBA skill…

(2) **To LISTEN TO A GAME**, tell me “Play the Cavs game" or “Stream the Atlanta game."  Most games have the home and away announcers, just say the team name for the announcers you want and we'll start streaming.  If Alexa has trouble recognizing your team name, be sure and use the city AND team name together, like “Houston Rockets.”

(3) To ask about the SCHEDULE, say “What games are on today?” OR “When do the Warriors play?”  Ask about a specific team to get broadcaster information for upcoming games.  

(4) Ask me about SCORES by saying, “What is the score of the Milwaukee Bucks game?” OR “What are the latest scores?"  

Additionally after opening the skill, you can say things to me like:

Who is playing now?
When do the Celtics play the Lakers?
What time are the Memphis Grizzlies on?
Did the Thunder win on Monday?

**You will need to login from the Alexa companion app with a valid NBA League Pass subscription in order to listen to games.  Visit www.nba.com/leaguepass to sign up today.
review: Lovve tha up dates

name: Superbowl Facts
description: Facts and Trivia about the superbowl (American football championship game). Great for a super bowl party to entertain guests, or just some fun facts to entertain yourself. Cool trivia about teams, players, even some trivia about the food and halftime show.
maker: by eRose Web & Business Services, LLC

comment heading: Sound like a golfer -- even if you've never set foot on a course!
review: I'm not a golfer, but now I'll be able to hold my own in conversations with friends who are. I particularly liked the false facts -- things people believe about golf that aren't true. The text is a little clunky, though, as though it was written to be read on screen, not read aloud. That's the only reason I didn't give it 5 stars.

name: Cricket Info
description:
You can ask for brief, detailed or quick score updates. You can ask for score or schedule for any team. Examples, 
“Alexa, ask cricket info to get score update” gets brief score update of all on going matches.
“Alexa, ask cricket info to get team India schedule” gets schedule of team India cricket matches.
"Alexa, ask cricket info to get IPL update" gets score updates for ongoing IPL matches. 
“Alexa, ask cricket info to get quick score update” gets score summary for all ongoing matches, you can optionally request quick score for a team.
“Alexa, ask cricket info to get team Australia detailed score” gets detailed score for ongoing match of team Australia.
review: Incredible details, works very well

– an overview of your team’s weekly matchup and score.
– your team’s injury/bye status. 
– player scores and injury updates.
All without ever putting your hands on the ball.

name: UFC Octagon News
description:
Have you ever asked yourself when is the next UFC event? Or what were the fights in the upcoming UFC main event? Now with this new UFC Octagon News skill, one can get the answer to these questions through Alexa. The UFC Octagon News was created for UFC fans to receive UFC related information easily through an Alexa device.

One can invoke this skill by saying "Alexa, open UFC Octagon".

Once the skill starts, it will prompt the listener to say something like "news", "next event", "previous event" or "men ranking". Then, the listener can choose the desired option to receive the related information back from Alexa.

Please note that this skill will continue growing based on the feedback and support we receive back from listeners. Currently, below are the main features:

1.	Say "news" to get more information about trending news relating to UFC. This option will also provide any other 
        update or new feature messages about this skill.

2.	Say "next event" to get more information about the next UFC main event such as date, place, main card fights.

3.	Say "previous event" to get more information about the results of the previous UFC main card fights.

4.	Say "men ranking" to get more information about all the UFC ranking categories for men. Please note that only the 
        champion and the top 3 ranked men fighters will be listed for each category.

5.	Say "women ranking" to get more information about all the UFC ranking categories for women. Please note that 
        only the champion and the top 3 ranked women fighters will be listed for each category.

6.	Say "stop" if you wish to exit the skill.

7.	Say "help" to get more information about how to use this Alexa skill.

Please feel free to contact us at quizmemore@yahoo.com for any issues or feedback you might have. We would love to hear from you about this skill to help us make this a better experience for everyone.
review: Its the most useful UFC app so far. with that said there is room for improvement

name: Baseball Reference
description:
Welcome to the Baseball Reference Alexa application. This application makes finding out leaders in certain statistics as easy as just asking. As of right now this app can only return top ranking and you cannot make request by specific players or team statistics.

Users are able to request a multitude of different statistics that can be further specified by rank (1-10), top amount (top two, top three, top four, etc.) year (1871 - present), and league (All of Baseball, National League or American League). 

Here are some initial example requests:
-------------------------------------------
Alexa, ask Baseball Reference who is third in the National League in home runs.

Who leads the league in doubles?

Who lead the American League in wins in nineteen eighty six?

Who is the oldest player in the league?

Alexa, ask Baseball Reference, in nineteen ninety nine, who lead the league in home runs?

Who was top three in strikeouts?

Who was tenth in wins in the National League in nineteen seventy two
-------------------------------------------

Another feature available to users is that after a user makes a successful request and are prompted to ask another question, a user can build upon their previous request.


For Example:
-------------------------------------------
User Requests - "Alexa, ask Baseball Reference who was second in the National League in hits in nineteen eighty three"

Alexa Responds - "Rafael Ramirez was second in the National League with 185 Hits in 1983."

The user can now request a few things:

- Next -
User Requests - "Who was next?"
Alexa Responds -  "Al Oliver was third in the National League with 184 Hits in 1983."

- Previous -
User Requests - "Who was previous?"
Alexa Responds -  "Jose Cruz and Andre Dawson were tied for first in the National League with 189 Hits In 1983 ."

- Rank -
User Requests - "Who was sixth?"
Alexa Responds -  "Dickie Thon was sixth in the National League with 177 Hits In 1983."

- Top -
User Requests - "Who was top three?"
Alexa Responds -  "Jose Cruz and Andre Dawson were tied for first in the National League with 189 Hits In 1983. Rafael Ramirez was second in the National League with 185 Hits In 1983. Al Oliver was third in the National League with 184 Hits In 1983."
-------------------------------------------

Statistics To Request
-----------------------
// Hitting
Singles
Doubles
Triples
Home runs
RBIs
Runs
Stolen bases
Caught stealing
Batting average
Hits
Wins above replacement
Slugging percentage
Extra base hits
Total bases
On base percentage
Walks
Intentional walks
Sacrifice flies
At bats per home run
Grounded into double plays

// Pitching
Earned Run Average
Strikeouts
Strikes per walk
Strikeouts per nine innings
WHIP
Wins
Shutouts
Saves
Innings Pitches

//Misc
Oldest Player
Youngest Player

If you have any questions or comments regarding this application please feel free to reach out to us at ottomanellibaseball@gmail.com.

General Updates:

Alexa, ask 49ers Fan who do the 49ers play next?

Alexa, ask 49ers Fan Carlos Hyde (or any player's First name, Last name) touchdown update.



Fun Facts about the 49ers:


Alexa, ask 49ers Fan to tell me some trivia about the 49ers.

Alexa, ask 49ers Fan how many Super Bowls have the 49ers won?

Alexa, ask 49ers Fan who is Carlos Hyde?

Alexa, ask 49ers Fan who is NaVorro Bowman?

Alexa, ask 49ers Fan who is Eric Reid?

name: 97.1 The Ticket Sports Update
description: Detroit Sports Headlines
review: In case you were thinking that maybe they had fixed it by now.

name: NBC Sports Update
description:
The NBC Sports Update brings you national sports news, every hour, 24/7. 

Add the NBC Sports Update to your Flash Briefing and move it to the top of your news by going to Settings in the Alexa app. You can manage your Flash Briefing under Account. After adding the NBC Sports Update, you can say “Alexa, what’s my Flash Briefing?” or “Alexa, what’s in the news?” to hear the latest.
review: Switched to this for a much cleaner, clearer sports flash briefing than ESPN's hyped, rock fare and really liked it until it stopped working several days ago.  I hope someone fixes it soon.

name: NBA
description:
Welcome to the new NBA Alexa Skill! You can interact with me in several ways:

(1) Open me by saying "Alexa, open NBA." You should always start your conversation with me this way.  This will trigger the welcome menu and tell you how to listen to live NBA action, check scores, and get schedule info. 

After you’ve opened the NBA skill…

(2) **To LISTEN TO A GAME**, tell me “Play the Cavs game" or “Stream the Atlanta game."  Most games have the home and away announcers, just say the team name for the announcers you want and we'll start streaming.  If Alexa has trouble recognizing your team name, be sure and use the city AND team name together, like “Houston Rockets.”

(3) To ask about the SCHEDULE, say “What games are on today?” OR “When do the Warriors play?”  Ask about a specific team to get broadcaster information for upcoming games.  

(4) Ask me about SCORES by saying, “What is the score of the Milwaukee Bucks game?” OR “What are the latest scores?"  

Additionally after opening the skill, you can say things to me like:

Who is playing now?
When do the Celtics play the Lakers?
What time are the Memphis Grizzlies on?
Did the Thunder win on Monday?

**You will need to login from the Alexa companion app with a valid NBA League Pass subscription in order to listen to games.  Visit www.nba.com/leaguepass to sign up today.
review: Does not work.

name: Baseball Facts
description: Baseball facts for alexa

name: Cubbies Crib
description:
Are you a huge Chicago Cubs fan? Then you need the Cubbies Crib Flash Briefing Skill by FanSided to get the latest news, opinions and rumors on the Cubs. 

Cubbies Crib is the Chicago Cubs news and opinions site brought to you by the FanSided Network. Cubbies Crib is dedicated to providing top-notch Cubs news, views, and original content. This site also serves as a community for like-minded fans to come together to catch up on the latest news and to discuss their passion.
review: Outstanding flash briefing for everything needed as a Cubs fan.

name: Utah Fishing
description:
Are you headed out the door to your favorite Utah fishing spot and need to know what the fishing is like? Utah Fishing gives you the most up-to-date fishing report including: status, species, and full report!
Open the skill by saying, “Alexa, open Utah Fishing.” Next, simply ask for the specific fishing spot. You can say, “Alexa, what’s the fishing report for Strawberry Reservoir?” Or, without opening the skill, simply ask Alexa for the report all in one command. You can say, “Alexa, ask Utah Fishing for the fishing report at Lake Powell.”
If at any point you need help simply ask Alexa for possible commands by saying, “Alexa help.”
For an interactive fishing reports map visit: https://wildlife.utah.gov/hotspots/
review: Provides you with information on what fish you can catch and where and how to find them.  It's cool.

name: 'We Are' Cheer
description: Alexa leads you in the iconic 'We Are' cheer. She says 'We Are' and you say 'Penn State.' You'll even end with 'Thank you' and 'You're welcome,' just like the real thing.

name: 90-Second Drill
description: This twice-daily podcast is for fans that want the story behind the scores. Dan Schwartzman, noted NBC sports radio host, joins Otto Radio to break the most important stories in the world of sports. When the buzzer sounds, you’re 90 seconds from being in the know.
review: This loops twice when you invoke it. C'mon, man!!

name: Cricket Info
description:
You can ask for brief, detailed or quick score updates. You can ask for score or schedule for any team. Examples, 
“Alexa, ask cricket info to get score update” gets brief score update of all on going matches.
“Alexa, ask cricket info to get team India schedule” gets schedule of team India cricket matches.
"Alexa, ask cricket info to get IPL update" gets score updates for ongoing IPL matches. 
“Alexa, ask cricket info to get quick score update” gets score summary for all ongoing matches, you can optionally request quick score for a team.
“Alexa, ask cricket info to get team Australia detailed score” gets detailed score for ongoing match of team Australia.
review: Awesome! Works like a charm!

name: William Jessup Sports News
description: Without having to traverse the internet, this flash briefing will allow you to get all the new updates from your favorite sports at William Jessup University. The recent news article that is made after every game will be read aloud and users will get their updates within seconds. All sports are featured in this flash briefing, but you may disable ones that you are not interested in. Just make sure to check this flash briefing every week as games and events take place at that time. Just say "Alexa, what is my flash briefing"  or "Alexa, what is in the news?" and all the recent news you missed is a couple words away.
review: Love it!  So easy to get all the sports updates.

name: NCAA March Madness
description:
NCAA March Madness for Alexa delivers real-time tournament scores, schedules, information about your Bracket Picks, and live radio for each game.

Example Phrases:

“Alexa, ask March Madness what games are on right now?”

“Alexa, ask March Madness for today's scores.”

“Alexa, ask March Madness for today's schedule.”

“Alexa, ask March Madness what games can I listen to on the radio?”

“Alexa, ask March Madness for the score of the North Carolina game.”

“Alexa, ask March Madness to play the Duke versus Kentucky game.”

“Alexa, ask March Madness what time the Kansas game starts.”

“Alexa, ask March Madness how my bracket is doing.”

“Alexa, ask March Madness who I picked to win it all.”

“Alexa, ask March Madness which teams I picked today.”

To ask for help or give feedback on this skill please contact mmlivehelp@turner.com

*Note: The live radio feature is currently not supported on Fire TV.

*Note: Must sign-in with a valid Capital One NCAA March Madness Bracket Challenge account in order to get information about your bracket picks.
review: Love the live radio option!

name: LFC News
description: The latest LFC news direct from Liverpool Football Club
comment heading: Great to keep up to date on LFC
review: Minute of LFC news. Perfect for me!

name: Roll Tide Roll
description:
We have always loved Alexa and now we know why... she’s a Crimson Tide fan!
Roll Tide Roll is a perfect game-day addition for your Amazon Device!
Impress your friends, family, & coworkers while showing off that Crimson Tide Pride!

name: Yahoo Fantasy Football
description:
Does your line-up have what it takes? Login and link one of your existing Yahoo Fantasy Football head-to-head leagues to the Alexa Skill to track your team as they make their play for the championship. Competing in multiple Head-2-Head leagues? No problem, just say ‘Change league’ to easily switch to another league. 

Use the Alexa skill to get: 
– an overview of your team’s weekly matchup and score.
– your team’s injury/bye status. 
– player scores and injury updates.
All without ever putting your hands on the ball.

——

NOTE: This skill currently SUPPORTS Head-to-Head fantasy leagues only. It DOES NOT support Points leagues or Pick’Em.
review: I play on two different leagues and she asks which one I want to use. Love love love love this skill! The only thing that would make it better,  if Alexa could fix my roster.

name: cricketSkill
description:
Score Tracker will give the latest scores of matches. Try saying "ask score tracker for update".

You can also add favorite teams, and Alexa will output scores for them first, if they're currently playing.

Currently supports cricket only.

Stay tuned for more features.

name: New England Patriots
description:
Meet the Patriots!

Say “Alexa, open Patriots” to hear daily news updates, discover fun facts, and learn about coming to a game at Gillette Stadium.

You may ask:
What's new with the Patriots?
Play Patriots Radio.
What time is the game?
What is the Patriots schedule?
Tell me a fun fact about the Patriots.
Can bring a blanket to the game?
review: Wow! This is amazing.

name: American Basketball Trivia
description: Alexa asks 5 trivia questions and the user gets scored based on correct answers. The questions range from present, to historical information.

name: FIFA Latest News
description:
Unofficial FIFA news skill for Flash Briefing.

Get the latest news from fifa.com.

Go to Settings in your Alexa app and find “Flash Briefing” to move Vesti FM to the top of your news brief.

This skill was not created or endorsed by FIFA.

name: Golden State Warriors
description: The official Golden State Warriors skill is your guide to every NBA season. Whether you’re looking for a recap of last night’s action, or looking for the Warriors' next game and how to watch it, this skill has you covered. You can also get the latest team headlines, stat leaders for every game, and check the Warriors' current conference standing!

name: SwimmerJoe Show
description: The SwimmerJoe Show is a nationally syndicated weekly show focusing on competitive swimming, coaching, the Olympics, and the swimmer life. Hosted by Chris Emig and Joe Auer, the show regularly interviews college coaches and Olympians and provides tips and practical advice for coaches, parents, and athletes. Watch live every Sunday at 7 PM EST on the Facebook pages of SwimmerJoe, Florida Swim Network, or Swimming World.
comment heading: Great info for swimmers, parents, and coaches!
review: The SwimmerJoe Show has tons of info for swimmers, and especially parents of swimmers! I love the Dressel Drop In where Caeleb Dressel's family talks about being a swim family with 3 All-Amercian swimmers and 1 Olympic gold medalist. Things like, "What do you do when your kid doesn't want to go to swim practice?" are discussed. It's great!

name: Ultimate Sports Quiz
description:
The ultimate sports quiz to really settle those disputes of who knows most from the sporting world. If you can name a sport, there is a good chance there will be a question about it in here!
You will be asked 10 questions, so make sure you are ready for a tough quiz before you get going. There is a mix of difficult and easy questions so anybody can play. Good Luck!
review: Best for British sports fans

name: PGA TOUR
description: We can make it: Keep up to date on the latest scores from every PGA TOUR event throughout the season.  Ask Alexa for the latest leaderboard or get the score of your favorite player.  See more information here: https://www.pgatour.com/products/voiceassistant.html
review: Seems to work fine!!!!

name: Football Facts
description: Some interesting facts about football

name: ESPN Flash Briefing
description:
Want to stay up to date on the latest sports news? From Aaron Rodgers to Zlatan Ibrahimović, your ESPN Flash Briefings bring you the hottest stories in sports, updated throughout the day.
 
Add ESPN to your Flash Briefing, then say "Alexa, what's my Flash Briefing?" to tune in.
review: It used to give you a nice summary that lasted a minute or two, but the skill must have updated because now you sit through several minutes of ads before getting to some pretty useless sports information.

name: NCAA March Madness
description:
NCAA March Madness for Alexa delivers real-time tournament scores, schedules, information about your Bracket Picks, and live radio for each game.

Example Phrases:

“Alexa, ask March Madness what games are on right now?”

“Alexa, ask March Madness for today's scores.”

“Alexa, ask March Madness for today's schedule.”

“Alexa, ask March Madness what games can I listen to on the radio?”

“Alexa, ask March Madness for the score of the North Carolina game.”

*Note: The live radio feature is currently not supported on Fire TV.

*Note: Must sign-in with a valid Capital One NCAA March Madness Bracket Challenge account in order to get information about your bracket picks.
review: Despite our knowing that there was a 3:30 scheduled game for UConn Huskies, Alexa couldn’t find it. Also didn’t recognize terms such as “NCAA tournament.”

name: Big Ten Network Iowa News
description: This flash briefing skill will read you the latest news about The Iowa Hawkeyes.
review: never updated

name: College Football Updates
description:
The College Football News Brief with Lawton Swann is the skill that keeps on giving to college football fans around the country. Not only can you expect hourly news, but when big news breaks in other NCAA sports, we will have that for you as well.

Follow us on Twitter: @CFB_NewsBrief
review: Same old bites every day ans not up to date. Sime of the bites are over a week old.

name: Soccer Facts
description: A quick way to learn interesting tidbits about the game and the history of soccer, or football as it's called outside the United States.

name: NBA Flash Briefing
description: Follow the latest news and game recaps from around the NBA within Alexa's Flash Briefing. After enabling the skill, say things like "Alexa, what's my flash briefing?" Or, "Alexa, what's in the news" to hear your flash briefings. Go to Settings in your Alexa app and find "Flash Briefing" to move NBA Flash Briefing to the top of your news brief.
review: It's great to get my NBA updates on Alexa.

name: Eat Sleep Fantasy
description: If you enjoy fantasy football, you will love this skill!  Everyday, an up to date fact will be presented.  The facts are always relevant and up to date to help you win your fantasy football season.
review: Only thing like it out there. Very cool.

name: Atlanta Running Guide
description:
Atlanta Running Guide is your resource for top places, races, clubs, and training programs in Atlanta. Each category is a top five countdown list.
This skill is optimized for Echo Show.
Please select from the following categories:
- Top Places
- Top Races
- Top Run Clubs
- Top Training Programs

The rankings were determined in survey conducted July 2017 with over 250 responses. Over 88% of survey respondents had 2 years or more of Atlanta running experience.

name: Panthers Fan
description:
Get unofficial to-the-minute stats & fun facts on the Panthers by Fresh Digital Group. This skill isn’t sponsored or endorsed by the Panthers.

Here’s some ways you can use the skill. We have given you many different ways for you to talk to Alexa:



General Updates:


Alexa, ask Panthers Fan how are the Panthers doing? 

Alexa, ask Panthers Fan who do the Panthers play next?

Alexa, ask Panthers Fan Cam Newton (or any player's First name, Last name) touchdown update. 



Fun Facts about the Panthers:


Alexa, ask Panthers Fan to tell me some trivia about the Panthers. 

Alexa, ask Panthers Fan how many Super Bowls have the Panthers won?

name: Overwatch League Standings
description:
New feature: initial support for Echo devices with a display! For example, the Echo Show. Check it out by asking for the "top 3 teams".

New feature: Recent Results. Just say "recent results" to hear the most recent match results!

New feature: Lots of stuff behind the scenes! If a game is live, you’ll get the current score of the match, as well as much more info! Be sure to open the skill often, since the updates will keep on coming!

New feature: Now you can ask: "Alexa, when is the next game?" to find out when the next game will be on, regardless of team. 

New feature: Added game schedule. Now you can find out when your favorite team is playing next! Just say "when are the Los Angeles Gladiators playing next". Note: match times will be in UTC unless you allow the skill to access your device's location (country and postal code only!)

—
Now you can check the current standings of your favorite team (or the whole league), right from your Alexa device. Just ask the rank of your favorite team!
review:
Hello Ginno,

Unfortunately I am not able to reply directly to your review.

The skill works using the invocation name "o.w.l. standings", so you need to say the whole thing (and spell out the 3 letters in O-W-L) to access the skill.

So written slightly different, you can try "ask O-W-L standings when is the next game" or simply "open O-W-L standings" would work as well.

name: Utes Football Alumni Briefing
description: Want to hear all the ins and out of Utah football through the perspective of athletes who have been there and experienced it? This is the flash briefing for you! We break down upcoming matchups, players to watch and tell stories of the good old days. All from players you know and love! Join us each week to hear what we think you should look out for in the upcoming game, recap highlights and reminiscence about past rivalries and matchups few could ever forget. Join the Utes Football Briefing.
review: Super clear and double sided!!!👍👍👍

name: Flash Briefing Chile
description: News headlines from cooperativa radio in chile
review: no esta en Español

name: Sports Hub Flash Briefing
description: Get the latest sports headlines covering the New England Patriots, Boston Bruins, Boston Celtics, Boston Red Sox, and the New England Revolution, as well as national sports stories from Boston's Home for Sports, 98.5 The Sports Hub.
review: The skill plays a playlist of headlines from latest to oldest when it should just play the latest one.

name: Baseball Reference
description:
Welcome to the Baseball Reference Alexa application. This application makes finding out leaders in certain statistics as easy as just asking. As of right now this app can only return top ranking and you cannot make request by specific players or team statistics.

Users are able to request a multitude of different statistics that can be further specified by rank (1-10), top amount (top two, top three, top four, etc.) year (1871 - present), and league (All of Baseball, National League or American League). 

Here are some initial example requests:
-------------------------------------------
Alexa, ask Baseball Reference who is third in the National League in home runs.

Who leads the league in doubles?

Who lead the American League in wins in nineteen eighty six?

Who is the oldest player in the league?

Alexa, ask Baseball Reference, in nineteen ninety nine, who lead the league in home runs?

Who was top three in strikeouts?

Who was tenth in wins in the National League in nineteen seventy two
-------------------------------------------

Another feature available to users is that after a user makes a successful request and are prompted to ask another question, a user can build upon their previous request.


For Example:
-------------------------------------------
User Requests - "Alexa, ask Baseball Reference who was second in the National League in hits in nineteen eighty three"

Alexa Responds - "Rafael Ramirez was second in the National League with 185 Hits in 1983."

The user can now request a few things:

- Next -
User Requests - "Who was next?"
Alexa Responds -  "Al Oliver was third in the National League with 184 Hits in 1983."

- Previous -
User Requests - "Who was previous?"
Alexa Responds -  "Jose Cruz and Andre Dawson were tied for first in the National League with 189 Hits In 1983 ."

- Rank -
User Requests - "Who was sixth?"
Alexa Responds -  "Dickie Thon was sixth in the National League with 177 Hits In 1983."

- Top -
User Requests - "Who was top three?"
Alexa Responds -  "Jose Cruz and Andre Dawson were tied for first in the National League with 189 Hits In 1983. Rafael Ramirez was second in the National League with 185 Hits In 1983. Al Oliver was third in the National League with 184 Hits In 1983."
-------------------------------------------

Statistics To Request
-----------------------
// Hitting
Singles
Doubles
Triples
Home runs
RBIs
Runs
Stolen bases
Caught stealing
Batting average
Hits
Wins above replacement
Slugging percentage
Extra base hits
Total bases
On base percentage
Walks
Intentional walks
Sacrifice flies
At bats per home run
Grounded into double plays

// Pitching
Earned Run Average
Strikeouts
Strikes per walk
Strikeouts per nine innings
WHIP
Wins
Shutouts
Saves
Innings Pitches

//Misc
Oldest Player
Youngest Player

If you have any questions or comments regarding this application please feel free to reach out to us at ottomanellibaseball@gmail.com.
comment heading: Not bad , but could be improved.
review: It's ok.  Could not tell me the 1988 American or National League MVP.  also, could not tell me who threw no hitters in 2016. Does do pretty well on individual statistics per season.

name: Activity Tracker
description:
Keep up with your activities on Strava. 
To use this skill you must have an Strava account. To sign up for an account go to https://www.strava.com.

Supported commands:

Alexa, Ask Activity Tracker .....

• about my last run
Detailed information about your last run

• about my last ride
Detailed information about your last bike ride

• about my total stats
The number of times and distance you've completed in the last month

• to get my achievements
Get the number of your recent achievement
comment heading: Nice skill for strava status check
review:
Great skill with some suggestions.
When i start the activity tracker, i am looking to ask multiple questions, but it exists after answering one question.
Can i ask more questions like what are my challenges, what are my personal record for full marathon etc.

name: Yahoo Fantasy Football
description:
Does your line-up have what it takes? Login and link one of your existing Yahoo Fantasy Football head-to-head leagues to the Alexa Skill to track your team as they make their play for the championship. Competing in multiple Head-2-Head leagues? No problem, just say ‘Change league’ to easily switch to another league. 

Use the Alexa skill to get: 
– an overview of your team’s weekly matchup and score.
– your team’s injury/bye status. 
– player scores and injury updates.
All without ever putting your hands on the ball.

——

NOTE: This skill currently SUPPORTS Head-to-Head fantasy leagues only. It DOES NOT support Points leagues or Pick’Em.
comment heading: Doesn't work at all for me
review: Won't activate when saying "ask yahoo fantasy football about" and any modifier. Have unlinked and relinked multiple times

skills-rest: The Rookie's Guide to the NFL
name: The Rookie's Guide to the NFL
description:
The Rookie's Guide to the NFL is your official way to learn about the National Football League. Become an expert by asking about the rules, penalties, scoring plays, commentator lingo, previous Super Bowls, team formations, and more.

After enabling the skill, say 'Open NFL' or 'Launch NFL' to use The Rookie's Guide.

Once you've opened the skill, you can say things like:
-What is defensive pass interference?
-How many players are on a team?
-Who won Super Bowl 35?
-What's the difference between a running back and a wide receiver?
-Tell me about the Music City Miracle
-How tall is Aaron Rodgers?
-What does ‘move the chains’ mean?
Or, just say 'Surprise me' to hear a new definition

If you get stuck within the skill, say 'Alexa, what does this skill do?' to hear more options.
review: Very cool new feature by the NFL and Amazon! Super innovative and easy to use. I’ve watched football my entire life, and I’m learning new things. Highly recommend for fans of all levels.

name: Tom Brady Facts
description: Tom Brady Facts is a must for any football fan. You think you know Tom Brady? Prove it. This one goes deep. Test yourself or your friends' knowledge of this NFL superstar who just very well may be the Greatest of All Time (G.O.A.T).
review: Brady is good#🏈🏈brady

name: Oakdale High School Sports Update
description: This skill will read an Oakdale High School weekly sports re-cap.  It's content is dynamic and comes from http://www.fcps.org/athletics/oakdale-high as well as input and information provided by the OHS coaching staff.
review: I used to live in Oakdale - not exactly a tech capital of the Central Valley. Cool to see the high school doing this ahead of so many others. Nice job, Oakdale!

name: Hockey Updates
description:
Hockey Updates provides live score and audio updates for NHL games. Hockey Updates will let you know when the puck drops, a penalty is incurred or a goal scored.

To use Hockey Updates ask Alexa to open the skill.

'Alexa, open Hockey Updates'

Tell Alexa which game you'd like to follow.

'The Canadiens'

If you'd like live audio updates, just say yes!

'Yes'

You'll hear the faint sound of a hockey practice to let you know that Hockey Updates is running. Once the game starts you'll hear regular updates, live from the rink.

To stop Hockey Updates, ask Alexa to cancel or stop at any time.

'Alexa, stop'
review:
Tried this skill tonight for the Capitals game.  The real time updates are great.  Interested mostly in penalties and scores.
For me, it would be better for a quiet background, and only have Alexa come on to make the announcements.  In order to hear the updates, the volume needs to be pretty high, and the hockey noises are distracting.  Also, please consider announcing the updates twice.  By the time the voice comes on to say what’s happening, it’s easy to miss what’s happening.  :}

name: Baseball Live
description:
Find more information than the built-in MLB functions.

-See who is pitching or batting for your team
    - Ex: "Ask Baseball Live who is pitching for The Phillies"
-See what is currently happening in your team's game
    - Ex: "Ask Baseball Live what's the score of The Phillies game"
-See what play just happened in your team's game
    - Ex: "Ask Baseball Live what's happening in The Phillies game"
    - Ex: "Ask Baseball Live what just happened in The Phillies game"
-Check the standings
    - Ex: "Ask Baseball Live how many games back are The Mets"
-See the lines score
    - Ex: "Ask Baseball Live for the line score of The Phillies game"

Pro Version
-Get a team briefing including the score of the game, the standings in the division/wild card, and updates on the teams relevant in the standings
review: Same here. No info for starting pitchers...

name: Football Crime
description:
DISCLAIMER: This skill may not be suitable for all ages.

Impress your friends with random Football players' crime records! The Football Crime skill picks a random crime from the NFL Arrest database and shares it with you. Alexa will speak the information out loud and put a card in your Alexa app for your reference, so you can show your friends or just recall interesting records later.

To get started, simply say:

"Alexa, ask Football Crime for a random crime."

NOTE: This skill is in no way affiliated with or endorsed by the NFL.
review: Love it!!

name: Marshawn Lynch's BeastMode
description:
The BeastMode Skill is a fun and informative skill. This skill allows you to say things like: 

Press Conference Questions

Alexa, Ask BeastMode... 

how was that defense?
how was the game?
what are you going to do after the game?
how are you feeling?
what's next for you?

You can also ask for facts about Marshawn:

For more information visit us at http://beastmodeonline.com
comment heading: He's just here so he won't get fined
review: And he's all bout that action boss

name: Basketball Coaching Advice
description: This will deliver advice to help with coaching basketball at all levels. Advice ranges from drills to run all the way to philosophy on coaching.

name: UC Irvine Athletics
description:
UC Irvine Athletics for Alexa can keep you up to date with the Anteaters. Let Alexa update you with the latest news from the Anteaters, including game results, team news, and schedules.

For more information, visit ucirvinesports.com/alexa or tweet us at @UCIAthletics.
comment heading: On a crisp Southern California afternoon in my office overlooking ...
review: On a crisp Southern California afternoon in my office overlooking the vast landscape of Orange County leading off to the Sierra Nevadas in the distance. I stood by my window deep in thought as the sun continued it's descent toward the horizon. Then the thought struck me, "When do my Anteaters have their next baseball game?". I turned to Alexa and within a matter of seconds she had me fully updated on all the UCI baseball details I desired.

name: Tom Brady Facts
description: Tom Brady Facts is a must for any football fan. You think you know Tom Brady? Prove it. This one goes deep. Test yourself or your friends' knowledge of this NFL superstar who just very well may be the Greatest of All Time (G.O.A.T).
review: Good stuff right here

name: StatMuse
description:
StatMuse lets you explore sports statistics, schedules and scores in a whole new way, straight from your favorite players and personalities. Say "Alexa, ask StatMuse who has the most career receiving yards?" and hear Jerry Rice tell you about his record. Then try "Who had the most touchdowns last season?" to hear from David Johnson. Ask "When are the Falcons playing next?" to have Devonta Freeman give you his game schedule.



StatMuse provides instant answers to your NBA, NFL, MLB & NHL questions and features the authentic voices of Peyton Manning, Le'Veon Bell, Drew Brees, Terrell Owens, Jerry Rice and other players, plus Scott Van Pelt and Joe Buck. StatMuse is the officially licensed AI of the NFL Players Association.

Start by asking:
"Alexa, open Statmuse…"

“How did the Eagles do?”
"Who had the most passing yards in a season?"
After hearing Drew Brees answer, ask "Where did you go to college?" or "How many touchdowns did you have last season?"

"Who won the World Series in 1945?"
"Which pitcher had the most strikeouts last year?"
After hearing the answer, ask "What is his career ERA?"

"How did Steph Curry do last season?"
“Who do the Rockets play this week?”

“What hockey games are on tonight?”
“Tell me about the Golden Knights.”
StatMuse has comprehensive stats going back to 1947 for the NBA, 1920 for the NFL, 1876 for MLB and 1917 for the NHL.

comment heading: Head and Shoulders Above the Others
review: Fantastic!  This sports app makes most of the others seem amateurish!  This is what the future looks like for gleening sports statistics!  Highly recommended!

name: Montreal Canadiens Trivia
description: This Montreal Canadiens Hockey Trivia Game contains tons of questions with multiple choice answers that you can pick from. The game will ask 5 questions and keep track of how many you answer correctly.

name: NBC Sports Update
description:
The NBC Sports Update brings you national sports news, every hour, 24/7. 

Add the NBC Sports Update to your Flash Briefing and move it to the top of your news by going to Settings in the Alexa app. You can manage your Flash Briefing under Account. After adding the NBC Sports Update, you can say “Alexa, what’s my Flash Briefing?” or “Alexa, what’s in the news?” to hear the latest.
comment heading: A must have skill for any sports lover
review: Best sports reviews on the planet I listen everyday!

name: StatMuse
description:
StatMuse lets you explore sports statistics, schedules and scores in a whole new way, straight from your favorite players and personalities. Say "Alexa, ask StatMuse who has the most career receiving yards?" and hear Jerry Rice tell you about his record. Then try "Who had the most touchdowns last season?" to hear from David Johnson. Ask "When are the Falcons playing next?" to have Devonta Freeman give you his game schedule.



StatMuse provides instant answers to your NBA, NFL, MLB & NHL questions and features the authentic voices of Peyton Manning, Le'Veon Bell, Drew Brees, Terrell Owens, Jerry Rice and other players, plus Scott Van Pelt and Joe Buck. StatMuse is the officially licensed AI of the NFL Players Association.

Start by asking:
"Alexa, open Statmuse…"

“How did the Eagles do?”
"Who had the most passing yards in a season?"
After hearing Drew Brees answer, ask "Where did you go to college?" or "How many touchdowns did you have last season?"

"Who won the World Series in 1945?"
"Which pitcher had the most strikeouts last year?"
After hearing the answer, ask "What is his career ERA?"

"How did Steph Curry do last season?"
“Who do the Rockets play this week?”

“What hockey games are on tonight?”
“Tell me about the Golden Knights.”
StatMuse has comprehensive stats going back to 1947 for the NBA, 1920 for the NFL, 1876 for MLB and 1917 for the NHL.

Here are just a few of the stats now available to you, instantly: https://www.statmuse.com/getting-started/examples

name: Cricket Info
description:
You can ask for brief, detailed or quick score updates. You can ask for score or schedule for any team. Examples,

"Alexa, ask cricket info to get IPL update" gets score updates for ongoing IPL matches.

“Alexa, ask cricket info to get team Australia detailed score” gets detailed score for ongoing match of team Australia.
comment heading: This is a great skill to add to Alexa

name: Baseball Reference
description:
Welcome to the Baseball Reference Alexa application. This application makes finding out leaders in certain statistics as easy as just asking. As of right now this app can only return top ranking and you cannot make request by specific players or team statistics.

Users are able to request a multitude of different statistics that can be further specified by rank (1-10), top amount (top two, top three, top four, etc.) year (1871 - present), and league (All of Baseball, National League or American League). 

Here are some initial example requests:
-------------------------------------------
Alexa, ask Baseball Reference who is third in the National League in home runs.

Who leads the league in doubles?

Who lead the American League in wins in nineteen eighty six?

Who is the oldest player in the league?

Alexa, ask Baseball Reference, in nineteen ninety nine, who lead the league in home runs?

Who was top three in strikeouts?

Who was tenth in wins in the National League in nineteen seventy two
-------------------------------------------

Another feature available to users is that after a user makes a successful request and are prompted to ask another question, a user can build upon their previous request.


For Example:
-------------------------------------------
User Requests - "Alexa, ask Baseball Reference who was second in the National League in hits in nineteen eighty three"

Alexa Responds - "Rafael Ramirez was second in the National League with 185 Hits in 1983."

The user can now request a few things:

- Next -
User Requests - "Who was next?"
Alexa Responds -  "Al Oliver was third in the National League with 184 Hits in 1983."

- Previous -
User Requests - "Who was previous?"
Alexa Responds -  "Jose Cruz and Andre Dawson were tied for first in the National League with 189 Hits In 1983 ."

- Rank -
User Requests - "Who was sixth?"
Alexa Responds -  "Dickie Thon was sixth in the National League with 177 Hits In 1983."

- Top -
User Requests - "Who was top three?"
Alexa Responds -  "Jose Cruz and Andre Dawson were tied for first in the National League with 189 Hits In 1983. Rafael Ramirez was second in the National League with 185 Hits In 1983. Al Oliver was third in the National League with 184 Hits In 1983."
-------------------------------------------

Statistics To Request
-----------------------
// Hitting
Singles
Doubles
Triples
Home runs
RBIs
Runs
Stolen bases
Caught stealing
Batting average
Hits
Wins above replacement
Slugging percentage
Extra base hits
Total bases
On base percentage
Walks
Intentional walks
Sacrifice flies
At bats per home run
Grounded into double plays

// Pitching
Earned Run Average
Strikeouts
Strikes per walk
Strikeouts per nine innings
WHIP
Wins
Shutouts
Saves
Innings Pitches

//Misc
Oldest Player
Youngest Player

If you have any questions or comments regarding this application please feel free to reach out to us at ottomanellibaseball@gmail.com.
review:
This app easily allows anyone to find the top rankings in a variety of different statisticss.

I can quickly and easily find leaders from every year in baseball!

As an avid fan of the game this really helps me stay ontop of who is doing what around the league.

name: Running Outfit Advisor
description:
The Running Outfit Advisor provides running apparel recommendations based on current weather conditions in your area or based on your inputs. Choosing current weather conditions may prompt you to enable location permissions in your Alexa app. 
Our exclusive apparel algorithm provides personalized apparel recommendations based on weather conditions and gender.

If you choose apparel advice based current weather conditions, Alexa will pull temperature, humidity, wind speed, and other weather conditions based on your zip code. Alexa will prompt you for your gender and create a personalized recommendation based on our exclusive apparel algorithm.

If you select running outfit advice based on your inputs, Alexa will ask you for your gender, temperature, weather conditions (sunny, windy, cloudy, or raining), and your run intensity (easy run, or race) and create a personalized recommendation based on our exclusive apparel algorithm. Feel free to adjust based on your personal preference. This is only intended to be a guide.

name: NHL
description:
The Official NHL Skill is the best way for hockey fans using Alexa to get detailed information on NHL scores, schedules, standings and current players.

Open the skill by saying, “Alexa, open NHL.”

To check scores, you can ask Alexa questions such as “Ask NHL, what is the score of the Red Wings game?”  You can ask for game previews and recaps as well as real-time updates during every NHL game.

To get team schedules, you can ask Alexa questions such as “Ask NHL, when is the next Sharks game?” or “Who do the Maple Leafs play tomorrow?

You can also ask for biographical and statistical information on every current NHL player.
 
To set reminders 30 minutes before the start of your favorite team’s game, “Ask NHL, reminders”  

The Official NHL Skill is available on the Echo Dot, Echo Spot, Echo Show, Fire TV and all Alexa enabled devices 

Created by the National Hockey League

comment heading: Very cool skill for this Ft
review: Very cool skill for this Ft. Collins mountain biker. I love that I can easily check if there are any closures before heading out.

description: The official skill of the San Francisco 49ers. Hear all of the latest news and updates about the 49ers directly from the coaches, players, and executives. Just enable the skill and tell Alexa "give me 49ers update in 30sec.

name: Game Lines
description:
Grabs up to date spreads and over/under odds for upcoming NFL, NBA, and NCAA Division 1 games. 

Ask game lines for a team name, followed optionally by what sport you want to know about.

For example, "Alexa, ask game lines for the West Virginia college basketball game."

Odds are provided by http://www.betonline.ag and made available shortly after they are posted on their website.
review: Awesome

This skill was created using a Skill Blueprint. Your requests to this skill are not shared with the skill developer.

Do you love football?  Do you think you know all about the Gridiron?

name: NHL
description:
The Official NHL Skill is the best way for hockey fans using Alexa to get detailed information on NHL scores, schedules, standings and current players.

Open the skill by saying, “Alexa, open NHL.”

To check scores, you can ask Alexa questions such as “Ask NHL, what is the score of the Red Wings game?”  You can ask for game previews and recaps as well as real-time updates during every NHL game.

To get team schedules, you can ask Alexa questions such as “Ask NHL, when is the next Sharks game?” or “Who do the Maple Leafs play tomorrow?

You can also ask for biographical and statistical information on every current NHL player.
 
To set reminders 30 minutes before the start of your favorite team’s game, “Ask NHL, reminders”  

The Official NHL Skill is available on the Echo Dot, Echo Spot, Echo Show, Fire TV and all Alexa enabled devices 

Created by the National Hockey League

name: OH - IO
description:
Show off your Buckeye pride! 
When you say "OH" Alexa says "IO"!

review: I am a Michigan fan and I wholeheartedly love this skill

description:
"Alexa, bleed purple"

Grilled Cheese Thursday.  The Quad.  21-16   The smell of dog food when it rains.  Gingerbread House.  D-Hall.  The Breeze. JMaddy.  You bleed purple and gold.
review: Great fight song but couldn't get her to "Bleed Purple"!

name: NCAA March Madness
description:
NCAA March Madness for Alexa delivers real-time tournament scores, schedules, information about your Bracket Picks, and live radio for each game.

Example Phrases:

“Alexa, ask March Madness what games are on right now?”

“Alexa, ask March Madness for today's scores.”

“Alexa, ask March Madness for today's schedule.”

“Alexa, ask March Madness what games can I listen to on the radio?”

“Alexa, ask March Madness for the score of the North Carolina game.”

“Alexa, ask March Madness to play the Duke versus Kentucky game.”

“Alexa, ask March Madness what time the Kansas game starts.”

“Alexa, ask March Madness how my bracket is doing.”

“Alexa, ask March Madness who I picked to win it all.”

“Alexa, ask March Madness which teams I picked today.”

To ask for help or give feedback on this skill please contact mmlivehelp@turner.com

*Note: The live radio feature is currently not supported on Fire TV.

*Note: Must sign-in with a valid Capital One NCAA March Madness Bracket Challenge account in order to get information about your bracket picks.
comment heading: The app works well if you ask it for what ...
review: The app works well if you ask it for what you want the correct way.  Unfortunately it’s not that intuitive.  I had to go on line to get it right from the website.

name: ESPN
description:
Get your sports radio fix with the ESPN skill. From Mike and Mike to Dan Le Batard and Stu Gotz, this skill brings you live ESPN Radio, several ESPN affiliate stations, and hourly news updates.  

Say, "Tell me the news," "Play the radio," or ask for your local ESPN radio station to access the best in sports radio content.

Supported radio stations include:
- ESPN Radio
- ESPN Deportes Radio
- ESPN Chicago (WMVP 1000 AM)
- ESPN Los Angeles (KSPN 710 AM)
- ESPN New York (WEPN 98.7 FM)
- ESPN Deportes New York (WEPN 1050 AM)
comment heading: Awesome comes in very handy gives me exactly what i need without surfing the tv or web.

They seem to have adjusted the volume.
The content is their regular sport center radio update. Overall pretty good for a flash briefing.

description: Get daily breaking news, rumors, schedules, stats, scores and more on Pittsburgh's NFL team, all from PennLive.com, Pennsylvania's leading online news source. Hosted by John Luciew.
review: The information could be given in half the time. While the delivery is better than being monotone, its a bit over the top.

name: Yanks go Yard
description:
Get the latest Yankees news from FanSided's Yanks go Yard, your home for all things New York Yankees.

Yanks Go Yard is dedicated to providing top-notch Yankees news, views, and original content. This site also serves as a community for like-minded fans to come together to catch up on the latest news and to discuss their passion.

name: Arsenal
description:
Get the most out of every match day with Arsenal FC’s official skill. With full support for pre-match build-up, live commentary and post-match analysis you can keep up to date with all the action. 
 
To get started, simply say "Alexa, open Arsenal."
 
Options include: 

Pre Match:
“Alexa, ask Arsenal for the match preview.” - receive an overview of the upcoming match.
“Alexa, ask Arsenal who’s injured?” - find out who is injured.
“Alexa, ask Arsenal for the team lineup.” - available approximately one hour before kick-off.
“Alexa, ask Arsenal for the pre-match build up.” - listen to the official pre-match commentary, available around 30 minutes before kick-off.

During Match:
“Alexa, ask Arsenal for the live commentary.” - listen to the official match commentary, available during a game.
“Alexa, ask Arsenal for the match summary.” - find out the score, bookings, injuries and substitutions.
“Alexa, ask Arsenal for the score.” - learn how we’re getting on in-play.

Post Match:
“Alexa, ask Arsenal for the post match analysis.” - listen to the official post-match commentary, available for around 30 minutes after the final whistle. 
“Alexa, ask Arsenal for the match report.” - hear the official Arsenal opinion of the game.

name: My BQ
description: Looking to run for the Boston Marathon? My BQ lets you find the qualifying time needed in order to gain entry into the most prestigious marathon around.
review: quickly access specific boston marathon qualifying criteria by age and sex .

name: My Bridge Radio
description:
My Bridge Radio is a skill to help you play the internet stream of Nebraska's local Christian radio network. 

You can say:

"Alexa, play My Bridge Radio"
"Alexa, open My Bridge Radio"
"Alexa, start My Bridge Radio"
"Alexa, launch My Bridge Radio"

Please send us an email with your suggestions at email@mybridgeradio.net
review: So thankful to be able to hear My Bridge Christian radio over Alexa! Thank you for making it possible! I appreciate being able to hear christian radio and talk locally and whatever room I'm in now, thanks to Alexa!

name: Baseball Live
description:
Find more information than the built-in MLB functions.

-See who is pitching or batting for your team
    - Ex: "Ask Baseball Live who is pitching for The Phillies"
-See what is currently happening in your team's game
    - Ex: "Ask Baseball Live what's the score of The Phillies game"
-See what play just happened in your team's game
    - Ex: "Ask Baseball Live what's happening in The Phillies game"
    - Ex: "Ask Baseball Live what just happened in The Phillies game"
-Check the standings
    - Ex: "Ask Baseball Live how many games back are The Mets"
-See the lines score
    - Ex: "Ask Baseball Live for the line score of The Phillies game"

Pro Version
-Get a team briefing including the score of the game, the standings in the division/wild card, and updates on the teams relevant in the standings
review: App tells nothing about who's pitching at all just inning updates.

name: Prime Light Meditation
description:
Prime Light Meditation is a 20 minutes guided meditation narrated by "Jesse Elder" for the exclusive use of his private "Legacy Community" members.  This skill provides a convenient way for Legacy members to listen to the guided meditation without having to physically interact with other playback devices and to have a less distracted and more natural enjoyable experience.

To get started with the skill, you can say:

"Alexa, open Prime Light Meditation"
"Alexa, start Prime Light Meditation"
"Alexa, launch Prime Light Meditation"

Please leave a 5-star review if you love this skill, or send us an email with your suggestions at feedback@aialchemy.com. Your 5-star reviews encourage us to keep making more great skills, thanks!

This skill is inspired by the teachings of "Jesse Elder" and is created by "Amir Harouni" in deep appreciation and the desire to further the reach of Jesse's teachings.
review: Prime Light Meditation is AMAZING , just LOVE it

Zen Garden by Sound Healing Center

Please leave a 5-star review if you love this skill, or send us an email with your suggestions at ReikiAwakening.com. Your 5-star reviews encourage us to keep making more great skills, thanks!

name: Browns Fan
description:
Get unofficial to-the-minute stats & fun facts on the Browns by Fresh Digital Group. This skill isn’t sponsored or endorsed by the Browns.

Here’s some ways you can use the skill. We have given you many different ways for you to talk to Alexa:



General Updates:


Alexa, ask Browns Fan how are the Browns doing? 

Alexa, ask Browns Fan who do the Browns play next?

Alexa, ask Browns Fan Joe Thomas (or any player's First name, Last name) touchdown update. 



Fun Facts about the Browns:


Alexa, ask Browns Fan to tell me some trivia about the Browns. 

Alexa, ask Browns Fan how many Super Bowls have the Browns won?
review: This is not ready for prime time. Can't answer any questions.

name: StatMuse
description:
StatMuse lets you explore sports statistics, schedules and scores in a whole new way, straight from your favorite players and personalities. Say "Alexa, ask StatMuse who has the most career receiving yards?" and hear Jerry Rice tell you about his record. Then try "Who had the most touchdowns last season?" to hear from David Johnson. Ask "When are the Falcons playing next?" to have Devonta Freeman give you his game schedule.



StatMuse provides instant answers to your NBA, NFL, MLB & NHL questions and features the authentic voices of Peyton Manning, Le'Veon Bell, Drew Brees, Terrell Owens, Jerry Rice and other players, plus Scott Van Pelt and Joe Buck. StatMuse is the officially licensed AI of the NFL Players Association.

Start by asking:
"Alexa, open Statmuse…"

“How did the Eagles do?”
"Who had the most passing yards in a season?"
After hearing Drew Brees answer, ask "Where did you go to college?" or "How many touchdowns did you have last season?"

"Who won the World Series in 1945?"
"Which pitcher had the most strikeouts last year?"
After hearing the answer, ask "What is his career ERA?"

"How did Steph Curry do last season?"
“Who do the Rockets play this week?”

“What hockey games are on tonight?”
“Tell me about the Golden Knights.”
StatMuse has comprehensive stats going back to 1947 for the NBA, 1920 for the NFL, 1876 for MLB and 1917 for the NHL.

Here are just a few of the stats now available to you, instantly: https://www.statmuse.com/getting-started/examples
review: Good app, would be 5 stars if there wasn't Joe Buck talking on it

name: WV MetroNews Sports Briefing

Also does not update from Saturday morning until Monday, so it previews a WVU game that has already been played all weekend.

name: Baseball Trivia
description: This is a trivia game that quizzes your knowledge about the Boston Baseball history.  Simple to use, listen to the question and if you need to repeat the question, say repeat question or repeat.  There are four choices, listen for all four answers and then answer 1,2,3,or 4.  Suggestions, comments and critiques are welcome.

name: College Football Roster Info

Simply ask Alexa about players by using their full name, last name, or number and their team and she will tell you key information about them like their height, weight, class and hometown. 
Note: information is current as of the start of the season, if you find numbers have changed let me know as the teams sometimes shuffle those in the first week or so.

name: ADVrider.com (Unofficial) Dakar 2019 News
description:
The Dakar Rally is an annual rally raid organised by the Amaury Sport Organisation. Most events since the inception in 1978 were from Paris, France, to Dakar, Senegal, but due to security threats in Mauritania, which led to the cancellation of the 2008 rally, races since 2009 have been held in South America.

The 2019 Rally runs from 6 January 2019 -  17 January 2019. It covers 5,000 km of racing over 10 stages. 

ADVrider.com has been the internet's number one resource for adventure motorcycling on the internet for over a decade. Our team in South America is following the rally on the ground.

Subscribe to get the latest Dakar news and stage results.

name: Cricket Info
description:
You can ask for brief, detailed or quick score updates. You can ask for score or schedule for any team. Examples, 
“Alexa, ask cricket info to get score update” gets brief score update of all on going matches.
“Alexa, ask cricket info to get team India schedule” gets schedule of team India cricket matches.
"Alexa, ask cricket info to get IPL update" gets score updates for ongoing IPL matches. 
“Alexa, ask cricket info to get quick score update” gets score summary for all ongoing matches, you can optionally request quick score for a team.
“Alexa, ask cricket info to get team Australia detailed score” gets detailed score for ongoing match of team Australia.
review: If you are looking for quick cricket scores thru Alexa then look no further this is the one! I tried few others did not work as great as this one.

name: VSIN
description:
Welcome to this new Alexa Skill from the Vegas Stats & Information Network. VSiN is a sports betting news network broadcasting 24-7 on VSiN.com and SiriusXM 204. 

This skill provides you with the latest sports betting lines for today’s games from the oddsmakers at the South Point sports book in Las Vegas.

Here is how to interact with Alexa:

>>Always begin by saying "Alexa, ask Vegas Stats" You should always start your conversation with me this way.

>>To get the line for a specific game, say “Alexa, ask Vegas Stats for the line on the [city and team name] game.

Alexa will answer with the appropriate betting lines based on the sports provided: pro and college basketball, hockey, baseball and pro and college football.

The betting lines could include the point spread, the money line and the total depending on the sport

name: New England Patriots

name: Coach Harbaugh
description:
Need to get fired up? Of course you don't - you are already attacking today with an enthusiasm unknown to mankind. But how about having your own personal Jim Harbaugh to entertain you on game day? Or on Mondays. Or every single morning while you wash down your steak breakfast with whole milk. 

You can say:
1. Alexa, ask Coach Harbaugh for a quote
2. Alexa, ask Coach Harbaugh to play "The Victors"
3. Alexa, ask Coach Harbaugh WHO'S GOT IT BETTER THAN US!?

Please note that this skill is not affiliated with the University of Michigan in any way. I'm just a fan with the constitutional right to share Jim Harbaugh's wisdom with you.

Special thanks to Sibish Basheer for making this possible.

name: NBA
description:
Welcome to the new NBA Alexa Skill! You can interact with me in several ways:

(1) Open me by saying "Alexa, open NBA." You should always start your conversation with me this way.  This will trigger the welcome menu and tell you how to listen to live NBA action, check scores, and get schedule info. 

After you’ve opened the NBA skill…

(2) **To LISTEN TO A GAME**, tell me “Play the Cavs game" or “Stream the Atlanta game."  Most games have the home and away announcers, just say the team name for the announcers you want and we'll start streaming.  If Alexa has trouble recognizing your team name, be sure and use the city AND team name together, like “Houston Rockets.”

(3) To ask about the SCHEDULE, say “What games are on today?” OR “When do the Warriors play?”  Ask about a specific team to get broadcaster information for upcoming games.  

(4) Ask me about SCORES by saying, “What is the score of the Milwaukee Bucks game?” OR “What are the latest scores?"  

Additionally after opening the skill, you can say things to me like:

Who is playing now?
When do the Celtics play the Lakers?
What time are the Memphis Grizzlies on?
Did the Thunder win on Monday?

**You will need to login from the Alexa companion app with a valid NBA League Pass subscription in order to listen to games.  Visit www.nba.com/leaguepass to sign up today.

name: Jammin' Jon's Wrestling News.
description: Need your daily dose of what's going on in the WWE, TNA, ROH, NJPW, and the Indies? Don't want to check the dirtsheets? Leave it up to Jammin' Jon! He will provide you every single day with the latest news in Professional Wrestling. Don't miss out on this! It's better than a bodyslam!
review: I WAS enjoying this app and tolerated all the frequent and lengthy (often longer than the actual news portion) non-wrestling commentary, about everything other than wrestling. But I've finally reached my threshold. The final straw came when Jon detailed all the information relating to his wisdom tooth ordeal. I'm really sympathetic and I'm glad everything worked out in the end, but a program about wrestling news isn't the place for a looong, detailed description about an infection complete with descriptive visuals (ie "puss"). I listen to my Echo news briefings in the AM while eating breakfast. No one wants to hear about puss and infection while eating. No thanks. If you want wrestling news in a nice condensed format on your Echo, look elsewhere.

review: Alexa is confused even by the name of the skill. She insists there is no March Madness available. After arguing with her for some time, Alexa finally concedes. Win for me! At last a live game begins playing. I try to switch between games, and Alexa decides there are no other games. I beg. I plead. She becomes stubborn and opts for music instead. I immediately demand March Madness. With evil in her voice, Alexa taunts me, saying there is no such skill.  We begin the process all over again...Yes, I've discovered the true meaning of March Madness!?!

name: Baseball Reference
description:
Welcome to the Baseball Reference Alexa application. This application makes finding out leaders in certain statistics as easy as just asking. As of right now this app can only return top ranking and you cannot make request by specific players or team statistics.

Users are able to request a multitude of different statistics that can be further specified by rank (1-10), top amount (top two, top three, top four, etc.) year (1871 - present), and league (All of Baseball, National League or American League). 

Here are some initial example requests:
-------------------------------------------
Alexa, ask Baseball Reference who is third in the National League in home runs.

Who leads the league in doubles?

Who lead the American League in wins in nineteen eighty six?

Who is the oldest player in the league?

Alexa, ask Baseball Reference, in nineteen ninety nine, who lead the league in home runs?

Who was top three in strikeouts?

Who was tenth in wins in the National League in nineteen seventy two
-------------------------------------------

Another feature available to users is that after a user makes a successful request and are prompted to ask another question, a user can build upon their previous request.


For Example:
-------------------------------------------
User Requests - "Alexa, ask Baseball Reference who was second in the National League in hits in nineteen eighty three"

Alexa Responds - "Rafael Ramirez was second in the National League with 185 Hits in 1983."

The user can now request a few things:

- Next -
User Requests - "Who was next?"
Alexa Responds -  "Al Oliver was third in the National League with 184 Hits in 1983."

- Previous -
User Requests - "Who was previous?"
Alexa Responds -  "Jose Cruz and Andre Dawson were tied for first in the National League with 189 Hits In 1983 ."

- Rank -
User Requests - "Who was sixth?"
Alexa Responds -  "Dickie Thon was sixth in the National League with 177 Hits In 1983."

- Top -
User Requests - "Who was top three?"
Alexa Responds -  "Jose Cruz and Andre Dawson were tied for first in the National League with 189 Hits In 1983. Rafael Ramirez was second in the National League with 185 Hits In 1983. Al Oliver was third in the National League with 184 Hits In 1983."
-------------------------------------------

Statistics To Request
-----------------------
// Hitting
Singles
Doubles
Triples
Home runs
RBIs
Runs
Stolen bases
Caught stealing
Batting average
Hits
Wins above replacement
Slugging percentage
Extra base hits
Total bases
On base percentage
Walks
Intentional walks
Sacrifice flies
At bats per home run
Grounded into double plays

// Pitching
Earned Run Average
Strikeouts
Strikes per walk
Strikeouts per nine innings
WHIP
Wins
Shutouts
Saves
Innings Pitches

//Misc
Oldest Player
Youngest Player

If you have any questions or comments regarding this application please feel free to reach out to us at ottomanellibaseball@gmail.com.
review: Alexa needs a Skill like this one purports to be, however, this skill app simply doesn't work. I asked it really hard questions, like how many career home runs did Babe Ruth have?  What was Ty Cobbs career bating average? ....Nothing.  It has now been disabled while I wait for someone to get a Baseball Wiki type skill perfected.

To ask for help or give feedback on this skill please contact mmlivehelp@turner.com
