name: Sachin Sachin Chanting
description:
Crowd Chanting Sachin Sachin! Goosebumps grantee. 

Try another skill Dhoni Dhoni Chanting. (to find the skill enter "dhoni chant' in the search bar)

name: Tennis Updates
description: This skill is intended to give you a good update on what is going on in the Tennis World.
review: This is a skill that gives me a very straightforward news on the tennis world.

name: Lake Worth Surf Report
description: Provides a surf report for Lake Worth Pier in Palm Beach county Florida
review: Exactly what I was looking for.  The other "skills" have flopped when it comes to PBC.  Thank you!!!!

name: Buffalo Sports Facts
description: Ask Alexa for trivia and facts for your favorite Buffalo sports teams.

name: WV MetroNews Sports Briefing
description: West Virginia's top sports stories updated throughout the day.

name: Cubs Baseball Unauthorized Trivia
description:
Cubs Baseball Trivia was amassed by a long time avid fan of the Chicago Cubs. This skill is fun to play during the long winter months when there is no baseball and you long to hear Play Ball". Or while waiting for the game to start  at home.

Cubs Baseball  Trivia is great for the entire family. Play with or against each other and see who really knows their Cubbies.

New trivia is constantly being added to the skill so keep coming back and playing.

If you have questions or comments please let us know:
Steve@dwilsys.com.

This skill is not sponsored or endorsed by Major League Baseball or the Chicago Cubs. This is a fan created game.
review: CORRECTION: Ernie Banks is Mr. Cub, not Billy Williams.

name: Baseball Scores in 30 seconds
description: Just the score ma'am.  Daily scores in less than 30 seconds by SportDrum .  The must-have Alexa flash briefing for sports fans.  Say Alexa, enable Baseball Scores in 30 seconds.
review: Working great for me.  Getting spring training scores now is a nice touch.

name: ESPN
description:
Get your sports radio fix with the ESPN skill. From Mike and Mike to Dan Le Batard and Stu Gotz, this skill brings you live ESPN Radio, several ESPN affiliate stations, and hourly news updates.  

Say, "Tell me the news," "Play the radio," or ask for your local ESPN radio station to access the best in sports radio content.

Supported radio stations include:
- ESPN Radio
- ESPN Deportes Radio
- ESPN Chicago (WMVP 1000 AM)
- ESPN Los Angeles (KSPN 710 AM)
- ESPN New York (WEPN 98.7 FM)
- ESPN Deportes New York (WEPN 1050 AM)
review: Lots of fun

name: Coach Harbaugh
description:
Need to get fired up? Of course you don't - you are already attacking today with an enthusiasm unknown to mankind. But how about having your own personal Jim Harbaugh to entertain you on game day? Or on Mondays. Or every single morning while you wash down your steak breakfast with whole milk. 

You can say:
1. Alexa, ask Coach Harbaugh for a quote
2. Alexa, ask Coach Harbaugh to play "The Victors"
3. Alexa, ask Coach Harbaugh WHO'S GOT IT BETTER THAN US!?

Please note that this skill is not affiliated with the University of Michigan in any way. I'm just a fan with the constitutional right to share Jim Harbaugh's wisdom with you.

Special thanks to Sibish Basheer for making this possible.
review: Prepare to appreciate Coach Harbaugh's quotes even more as Alexa delivers them straight to your home in her robot voice! Go Blue!

name: HikeMaster
description: The skill provides good hikes around Bay Area. It works with the invocation call "Alexa, ask Hike Master" . A sample phase to use is "Alexa, ask hike master to give me a hike that is easy"

name: Gridiron Trivia
description:
Do you love football?  Do you think you know all about the Gridiron?
Well, now you can play the Gridiron Trivia game on your Amazon Echo.
review: Really fun

name: Flashbang Feed
description: When you ask for your flash briefing this will provide CSGO news with it! Get updates on your favorite teams, tournaments, rule changes, and roster updates. This provides a great way to keep up with the latest in CSGO easily.
review: It's good for news. but it should have more options like upcoming events, schedules and etc.

name: Patriots Fan
description:
Here are 38 interesting unofficial facts about the Patriots! The skill is not sponsored or endorsed by New England Patriots.
Facts were supplied by Will Gellman.
review: Did not understand 3 questions asked.

name: Clemson Sports Talk
description:
The latest updates on Clemson Sports from Clemson Sports Talk. You can listen to Clemson Sports Talk on your Amazon Echo by saying, "Alexa, play Clemson Sports Talk".

You can also listen live between 6-8PM weeknights by saying, "Alexa, play Fox Sports Radio 1400."

Follow the show on Twitter: @ClemsonSports

Go Tigers!
review: Lawton & C.S.T the BEST hands down!

name: Yahoo Fantasy Football
description:
Does your line-up have what it takes? Login and link one of your existing Yahoo Fantasy Football head-to-head leagues to the Alexa Skill to track your team as they make their play for the championship. Competing in multiple Head-2-Head leagues? No problem, just say ‘Change league’ to easily switch to another league. 

Use the Alexa skill to get: 
– an overview of your team’s weekly matchup and score.
– your team’s injury/bye status. 
– player scores and injury updates.
All without ever putting your hands on the ball.

——

NOTE: This skill currently SUPPORTS Head-to-Head fantasy leagues only. It DOES NOT support Points leagues or Pick’Em.
comment heading: Limited functions, but works well even for multiple teams
review: This skill can tell you about your head-to-head matchup, give you a score update, League standings and information about specific players. It does work for multiple Yahoo fantasy football teams. It took awhile to figure it out - just say " change team" as a command and it will cycle through the different Yahoo fantasy football teams you have. Overall I think it's pretty good it's nice just ask Alexa for a score update without having to look at it on a phone or computer.

skills-rest: Hoosier Sound-Off: IU Sports News by Hoosier Sound
name: Hoosier Sound-Off: IU Sports News by Hoosier Sound
description: Hoosier Sound-Off is a regular news update of the most important Indiana sports news from The Hoosier Sound. Hosted by Noah Freeman, this short flash briefing will include short updates from around the Indiana University athletic department for a variety of sports.

name: PGA TOUR
description: We can make it: Keep up to date on the latest scores from every PGA TOUR event throughout the season.  Ask Alexa for the latest leaderboard or get the score of your favorite player.  See more information here: https://www.pgatour.com/products/voiceassistant.html
review: Like this skill, easy to use and find my favorite golfers.

name: PGA TOUR
description: We can make it: Keep up to date on the latest scores from every PGA TOUR event throughout the season.  Ask Alexa for the latest leaderboard or get the score of your favorite player.  See more information here: https://www.pgatour.com/products/voiceassistant.html
comment heading: Currency, accuracy, and ability to home in on 1 player.
review: Excellent app, I love the ability to only get info on the few players that I am following.

name: Wizards Flash Briefing
description: Don’t miss a thing! Get the latest Washington Wizards team news right from Alexa, updated daily. Start by saying, “Alexa, What’s the latest news?" Created by Monumental Sports & Entertainment.

name: Robot Roxie
description:
Trying to keep score when you're playing baseball can be difficult, so why not use your Alexa and have it keep score for you?  

Roxie is a skill that tracks all of the basic information around a one-on-one pickup game.  Here are different features.

To begin, say "Start Game" and a new game will be initialized.  By default, the games are three innings long, and each player gets ten swings.

You can customize the player names by saying "Change Player One/Two name to <name>".

Say pitch ball and Roxie will track that a pitch was thrown.  Let Roxie know what happened next - either say "Strike, Ball, or Base Hit" and it will track the score.
review: Very innovative skill that incorporates a voice user interface with tracking live game play.

name: theScore Sports
description: Whether a casual or hardcore sports fan, theScore skill gives you all the information you need to be kept up to date. You'll get top news, trade rumors, stats and scores for all of the leagues you care about.
review: Volume compared to the other Skills when I listen to my Flash Briefing is about 60% only

name: NBA
description:
Welcome to the new NBA Alexa Skill! You can interact with me in several ways:

(1) Open me by saying "Alexa, open NBA." You should always start your conversation with me this way.  This will trigger the welcome menu and tell you how to listen to live NBA action, check scores, and get schedule info. 

After you’ve opened the NBA skill…

(2) **To LISTEN TO A GAME**, tell me “Play the Cavs game" or “Stream the Atlanta game."  Most games have the home and away announcers, just say the team name for the announcers you want and we'll start streaming.  If Alexa has trouble recognizing your team name, be sure and use the city AND team name together, like “Houston Rockets.”

(3) To ask about the SCHEDULE, say “What games are on today?” OR “When do the Warriors play?”  Ask about a specific team to get broadcaster information for upcoming games.  

(4) Ask me about SCORES by saying, “What is the score of the Milwaukee Bucks game?” OR “What are the latest scores?"  

Additionally after opening the skill, you can say things to me like:

Who is playing now?
When do the Celtics play the Lakers?
What time are the Memphis Grizzlies on?
Did the Thunder win on Monday?

**You will need to login from the Alexa companion app with a valid NBA League Pass subscription in order to listen to games.  Visit www.nba.com/leaguepass to sign up today.
comment heading: Doesn’t play the announcers that match the team name.
review: Tried it with a few different teams and it’s not matching what League Pass is playing at the same time l.

skills-rest: KPIX 5 San Francisco Bay Area Sports
name: KPIX 5 San Francisco Bay Area Sports
description: Today’s sports headlines from the Bay Area’s KPIX 5. Includes video on compatible devices.
comment heading: Definitely add KPIX to your Alexa skills
review: I listen to KPIX every morning, it’s the best way to get my Bay Area news. I also get to watch it on my Show. I don’t have tv, but I get to watch the news when I want to!

name: Baseball Reference
description:
Welcome to the Baseball Reference Alexa application. This application makes finding out leaders in certain statistics as easy as just asking. As of right now this app can only return top ranking and you cannot make request by specific players or team statistics.

Users are able to request a multitude of different statistics that can be further specified by rank (1-10), top amount (top two, top three, top four, etc.) year (1871 - present), and league (All of Baseball, National League or American League). 

Here are some initial example requests:
-------------------------------------------
Alexa, ask Baseball Reference who is third in the National League in home runs.

Who leads the league in doubles?

Who lead the American League in wins in nineteen eighty six?

Who is the oldest player in the league?

Alexa, ask Baseball Reference, in nineteen ninety nine, who lead the league in home runs?

Who was top three in strikeouts?

Who was tenth in wins in the National League in nineteen seventy two
-------------------------------------------

Another feature available to users is that after a user makes a successful request and are prompted to ask another question, a user can build upon their previous request.


For Example:
-------------------------------------------
User Requests - "Alexa, ask Baseball Reference who was second in the National League in hits in nineteen eighty three"

Alexa Responds - "Rafael Ramirez was second in the National League with 185 Hits in 1983."

The user can now request a few things:

- Next -
User Requests - "Who was next?"
Alexa Responds -  "Al Oliver was third in the National League with 184 Hits in 1983."

- Previous -
User Requests - "Who was previous?"
Alexa Responds -  "Jose Cruz and Andre Dawson were tied for first in the National League with 189 Hits In 1983 ."

- Rank -
User Requests - "Who was sixth?"
Alexa Responds -  "Dickie Thon was sixth in the National League with 177 Hits In 1983."

- Top -
User Requests - "Who was top three?"
Alexa Responds -  "Jose Cruz and Andre Dawson were tied for first in the National League with 189 Hits In 1983. Rafael Ramirez was second in the National League with 185 Hits In 1983. Al Oliver was third in the National League with 184 Hits In 1983."
-------------------------------------------

Statistics To Request
-----------------------
// Hitting
Singles
Doubles
Triples
Home runs
RBIs
Runs
Stolen bases
Caught stealing
Batting average
Hits
Wins above replacement
Slugging percentage
Extra base hits
Total bases
On base percentage
Walks
Intentional walks
Sacrifice flies
At bats per home run
Grounded into double plays

// Pitching
Earned Run Average
Strikeouts
Strikes per walk
Strikeouts per nine innings
WHIP
Wins
Shutouts
Saves
Innings Pitches

//Misc
Oldest Player
Youngest Player

If you have any questions or comments regarding this application please feel free to reach out to us at ottomanellibaseball@gmail.com.
review: Boring, not very into this skill

name: Kansas City Royals Unofficial
description:
For fans of Kansas City Royals baseball who want to know their latest score, their next game, their standings, or how they've been doing lately (are they on a winning streak (oh yeah!) or a rough patch (oh no)). 

Ask the Royals baseball skill "how have they been doing?" or "what is their record" or even "when is their next game?" Stay up to date with the Kansas City Royals no matter if you live in Kansas City or far away.

name: Baseball Facts
description: This skill will inform you of facts related to the baseball. It informs you of past achievements of teams, streaks of winning and losing, and various tidbits. Just ask Alexa to tell you a fact.

name: Baseball Live
description:
Find more information than the built-in MLB functions.

-See who is pitching or batting for your team
    - Ex: "Ask Baseball Live who is pitching for The Phillies"
-See what is currently happening in your team's game
    - Ex: "Ask Baseball Live what's the score of The Phillies game"
-See what play just happened in your team's game
    - Ex: "Ask Baseball Live what's happening in The Phillies game"
    - Ex: "Ask Baseball Live what just happened in The Phillies game"
-Check the standings
    - Ex: "Ask Baseball Live how many games back are The Mets"
-See the lines score
    - Ex: "Ask Baseball Live for the line score of The Phillies game"

Pro Version
-Get a team briefing including the score of the game, the standings in the division/wild card, and updates on the teams relevant in the standings
review: im impressed. gets me quick facts about games last week, this week, starting pitchers, line-ups, etc. only complaint is the app won’t list who’s on the DL list. i know MLB just renamed it “injured list”, but the app will not list this either. gave it 5 stars anyway, as it’s better than most

name: Game Lines
description:
Grabs up to date spreads and over/under odds for upcoming NFL, NBA, and NCAA Division 1 games. 

Ask game lines for a team name, followed optionally by what sport you want to know about.

For example, "Alexa, ask game lines for the West Virginia college basketball game."

Odds are provided by http://www.betonline.ag and made available shortly after they are posted on their website.
review: Wow nice background. The paved road is so clean. Could be USA. Or canada

name: Steelers Fan
description:
Get unofficial to-the-minute stats & fun facts on the Steelers by Fresh Digital Group. This skill isn’t sponsored or endorsed by the Steelers.

Here’s some ways you can use the skill. We have given you many different ways for you to talk to Alexa:



General Updates:


Alexa, ask Steelers Fan how are the Steelers doing? 

Alexa, ask Steelers Fan who do the Steelers play next?

Alexa, ask Steelers Fan Terry Bradshaw (or any player's First name, Last name) touchdown update. 



Fun Facts about the Steelers:


Alexa, ask Steelers Fan to tell me some trivia about the Steelers. 

Alexa, ask Steelers Fan how many Super Bowls have the Steelers won?
review: I appreciate your work on live feeds! Good work!

name: theScore eSports
description:
heScore esports Flash Briefing is the ultimate esports experience!

On a daily basis, you'll get breaking news, live scores, in-depth analyses and more from across the world of competitive gaming.

We deliver breaking news and live scoring coverage of major games including:
• League of Legends (NA LCS, EU LCS, LCK, LPL, and many more!)
• Dota 2
• Counter-Strike: GO (CS:GO)
• Heroes of the Storm
• Call of Duty (CoD)
• StarCraft II
• Hearthstone
• Street Fighter
• Super Smash Bros. 
• Overwatch

Add theScore esports to your Flash Briefing by going to Settings in the Alexa app. You can manage your Flash Briefing under Account.

After adding theScore esports, you can say “Alexa, what’s my Flash Briefing?” or “Alexa, what’s in the news?” to hear the latest.
review: It feels a little CS Go biased but good variety of games are talked about.

name: NCAA March Madness
description:
NCAA March Madness for Alexa delivers real-time tournament scores, schedules, information about your Bracket Picks, and live radio for each game.

Example Phrases:

“Alexa, ask March Madness what games are on right now?”

“Alexa, ask March Madness for today's scores.”

“Alexa, ask March Madness for today's schedule.”

“Alexa, ask March Madness what games can I listen to on the radio?”

“Alexa, ask March Madness for the score of the North Carolina game.”

“Alexa, ask March Madness to play the Duke versus Kentucky game.”

“Alexa, ask March Madness what time the Kansas game starts.”

“Alexa, ask March Madness how my bracket is doing.”

“Alexa, ask March Madness who I picked to win it all.”

“Alexa, ask March Madness which teams I picked today.”

To ask for help or give feedback on this skill please contact mmlivehelp@turner.com

*Note: The live radio feature is currently not supported on Fire TV.

*Note: Must sign-in with a valid Capital One NCAA March Madness Bracket Challenge account in order to get information about your bracket picks.
comment heading: Asked to listen to a game and after a pause ...
review: Asked to listen to a game and after a pause Alexa said sorry I'm having trouble accessing the March madness skill right now.  Think it is overloaded.

name: NCAA March Madness
description:
NCAA March Madness for Alexa delivers real-time tournament scores, schedules, information about your Bracket Picks, and live radio for each game.

name: O-H!
description: Fans of Ohio State say O-H, and people cheer back, I-O! This skill allows Alexa to get in on the fun. Turn on Follow-Up mode to allow you to keep saying O-H without having to say Alexa first.
review: Say, Alexa, OH! And she responds back. Twice.

name: LFC News
description: The latest LFC news direct from Liverpool Football Club
comment heading: What a flash briefing should be!
review:
Thanks!

We want to help you reach more people so you can grow this flash briefing's audience! Please take 30s and go to askvoco.com and make a profile as we are finally making voice content discoverable!

skills-rest: What's the Fishing Report for Lake Erie?
name: What's the Fishing Report for Lake Erie?
description:
Where are the fish biting on Lake Erie? A complete guide to fishing on Lake Erie. Discover where the Walleye and Perch are biting on Lake Erie. Find the hotspots for Smallmouth Bass, weather conditions, wave and wind conditions on Lake Erie and in the Shores and Islands area.

Powered by 1StepSolution.com
invocation name: what's the lake erie fishing report

name: FIFA World Cup
description:
This skill brings you news and action from the FIFA world cup 2018. You can get daily highlights, match scores and fixtures.

Some examples of the queries you can ask are:
- Argentina versus Croatia score
- When is Denmark playing France?
- What's the result of Croatia versus Russia?

Please provide feedback on the skill to fifaskill@logituit.com. We would love to get your feedback.
comment heading: Nice idea and very handy for the game
review: Nice and easy to use.

skills-rest: The Rookie's Guide to the NFL
name: The Rookie's Guide to the NFL
description:
The Rookie's Guide to the NFL is your official way to learn about the National Football League. Become an expert by asking about the rules, penalties, scoring plays, commentator lingo, previous Super Bowls, team formations, and more.

After enabling the skill, say 'Open NFL' or 'Launch NFL' to use The Rookie's Guide.

Once you've opened the skill, you can say things like:
-What is defensive pass interference?
-How many players are on a team?
-Who won Super Bowl 35?
-What's the difference between a running back and a wide receiver?
-Tell me about the Music City Miracle
-How tall is Aaron Rodgers?
-What does ‘move the chains’ mean?
Or, just say 'Surprise me' to hear a new definition

If you get stuck within the skill, say 'Alexa, what does this skill do?' to hear more options.
comment heading: This skill can predict the future!
review: If you ask, "Tell me about the Kansas City Chiefs", it starts off and exclaims, "The Kansas Chiefs are winners of two Superbowls"...  That's awesome!  We must win this year's big game for our second one!  I'm off now to get 2nd mortgage on the house and cash in.

name: Running Clothes
description:
Wondering what to wear on your next run? 
The Running Clothes Advisor takes the guesswork out of getting dressed for your next outdoor run based on your local weather conditions. This simple guide may prompt you to enable location permissions in your Alexa app. If you do not wish to enable location permissions say, "My Inputs" for your personalized apparel recommendation.

Our exclusive apparel algorithm provides personalized apparel recommendations based on weather conditions and gender. This skill has been optimized with screen support for Echo Show and Echo Spot devices.

After your run, re-open the Running Clothes advisor and select "log my run." You can record your miles ran and how your run went. You can also tell Alexa if her recommendation was too hot or too cold and the algorithm will automatically adjust your recommendations going forward.

If you choose apparel advice based current weather conditions, Alexa will pull temperature, humidity, wind speed, and other weather conditions based on your zip code. Alexa will prompt you for your gender and create a personalized recommendation based on our exclusive apparel algorithm. Our exclusive algorithm is based on years of running experience and races including 5K, 10K, 10 Miler, Half Marathon, and Full Marathon distances. Caroline Dunn is a New York City Marathon 2018 Finisher.

If you select running outfit advice based on your inputs, Alexa will ask you for your gender, temperature, weather conditions (sunny, windy, cloudy, or raining), and your run intensity (easy run, or race), to create a personalized recommendation based on our exclusive algorithm. Feel free to adjust based on your personal preference. This is only intended to be a guide.

Disclaimer: Please consult a physician before beginning a new workout program.

Created by: Caroline Dunn - https://www.linkedin.com/in/carolinedunn/
https://twitter.com/thecarolinedunn
https://www.instagram.com/thecarolinedunn/
http://carolinedunn.org/
http://alexadevgroup.com/
review: The recommendations are spot on and the app works really well.  It makes me want to run more!

name: NFL in :60
description:
The NFL in :60 is your official daily NFL news update on the top stories from around the League. From the latest headlines to the NFL storylines you need to know on your favorite team and playmakers. Multiple updates throughout the day keep you up to speed on all the latest, straight from the NFL Network News Desk.

Go to Settings in your Alexa app and find “Flash Briefing” to move NFL in :60 to the top of your news brief!

After enabling NFL in :60, you can say "Alexa, what's my Flash Briefing?" or "Alexa, what's the news?" to hear the latest from the NFL.

Make sure to also enable The Rookie's Guide to the NFL for scores, schedules, football facts, and more.
review: Good to have this available

name: Bleed Purple
description:
"Alexa, bleed purple"

Grilled Cheese Thursday.  The Quad.  21-16   The smell of dog food when it rains.  Gingerbread House.  D-Hall.  The Breeze. JMaddy.  You bleed purple and gold.
review: Works great for me! Love hearing it after the big win tonight.

Reddit's /r/baseball Baseball Nightly Pick skill.

description: Use the Follow The Game skill to find out what radio station (if any) is playing the Big Game (Super bowl) where you are, or will be at game time.

name: Cricket Info
description:
You can ask for brief, detailed or quick score updates. You can ask for score or schedule for any team. Examples, 
“Alexa, ask cricket info to get score update” gets brief score update of all on going matches.
“Alexa, ask cricket info to get team India schedule” gets schedule of team India cricket matches.
"Alexa, ask cricket info to get IPL update" gets score updates for ongoing IPL matches. 
“Alexa, ask cricket info to get quick score update” gets score summary for all ongoing matches, you can optionally request quick score for a team.
“Alexa, ask cricket info to get team Australia detailed score” gets detailed score for ongoing match of team Australia.

name: MTB Trails
description: Allows a user to query any city in the world and find mountain biking trails near that city. The default distance is set to 30 miles, but can be changed to any distance between one and 200 miles. More detailed information, including distance, difficulty, and elevation change is included for each trail. Trail conditions are also available.
review: Finds great trails

name: ESPN
description:
Get your sports radio fix with the ESPN skill. From Mike and Mike to Dan Le Batard and Stu Gotz, this skill brings you live ESPN Radio, several ESPN affiliate stations, and hourly news updates.  

Say, "Tell me the news," "Play the radio," or ask for your local ESPN radio station to access the best in sports radio content.

Supported radio stations include:
- ESPN Radio
- ESPN Deportes Radio
- ESPN Chicago (WMVP 1000 AM)
- ESPN Los Angeles (KSPN 710 AM)
- ESPN New York (WEPN 98.7 FM)
- ESPN Deportes New York (WEPN 1050 AM)
review: No watch espn skill to work with tv

name: New England Patriots
description:
Meet the Patriots!

Say “Alexa, open Patriots” to hear daily news updates, discover fun facts, and learn about coming to a game at Gillette Stadium.

You may ask:
What's new with the Patriots?
Play Patriots Radio.
What time is the game?
What is the Patriots schedule?
Tell me a fun fact about the Patriots.
Can bring a blanket to the game?
review: Awesome product!

name: Roger Bro - The Tennis Assistant
description:
Can't keep up with your tennis? Roger. Can't find a quick recap of the recent happenings in tennis? Roger. Can't follow Federer but can never get enough of him? Roger.
Roger - The Tennis Assistant delivers the latest in tennis, and the latest about Roger, with the convenience of a single command - Ask Roger. Ask Roger about Tennis News. Ask Roger about Roger Federer.
review: This app is just too khateek.

name: NCAA March Madness
description:
NCAA March Madness for Alexa delivers real-time tournament scores, schedules, information about your Bracket Picks, and live radio for each game.

Example Phrases:

“Alexa, ask March Madness what games are on right now?”

“Alexa, ask March Madness for today's scores.”

“Alexa, ask March Madness for today's schedule.”

“Alexa, ask March Madness what games can I listen to on the radio?”

“Alexa, ask March Madness for the score of the North Carolina game.”

“Alexa, ask March Madness to play the Duke versus Kentucky game.”

“Alexa, ask March Madness what time the Kansas game starts.”

“Alexa, ask March Madness how my bracket is doing.”

“Alexa, ask March Madness who I picked to win it all.”

“Alexa, ask March Madness which teams I picked today.”

To ask for help or give feedback on this skill please contact mmlivehelp@turner.com

*Note: The live radio feature is currently not supported on Fire TV.

*Note: Must sign-in with a valid Capital One NCAA March Madness Bracket Challenge account in order to get information about your bracket picks.
review: March Madness is not limited to men's games....

name: 93.7 The Fan Pittsburgh
description: The latest sports news and interview cuts from Pittsburgh hometown sports leader, 93-7 The Fan.
review: The updates are often 1 or 2 days behind.  I may ask for an update on Wednesday morning and I’m still receiving Monday’s report.  Plus it doesn’t appear that there is any effort to make updates over the weekend.  I’m a diehard Pgh sports fan and thus I’m very disappointed that this skill can’t keep me up to date on what’s happening with my teams.

name: College Football Roster Info
description:
The College Football Roster Info skill lets you get information about any player on any team in the FBS by name or number. Simply ask Alexa about players by using their full name, last name, or number and their team and she will tell you key information about them like their height, weight, class and hometown. 
Note: information is current as of the start of the season, if you find numbers have changed let me know as the teams sometimes shuffle those in the first week or so.
review: Wonderful. Much helpful.

name: Yahoo Fantasy Football
description:
Does your line-up have what it takes? Login and link one of your existing Yahoo Fantasy Football head-to-head leagues to the Alexa Skill to track your team as they make their play for the championship. Competing in multiple Head-2-Head leagues? No problem, just say ‘Change league’ to easily switch to another league. 

Use the Alexa skill to get: 
– an overview of your team’s weekly matchup and score.
– your team’s injury/bye status. 
– player scores and injury updates.
All without ever putting your hands on the ball.

——

NOTE: This skill currently SUPPORTS Head-to-Head fantasy leagues only. It DOES NOT support Points leagues or Pick’Em.
review: I want to know my score....

name: Indian Cricket Facts
description: provides interesting set of facts on indian cricket history and the players

name: cricketSkill
description:
Score Tracker will give the latest scores of matches. Try saying "ask score tracker for update".

You can also add favorite teams, and Alexa will output scores for them first, if they're currently playing.

Currently supports cricket only.

Stay tuned for more features.
review: Does not work. Doesn't list current india England test match

name: College Football Roster Info
description:
The College Football Roster Info skill lets you get information about any player on any team in the FBS by name or number. Simply ask Alexa about players by using their full name, last name, or number and their team and she will tell you key information about them like their height, weight, class and hometown. 
Note: information is current as of the start of the season, if you find numbers have changed let me know as the teams sometimes shuffle those in the first week or so.
review: It doenst know who the Wisconsin Badgers are. I will give them a week or two to update.

name: Let's Go!!!
description:
Stuck at home watching the VT game?  Miss being in the stands?  Alexa is here to help!  Say "Lets Go" to Alexa and she and her friends respond like true fans.

Losing track of how long its been since VT lost to that other team in Virginia?  Just ask Lets Go, and Alexa will let you know just how many days it has been.

name: Marshawn Lynch's BeastMode
description:
The BeastMode Skill is a fun and informative skill. This skill allows you to say things like: 

Press Conference Questions

Alexa, Ask BeastMode... 

how was that defense?
how was the game?
what are you going to do after the game?
how are you feeling?
what's next for you?

You can also ask for facts about Marshawn:

Alexa, Ask BeastMode when he was drafted
Alexa, Ask BeastMode what NFL teams he played on
Alexa, Ask BeastMode where the nickname BeastMode came from 
Alexa, Ask BeastMode where he grew up
Alexa, Ask BeastMode what sports he was good at in high school
Alexa, Ask BeastMode where he went to college
Alexa, Ask BeastMode what jersey number did he wear in college
Alexa, Ask BeastMode what awards did you win in college
Alexa, Ask BeastMode when did you announce your retirement
Alexa, Ask BeastMode What’s your favorite candy

For more information visit us at http://beastmodeonline.com
review: GO HAWKS!!

name: Yahoo Fantasy Football
description:
Does your line-up have what it takes? Login and link one of your existing Yahoo Fantasy Football head-to-head leagues to the Alexa Skill to track your team as they make their play for the championship. Competing in multiple Head-2-Head leagues? No problem, just say ‘Change league’ to easily switch to another league. 

Use the Alexa skill to get: 
– an overview of your team’s weekly matchup and score.
– your team’s injury/bye status. 
– player scores and injury updates.
All without ever putting your hands on the ball.

——

NOTE: This skill currently SUPPORTS Head-to-Head fantasy leagues only. It DOES NOT support Points leagues or Pick’Em.
review: Worked very well. It easily let me choose which of my teams to link to. The voice menu is logical and easy to navigate. Won't replace the Yahoo FF app but a fun and useful companion.

name: FantasyMetrix
description:
Alexa will provide past and present, weekly and season-long, statistics along with advanced metrics derived from NFL players using the Yahoo Fantasy Sports API

How To Use For Metrics:
1. Name of a current NFL player who has played in at least one game
2. Valid football metric pertaining to that player's position (See list below)
3. Year of an NFL season ranging from 2001 – Present
4. Week number is merely optional (Week 1 – 17)
5. Target metrics are only available beginning from year 2014 – Present

How To Use For Schedule:
1. Name of an NFL team
2. Year of an NFL season ranging from 2002 – Present
3. Week number ranging from Week 1 – 17

Quick Example Phrases:
Alexa, ask FantasyMetrix Rob Gronkowski, season stats, 2010
Alexa, ask FantasyMetrix Julio Jones, yards per reception, 2011
Alexa, ask FantasyMetrix Marshawn Lynch, rushing yards, 2012
Alexa, ask FantasyMetrix Russell Wilson, completions, twenty thirteen
Alexa, ask FantasyMetrix Oakland Raiders, week 10, twenty fourteen

Football Metrics:
Carries
Catch Rate
Completions
Completion Percentage
Fantasy Points
Fantasy Points Per Game
Fumbles
Game Log
Games Played
Half PPR Points
Half PPR Points Per Game
Interceptions
Passing Attempts
Passing Attempts Per Game
Passing Touchdowns
Passing Yards
Passing Yards Per Game
PPR Points
PPR Points Per Game
Receiving Touchdowns
Receiving Yards
Receiving Yards Per Game
Receptions
Receptions Per Game
Return Touchdowns
Rushing Attempts
Rushing Attempts Per Game
Rushing Touchdowns
Rushing Yards
Rushing Yards Per Game
Season Stats
Targets
Targets Per Game
Total Touchdowns
Two Point Conversions
Yards From Scrimmage
Yards From Scrimmage Per Game
Yards Per Attempt
Yards Per Carry
Yards Per Reception
Yards Per Target
review: This is a must have for any fantasy football enthusiast. It's a great help in figuring out who to start/sit, who to pick up/drop on the waivers, and research matchups. Totally worth it!

name: Champions League
description: Get the standings for each group in the Champions League.
review: Love the quick and efficient way to get the league leaders. Works great on my Show too!

name: Fantasy Racing Tips by Race4thePrize
description: Quick DFS racing audio bites from Race4thePrize.com.
review: pearce might be a tool but hes funny and i love his takes on nascar and the state of nascar.  he should be ceo of nascar

name: Boston Sports
description: Every day, we bring you the latest news and updates about Boston Sports. Thank you for listening to the SpokenLayer Network!
review:
for my flash briefing the broadcast is fine — until i try to move on to the next source. instead,
 it plays yesterday‘s news. then the day before that, then the day before that...it won’t let go.

name: Metro Sports
description: The Metro Sports Team aims to provide you with the best and most current information on New York Sports! We aim to update this skill periodically in order to ensure that you are always on the cutting edge.
comment heading: Hourly updates to NY sports stories?
review: Why not?!?! Saves me from having to spend too much screen time on my phone, and avoids looking at advertisements. Usually listen in the morning while getting dressed. Couldn't be better.

name: Rock Chalk Jayhawk
description:
We have always loved Alexa and now we know why... she’s a Jayhawk fan!
Rock Chalk Jayhawk is a perfect game-day addition for your Amazon Device!
Impress your friends, family, & coworkers while showing off that Jayhawk Pride!
review: Just like sotting in the hallowed halls of Allen Fieldhouse!

name: Fantasy Sports Update
description:
Get the latest fantasy sports updates to give you that winning edge in your fantasy league.  

Add the RTSports.com Fantasy Sports Update to your Flash Briefing and move it to the top of your news by going to Settings in the Alexa app.

After adding RTSports.com Fantasy Sports Update, you can say "Alexa, what's my Flash Briefing?" or "Alexa, what's in the news?" to hear the last fantasy updates.
review: Love it. Get my updates 5 times a day.

name: Bleed Purple
description:
"Alexa, bleed purple"

Grilled Cheese Thursday.  The Quad.  21-16   The smell of dog food when it rains.  Gingerbread House.  D-Hall.  The Breeze. JMaddy.  You bleed purple and gold.

name: Dodgers Baseball Fan Trivia
description:
Dodgers Fan Trivia was amassed by a long time avid fan of the Los Angeles Dodgers. This skill is fun to play during the long winter months when there is no baseball and you long to hear "It's time for Dodgers baseball". Or while waiting for the game to start while listening or watching at home.

Dodgers Fan Trivia is great for the entire family. Play with or against each other and see who really knows their Dodgers.

New trivia is constantly being added to the skill so keep coming back and playing.

If you have questions or comments please let us know:
TriviaSkills@dwilsys.com.

This skill is not sponsored or endorsed by Major League Baseball or the Los Angels Dodgers. This is a fan created game.
review: We are big Dodger fans. This was fun!

name: Skateboard Studio
comment heading: No design thought went into this
review: one question, one answer. no options, navigation or actionable outcomes. could be cool but needs a lot of work

name: ESPN
description:
Get your sports radio fix with the ESPN skill. From Mike and Mike to Dan Le Batard and Stu Gotz, this skill brings you live ESPN Radio, several ESPN affiliate stations, and hourly news updates.  

Say, "Tell me the news," "Play the radio," or ask for your local ESPN radio station to access the best in sports radio content.

review: Alexa says now playing ESPN Radio, and then silence.  I've turned the volume up way high to see if it is just quiet, but NOTHING.  Very annoying.

name: Boxing facts
description: Boxing facts gives you statistics and information on some of the best heavyweight fighters of all time.

name: College Football Updates
description:
The College Football News Brief with Lawton Swann is the skill that keeps on giving to college football fans around the country. Not only can you expect hourly news, but when big news breaks in other NCAA sports, we will have that for you as well.

Follow us on Twitter: @CFB_NewsBrief
review: Keeps me up to date with the latest football news!

name: numberFire News
description: numberFire gives you the best sports news and analysis to help you get an edge building your lineups and becoming a smarter fan. Powered by the numberFire platform and content, We can give you breaking news and major updates across all the 4 major sports and college football and basketball.

name: Yahoo Fantasy Football
description:
Does your line-up have what it takes? Login and link one of your existing Yahoo Fantasy Football head-to-head leagues to the Alexa Skill to track your team as they make their play for the championship. Competing in multiple Head-2-Head leagues? No problem, just say ‘Change league’ to easily switch to another league. 

Use the Alexa skill to get: 
– an overview of your team’s weekly matchup and score.

comment heading: Does not support Points league type, only Head to Head
review:
Does not support Points leagues, only Head to Head leagues.
Unfortunately I am only in a Points league in Yahoo.

name: StatMuse
description:
StatMuse lets you explore sports statistics, schedules and scores in a whole new way, straight from your favorite players and personalities. Say "Alexa, ask StatMuse who has the most career receiving yards?" and hear Jerry Rice tell you about his record. Then try "Who had the most touchdowns last season?" to hear from David Johnson. Ask "When are the Falcons playing next?" to have Devonta Freeman give you his game schedule.



StatMuse provides instant answers to your NBA, NFL, MLB & NHL questions and features the authentic voices of Peyton Manning, Le'Veon Bell, Drew Brees, Terrell Owens, Jerry Rice and other players, plus Scott Van Pelt and Joe Buck. StatMuse is the officially licensed AI of the NFL Players Association.

Start by asking:
"Alexa, open Statmuse…"

“How did the Eagles do?”
"Who had the most passing yards in a season?"
After hearing Drew Brees answer, ask "Where did you go to college?" or "How many touchdowns did you have last season?"

"Who won the World Series in 1945?"
"Which pitcher had the most strikeouts last year?"
After hearing the answer, ask "What is his career ERA?"

"How did Steph Curry do last season?"
“Who do the Rockets play this week?”

“What hockey games are on tonight?”
“Tell me about the Golden Knights.”
StatMuse has comprehensive stats going back to 1947 for the NBA, 1920 for the NFL, 1876 for MLB and 1917 for the NHL.

Here are just a few of the stats now available to you, instantly: https://www.statmuse.com/getting-started/examples
review: Not much cooler than getting to hear Peyton or SVP answer sports questions on my Alexa

name: New England Patriots
description:
Meet the Patriots!

Say “Alexa, open Patriots” to hear daily news updates, discover fun facts, and learn about coming to a game at Gillette Stadium.

You may ask:
What's new with the Patriots?
Play Patriots Radio.
What time is the game?
What is the Patriots schedule?
Tell me a fun fact about the Patriots.
Can bring a blanket to the game?
review: I have only used it for a little while but it works fine. It gave me the news for the day, including injury reports for the upcoming game.

name: ESPN Radio (via TuneIn)
description: As part of your Flash Briefing, hear the latest sports news from the ESPN Radio SportsCenter.
comment heading: Very poor showing for ESPN radio
review: Volume is out of control, content is not balanced amongst the sports and there is too much pre and post filler/marketing. Disabled until it improves.

name: Ravens Flash Briefing
description: The Baltimore Ravens Flash Briefing keeps fans connected with the team 365 days a year. Featuring daily updates from team writers, fans can catch up on the day’s biggest topics, including the latest news, injury reports, transactions, gameday info, team events and more. End each day with everything you need to know about the Ravens.

name: Bay Area Sports Tweets
description: Bay Sports Tweets informs you about the most recent tweet given by a bay area sports team you ask of. For example, just say "Alexa, ask Bay Sports Tweets to update me on the Golden State Warriors" or "Alexa, ask Bay Sports Tweets what the Giants tweeted recently". Alexa would then respond with the team's latest tweet.
maker: by Brian Tang and Chester Leung
review: Very easy to use and gives me just what I want! Nicely designed skill!

name: Jammin' Jon's Wrestling News.
description: Need your daily dose of what's going on in the WWE, TNA, ROH, NJPW, and the Indies? Don't want to check the dirtsheets? Leave it up to Jammin' Jon! He will provide you every single day with the latest news in Professional Wrestling. Don't miss out on this! It's better than a bodyslam!
review: This is a great skill that tells you everything about wrestling.

name: E Sport Odds
description:
E Sport Odds gives the game lines or odds based on the spread. E Sport Odds gives the lines for up to 10 games currently on the roster for the next 24 hours. E Sport Odds are updated hourly for all games, unless they are currently in play, or have been played, then information will not be given. This information is taken from an average of online sports books and is not guaranteed to be accurate. Please check your betting odds or game lines before placing your wagers.
 
This information and skill is sponsored by TheVegasBook.win

name: Baseball Live
description:
Find more information than the built-in MLB functions.

-See who is pitching or batting for your team
    - Ex: "Ask Baseball Live who is pitching for The Phillies"
-See what is currently happening in your team's game
    - Ex: "Ask Baseball Live what's the score of The Phillies game"
-See what play just happened in your team's game
    - Ex: "Ask Baseball Live what's happening in The Phillies game"
    - Ex: "Ask Baseball Live what just happened in The Phillies game"
-Check the standings
    - Ex: "Ask Baseball Live how many games back are The Mets"
-See the lines score
    - Ex: "Ask Baseball Live for the line score of The Phillies game"

Pro Version
-Get a team briefing including the score of the game, the standings in the division/wild card, and updates on the teams relevant in the standings
review: Still can't get an answer on starting pitchers.

name: IPL Cric
description:
IPL Alexa Skill Provides IPL fixtures & scores. 
Key features:
1. Provides schedule details for today, tomorrow, by team code or by team name. 
2. Provides live match scores. 

Example utterances 
Alexa, ask ipl cric whats the score?
Alexa, ask ipl cric what is CSK upcoming match?
Alexa, ask ipl cric when is RCB next match?
Alexa, ask ipl cric when is CSK versus RCB?
Alexa, ask ipl cric when is Chennai super kings vs Kings eleven Punjab?

Please mention the team code or exact team name. Team code & names for 2018:
CSK - Chennai Super Kings
RCB - Royal Challengers Bangalore
KKR - Kolkata Knight Riders
SRH - Sunrisers Hyderabad
KXIP - Kings XI Punjab
MI - Mumbai Indians
RR - Rajasthan Royals
DD - Delhi Daredevils
comment heading: Awesome skill ! Treat for cricket fans !
review: Answering all common questions for fixtures gracefully.

description:

Simply ask Alexa about players by using their full name, last name, or number and their team and she will tell you key information about them like their height, weight, class and hometown. 
Note: information is current as of the start of the season, if you find numbers have changed let me know as the teams sometimes shuffle those in the first week or so.
review: It's a helpful skill if you are specific in who you are asking for, you shouldn't say the word university after, or else it will be confused. It needs an update so you don't have to be so specific.

description: As part of your Flash Briefing, hear the latest sports news from the ESPN Radio SportsCenter.
review: The sound is fine. A little loud but guess what? You can adjust it. Get over it. It's the radio.

name: 93.7 The Fan Pittsburgh
description: The latest sports news and interview cuts from Pittsburgh hometown sports leader, 93-7 The Fan.
review: Hasn't updated content in over 3 weeks and would always be 1 or 2 days behind coming out of the weekend

name: Tiger bot
description: Tiger Bot gets Alexa to read a short phrase or play a short audio clip that is LSU related.
review: Great skill for showing off your LSU Tiger fandom!

name: Stadium Sounds
description: Get big game ready with the latest skill from ButtonPushApps.  This Alexa skill is used to celebrate TOUCHDOWNS and other big plays during American football games.  We  named this skill StadiumSounds.  This fun skill contains a sound file of a roaring tiger.  Invoke the skill each time your Tiger named sports team scores -  as a way to celebrate - just like you would hear if you were at the game live and in person!!  .
review: If you want to celebrate a big play with Alexa this Skill is for you. This Skill adds another level of enjoyment to watching games! It doesn't matter if everyone is supporting your team or not. I used my paired remote to activate the Skill and called out my friends without them noticing Alexa was on.  I would suggest using more sound effects and building a database of fight sounds, overall very enjoyable!

name: Cricket Information
description:
This skill allows you to get updates on Cricket. 
It keeps track of the upcoming games schedule.
Also, you could ask the score of the ongoing match.
review: Did not work. Also, can we simplify the command?

name: Football Facts
description: Some interesting facts about football
review: No working right

name: Upper Hand Fantasy
description:
The Upper Hand Fantasy skill provides you with instant answers to your start/sit questions in any given week, and even distinguishes between PPR and non-PPR. Once you open the skill by saying "Alexa, open Upper Hand Fantasy," Alexa will ask you to give two names to compare. You can say something like "David Johnson or Jordan Howard" and it will respond with an answer based on our latest rankings. 

Our rankings are updated multiple times a week to reflect on the latest news and updates throughout the NFL landscape. Even if you are not inside the skill, you can ask like so: "Alexa, ask Upper Hand Fantasy who to start between David Johnson and Le'veon Bell." It will give you an instant answer. More features will be coming soon! Check us out at upperhandfantasy,com!

name: ESPN Radio (via TuneIn)
description: As part of your Flash Briefing, hear the latest sports news from the ESPN Radio SportsCenter.
review: Horrible!! Every other app for Echo has a consistent volume level but this. The volume is unbearably loud and distorted. Can't even rate the content because it's too loud and embarrassing on a brilliant piece of technology.

name: Cricket Info
description:
You can ask for brief, detailed or quick score updates. You can ask for score or schedule for any team. Examples, 
“Alexa, ask cricket info to get score update” gets brief score update of all on going matches.
“Alexa, ask cricket info to get team India schedule” gets schedule of team India cricket matches.
"Alexa, ask cricket info to get IPL update" gets score updates for ongoing IPL matches. 
“Alexa, ask cricket info to get quick score update” gets score summary for all ongoing matches, you can optionally request quick score for a team.
“Alexa, ask cricket info to get team Australia detailed score” gets detailed score for ongoing match of team Australia.
review: Its nice

name: Jammin' Jon's Wrestling News.
description: Need your daily dose of what's going on in the WWE, TNA, ROH, NJPW, and the Indies? Don't want to check the dirtsheets? Leave it up to Jammin' Jon! He will provide you every single day with the latest news in Professional Wrestling. Don't miss out on this! It's better than a bodyslam!

name: Game Lines
description:
Grabs up to date spreads and over/under odds for upcoming NFL, NBA, and NCAA Division 1 games. 

Ask game lines for a team name, followed optionally by what sport you want to know about.

For example, "Alexa, ask game lines for the West Virginia college basketball game."

Odds are provided by http://www.betonline.ag and made available shortly after they are posted on their website.

If you prompt her "Alexa, Bear Down" she will continue to sing the fight song through to the end. Join in with her or let her sing solo.

review: Only con is that it’s a lot louder than the rest of my news flash

name: ESPN
description:
Get your sports radio fix with the ESPN skill. From Mike and Mike to Dan Le Batard and Stu Gotz, this skill brings you live ESPN Radio, several ESPN affiliate stations, and hourly news updates.  

Say, "Tell me the news," "Play the radio," or ask for your local ESPN radio station to access the best in sports radio content.

Supported radio stations include:
- ESPN Radio
- ESPN Deportes Radio
- ESPN Chicago (WMVP 1000 AM)
- ESPN Los Angeles (KSPN 710 AM)
- ESPN New York (WEPN 98.7 FM)
- ESPN Deportes New York (WEPN 1050 AM)
review: Works pretty good...but seems to want to timeout quite often. Also, the volume of the app is too low. Have to increase volume of device drastically once in the app to get sound loud enough to hear.

name: Who's on First?
description:
Who's on first? What's on second? For the first time ever, hear the world famous Abbott & Costello baseball themed comedy routine spoken by a virtual assistant. Play ball!

If you enjoyed this skill, please tell a friend and remember to leave it a 5 star review in your Alexa app. Thanks in advance!!!
review: sorry for 3 stars. this should be  given with 2 different voices3!

name: Calling The Hogs
description:
We have always loved Alexa and now we know why... she's a Razorback fan!
Calling The Hogs is a perfect game-day addition for your Amazon Device!
Impress your friends, family & coworkers while showing off that Razorback Pride!
comment heading: Needs a better quality audio clip
review: As this app does only one thing, it really should be better. I had music playing, which appropriately muted and Alexa said, “Let’s call those Hogs!,” which was actually very muddled, but I could overlook that part had the call been better. It was probably 5 notches quieter on the volume control than what I had been listening to, and I had to strain to hear it. I have my Echo Spot connected to a [very high quality] speaker (apparently we cannot use other brand names in reviews), so sufficed to say, it wasn’t the sub quality mono speaker at fault. It sounded like someone just had their tv on, recorded it on their phone from across the room, then posted it as an Alexa skill. I mean, if you’re going to post it, I’m sure UA would provide you an HD or UHD audio clip, or even better would be a video clip. That way you get to witness the spectacle of Razorback Nation as well as actually hearing it clearly. But that’s just a suggestion. At the very least, you could have a Razorback on my screen. I do like that I don’t need to stop my other skill to use it. I could be listening to the game, a commercial break comes along and I could just have an impromptu hog call-which sometimes happens!

comment heading: So much more interesting than getting a rundown of box ...
review: So much more interesting than getting a rundown of box scores. Way faster than listening to 30 minutes of ESPN. 90SD is a winner.

name: District on Deck
description:
Are you a huge Washington Nationals fan? Then you need the District on Deck Flash Briefing Skill by FanSided to get the latest news, opinions and rumors on the Nationals. 

District on Deck is the Washington Nationals news and opinions site brought to you by the FanSided Network. This site also serves as a community for like-minded fans to come together to catch up on the latest news and to discuss their passion.

Easy to get specific "games back" baseball updates. This is also a nice visual on Amazon Echo Show!  We can't wait to show off next week for friends we're having over for a party!  Kudos to the developer!

name: Irish 101

name: NHL
description:
The Official NHL Skill is the best way for hockey fans using Alexa to get detailed information on NHL scores, schedules, standings and current players.

Open the skill by saying, “Alexa, open NHL.”

To check scores, you can ask Alexa questions such as “Ask NHL, what is the score of the Red Wings game?”  You can ask for game previews and recaps as well as real-time updates during every NHL game.

To get team schedules, you can ask Alexa questions such as “Ask NHL, when is the next Sharks game?” or “Who do the Maple Leafs play tomorrow?

You can also ask for biographical and statistical information on every current NHL player.
 
To set reminders 30 minutes before the start of your favorite team’s game, “Ask NHL, reminders”  

The Official NHL Skill is available on the Echo Dot, Echo Spot, Echo Show, Fire TV and all Alexa enabled devices 

Created by the National Hockey League
review: I can’t set a reminder for upcoming games. How does it work?

name: Baseball Reference
description:
Welcome to the Baseball Reference Alexa application. This application makes finding out leaders in certain statistics as easy as just asking. As of right now this app can only return top ranking and you cannot make request by specific players or team statistics.

Users are able to request a multitude of different statistics that can be further specified by rank (1-10), top amount (top two, top three, top four, etc.) year (1871 - present), and league (All of Baseball, National League or American League). 

Here are some initial example requests:
-------------------------------------------
Alexa, ask Baseball Reference who is third in the National League in home runs.

Who leads the league in doubles?

Who lead the American League in wins in nineteen eighty six?

Who is the oldest player in the league?

Alexa, ask Baseball Reference, in nineteen ninety nine, who lead the league in home runs?

Who was top three in strikeouts?

Who was tenth in wins in the National League in nineteen seventy two
-------------------------------------------

Another feature available to users is that after a user makes a successful request and are prompted to ask another question, a user can build upon their previous request.


For Example:
-------------------------------------------
User Requests - "Alexa, ask Baseball Reference who was second in the National League in hits in nineteen eighty three"

Alexa Responds - "Rafael Ramirez was second in the National League with 185 Hits in 1983."

The user can now request a few things:

- Next -
User Requests - "Who was next?"
Alexa Responds -  "Al Oliver was third in the National League with 184 Hits in 1983."

- Previous -
User Requests - "Who was previous?"
Alexa Responds -  "Jose Cruz and Andre Dawson were tied for first in the National League with 189 Hits In 1983 ."

- Rank -
User Requests - "Who was sixth?"
Alexa Responds -  "Dickie Thon was sixth in the National League with 177 Hits In 1983."

- Top -
User Requests - "Who was top three?"
Alexa Responds -  "Jose Cruz and Andre Dawson were tied for first in the National League with 189 Hits In 1983. Rafael Ramirez was second in the National League with 185 Hits In 1983. Al Oliver was third in the National League with 184 Hits In 1983."
-------------------------------------------

Statistics To Request
-----------------------
// Hitting
Singles
Doubles
Triples
Home runs
RBIs
Runs
Stolen bases
Caught stealing
Batting average
Hits
Wins above replacement
Slugging percentage
Extra base hits
Total bases
On base percentage
Walks
Intentional walks
Sacrifice flies
At bats per home run
Grounded into double plays

// Pitching
Earned Run Average
Strikeouts
Strikes per walk
Strikeouts per nine innings
WHIP
Wins
Shutouts
Saves
Innings Pitches

//Misc
Oldest Player
Youngest Player

If you have any questions or comments regarding this application please feel free to reach out to us at ottomanellibaseball@gmail.com.
review: I think the skill should be able to find a particular statistic of a player. (Such as "How many doubles did Paul Goldschmidt have in 2017"). For leaders of a particular statistic its great.

name: Ski Conditions Buddy
description:
*** Please note that due to a change in policy, weatherunlocked.com will no longer provide this information for free.  Therefore this skill will cease to function as of March 1, 2018. 

If I can find another source of data, I will update this skill to use it.  ***

This Ski Buddy skill provides current weather and ski conditions for some NY ski resorts.

Currently, conditions for the Bristol Mountain ski resort in Canandaigua, NY, Holiday Valley ski resort in Ellicottville, NY, Swain Resort in Swain NY, and Greek Peak mountain resort in Cortland, NY are supported.

This skill is neither endorsed or sponsored by any ski resort.

Note: Occasionally Ski Buddy has trouble getting the conditions and will report an error.  Waiting a minute and trying again will generally be successful.

Weather and ski condition data provided by MyWeather2.com.

review: Ads,ads,ads,ads. don't Waste your time

name: NASCAR
description:
Keep up to date on all the latest from NASCAR including the schedule, race results and live updates. 

Listen to the podcast, live broadcast radio and driver in-car audio. Note, in-car audio and podcast may contain profanity.

While using NASCAR, you can ask Alexa to play the Podcast, ask about the next race, who is winning the current race, and who won the previous race.
review: Wish they would include in car audio for trucks and xfinity, other then that works good.

name: Live Cricket News
description: Alexa skill to get live cricket news
review: This flash briefing gives me the cricket news very quickly. Its nice to quickly gets scores. All I have to say to my Alexa is "Alexa, News Update" and it gives me the latest scores. Some of the pronunciations are little weird - but its good enough to get quick updates of the scores when a game is on.

name: NBA Flash Briefing
description: Follow the latest news and game recaps from around the NBA within Alexa's Flash Briefing. After enabling the skill, say things like "Alexa, what's my flash briefing?" Or, "Alexa, what's in the news" to hear your flash briefings. Go to Settings in your Alexa app and find "Flash Briefing" to move NBA Flash Briefing to the top of your news brief.
comment heading: Clean, quick, and just the info I want
review: I love the NBA focus without all the other stuff.

name: Bike Stats
description:
A skill to access your Strava cycling achievements and statistics.

At this time only cycling Strava activities are reported.

Virtual rides i.e. zwift/trainers are now included in the reported statistics.

You must link your Strava account to the skill using the Alexa app/webpage.

Supported commands:

Alexa, Ask Bike Stats .....

• about my last ride
Detailed information about your last ride

• about my weekly stats
The number of times and distance you've ridden in the last week

• about my summary
Monthly and annual statistics

• to get my achievements
Lists any KOM/QOM records you may hold

• to get my details
Your name/location and other basic Strava information

• to setup units
Sets your unit preferences for distance covered and height climbed


This skill is Powered by Strava but is an independent creation.

If you have any questions or feedback, please contact alexa@knownentity.com
review: It works as promised and nice to hear my stats just after arriving home from a ride;-)

review: Very cool skill

review: Repetitive questions and some answers are wrong. Example- The Denver Broncos have won three Super Bowls, not one as the game indicates.

skills-rest: The Rookie's Guide to the NFL
name: The Rookie's Guide to the NFL
description:
The Rookie's Guide to the NFL is your official way to learn about the National Football League. Become an expert by asking about the rules, penalties, scoring plays, commentator lingo, previous Super Bowls, team formations, and more.

After enabling the skill, say 'Open NFL' or 'Launch NFL' to use The Rookie's Guide.

Once you've opened the skill, you can say things like:
-What is defensive pass interference?
-How many players are on a team?
-Who won Super Bowl 35?
-What's the difference between a running back and a wide receiver?
-Tell me about the Music City Miracle
-How tall is Aaron Rodgers?
-What does ‘move the chains’ mean?
Or, just say 'Surprise me' to hear a new definition

If you get stuck within the skill, say 'Alexa, what does this skill do?' to hear more options.
review: app opens when you state the entire title. Gives good explanations. would be better if it gave animation too. i like it.

name: Baseball News
description: This skill tells you everything you should know about baseball, and updates every day.
review: This skill doesn't give you enough information. It rarely gives you the team name or player. You would have to be a diehard fan or already know who or what team, player, or event that is being referenced. Absolutely horrible.

name: Team Time
description: Enable this free skill, and speak to your teamSNAP account from any Amazon Alexa device.  Now everyone in your family can ask about the next game or practice.  This is a life saver for parents that have kids in organized sports.  Find out practice times, game locations, and jersey color for any scheduled event for your team.
comment heading: Visible Calendar on Show would be nice
review: It’s alright if you want to keep answering questions for multiple teams and going through the process just to find out about a practice. would be better if you could sync the teamsnap calendar to show on the echo show.

name: Marshawn Lynch's BeastMode
description:
The BeastMode Skill is a fun and informative skill. This skill allows you to say things like: 

Press Conference Questions

Alexa, Ask BeastMode... 

how was that defense?
how was the game?
what are you going to do after the game?
how are you feeling?
what's next for you?

review: Greatest thing ever, period!

name: Coach Harbaugh
description:
Need to get fired up? Of course you don't - you are already attacking today with an enthusiasm unknown to mankind. But how about having your own personal Jim Harbaugh to entertain you on game day? Or on Mondays. Or every single morning while you wash down your steak breakfast with whole milk. 

You can say:
1. Alexa, ask Coach Harbaugh for a quote
2. Alexa, ask Coach Harbaugh to play "The Victors"
3. Alexa, ask Coach Harbaugh WHO'S GOT IT BETTER THAN US!?

Please note that this skill is not affiliated with the University of Michigan in any way. I'm just a fan with the constitutional right to share Jim Harbaugh's wisdom with you.

Special thanks to Sibish Basheer for making this possible.
comment heading: Hail! A must for U of M fans...

With the Overwatch League skill you can keep track of when your favorite teams are playing and always know the current league standings. name: Baseball Reference
description:
Welcome to the Baseball Reference Alexa application. This application makes finding out leaders in certain statistics as easy as just asking. As of right now this app can only return top ranking and you cannot make request by specific players or team statistics.

Users are able to request a multitude of different statistics that can be further specified by rank (1-10), top amount (top two, top three, top four, etc.) year (1871 - present), and league (All of Baseball, National League or American League). 

Here are some initial example requests:
-------------------------------------------
Alexa, ask Baseball Reference who is third in the National League in home runs.

Who leads the league in doubles?

Who lead the American League in wins in nineteen eighty six?

Who is the oldest player in the league?

Alexa, ask Baseball Reference, in nineteen ninety nine, who lead the league in home runs?

Who was top three in strikeouts?

Who was tenth in wins in the National League in nineteen seventy two
-------------------------------------------

Another feature available to users is that after a user makes a successful request and are prompted to ask another question, a user can build upon their previous request.


For Example:
-------------------------------------------
User Requests - "Alexa, ask Baseball Reference who was second in the National League in hits in nineteen eighty three"

Alexa Responds - "Rafael Ramirez was second in the National League with 185 Hits in 1983."

The user can now request a few things:

- Next -
User Requests - "Who was next?"
Alexa Responds -  "Al Oliver was third in the National League with 184 Hits in 1983."

- Previous -
User Requests - "Who was previous?"
Alexa Responds -  "Jose Cruz and Andre Dawson were tied for first in the National League with 189 Hits In 1983 ."

- Rank -
User Requests - "Who was sixth?"
Alexa Responds -  "Dickie Thon was sixth in the National League with 177 Hits In 1983."

- Top -
User Requests - "Who was top three?"
Alexa Responds -  "Jose Cruz and Andre Dawson were tied for first in the National League with 189 Hits In 1983. Rafael Ramirez was second in the National League with 185 Hits In 1983. Al Oliver was third in the National League with 184 Hits In 1983."
-------------------------------------------

Statistics To Request
-----------------------
// Hitting
Singles
Doubles
Triples
Home runs
RBIs
Runs
Stolen bases
Caught stealing
Batting average
Hits
Wins above replacement
Slugging percentage
Extra base hits
Total bases
On base percentage
Walks
Intentional walks
Sacrifice flies
At bats per home run
Grounded into double plays

// Pitching
Earned Run Average
Strikeouts
Strikes per walk
Strikeouts per nine innings
WHIP
Wins
Shutouts
Saves
Innings Pitches

//Misc
Oldest Player
Youngest Player

If you have any questions or comments regarding this application please feel free to reach out to us at ottomanellibaseball@gmail.com.

Simply ask Alexa for a hockey fact, and she'll saucer pass one right to you. Take a 2-minute minor for quizzing Alexa on hockey, and you may find yourself in the Penalty Box!

name: Daily Alphabet Affirmation
description:
Alphabet Affirmation is a skill to help you upgrade how you feel instantly.  Unlike other affirmation skills which give you a one liner affirmation, the Alphabet Affirmation Skill is designed to take you on a short mental break via reciting a series of affirmative and uplifting words from A to Z that will guarantee a positive feel good distraction from life and brings you back into the positive vibration.


You can say:

"Alexa, open Alphabet Affirmation"
"Alexa, start Alphabet Affirmation"
"Alexa, start Alphabet Affirmation"

Please leave a 5-star review if you love this skill, or send us an email with your suggestions at (feedback@aialchemy.com). Your 5-star reviews encourage us to keep making more great skills, thanks!

Credits:  The "Alphabet Affirmation Skill" is entirely created by "Amir Harouni" and was inspired by the teachings of "Jesse Elder".  Please visit www.JesseElder.com if you are interested in finding out more.

**Version 2.0 Update**
If you are interested in improving your soccer skills, this is the Skill for you! Soccer Drills is a skill that was designed to improve soccer skills using several common drills, in a fun manner. Drills include tick tocks, toe touches, juggling, and more. 

To get started, say "Alexa, Start Soccer Drills", and you will be prompted to select a drill, and can immediately start to improve your soccer game.

Please share any feedback, as we are anxious to make this a great aid to your soccer game!

Hosted by Jerod Morris, this short flash briefing will keep you up-to-date on what's going on with your Hoosiers on the court and on the recruiting trail, with occasional nods to important historical events as well.
review: I love the couple of episodes I listened to. I'm a huge NBA fan, and know a lot about Indiana basketball, from Reggie Miller to the Isaiah Thomas as the coach and Ron Artest.. I mean, Metta WorldPeace, captain Jack, and all the way to Victor Oladipo, but I'm a complete noob when it comes to IIU hoops. And that's why I'm gonna be listening to this show as part of my morning briefing. Great show, guys! Keep up the good work. - Ravi Jayagopal , Podcast host, SubscribeMe.fm

name: SunUps
description:
SunUps is a 12 step mind and body exercise routine based on the ancient yogic practice of Surya Namaskar. The skill allows you to do the following:

BROWSE
Say Alexa, Ask Sunups to begin browse mode.
In this mode, you can browse through the steps by saying NEXT, REPEAT or START OVER. Listen to detailed instructions for each step and practice replicating each pose.

TRAIN
Say Alexa, Ask Sunups to begin training mode.
The skill provides a training module for those who are unaware of the steps involved in Surya Namaskar. Follow along with Alexa till you are comfortable doing SunUps on your own. Listen to detailed instructions to replicate each pose. Alexa will keep track of the number of sets you do.

TIP OF THE DAY!
Alexa, ask Sunups to tell me a tip/fact OR tip of the day.
The app provides detailed information about the various benefits of making SunUps a daily practice and the various ways to deepen your practice. 

DO
Alexa, ask Sunups to start expert mode.
Once you have learned how to do SunUps or are already familiar with them, you are ready to start doing them and let Alexa track your progress for you! Try to complete all levels to become a Sunups ninja! This mode provides Sun chants and Flute music accompaniment to elevate your experience.


SCORE
Alexa, ask Sunups for my score.
Alexa, ask Sunups to reset my score.

Alexa will tell you what level you are on and how many Sunups you will need to go to the next one! 

ALTERNATE NOSTRIL BREATHING/ BELLY BREATHING
Alexa, Ask Sunups to Begin breathing exercise.

Use calming flute music as an accompaniment for your daily 10-minute pranayama or breathing exercises. View the card for instructions.

MEDITATE

Alexa, ask Sunups to start guided relaxation.
Relax your body and mind with awareness using the 9-minute guided relaxation track provided. You may use the guided relaxation track to relax whenever you feel stressed or anxious.

Alexa, ask Sunups to start sun chants
You can use the 4-minute sun chants track for an energizing meditation experience.

*DISCLAIMER: Please seek your doctor's advice before you start these exercises. The information provided are tips and should be not considered as medical advice. *
comment heading: I like it, a mental workout!
review: This Skill makes a good attempt at becoming your one stop shop for mental exercise. It uses skill cards and keeps track of your process. The only issue is that the audio that plays seems to be recorded with Alexa’s voice and sound less then average. one and a half thumbs up!

name: NBA
description:
Welcome to the new NBA Alexa Skill! You can interact with me in several ways:

(1) Open me by saying "Alexa, open NBA." You should always start your conversation with me this way.  This will trigger the welcome menu and tell you how to listen to live NBA action, check scores, and get schedule info. 

After you’ve opened the NBA skill…

(2) **To LISTEN TO A GAME**, tell me “Play the Cavs game" or “Stream the Atlanta game."  Most games have the home and away announcers, just say the team name for the announcers you want and we'll start streaming.  If Alexa has trouble recognizing your team name, be sure and use the city AND team name together, like “Houston Rockets.”

(3) To ask about the SCHEDULE, say “What games are on today?” OR “When do the Warriors play?”  Ask about a specific team to get broadcaster information for upcoming games.  

(4) Ask me about SCORES by saying, “What is the score of the Milwaukee Bucks game?” OR “What are the latest scores?"  

Additionally after opening the skill, you can say things to me like:

Who is playing now?
When do the Celtics play the Lakers?
What time are the Memphis Grizzlies on?
Did the Thunder win on Monday?

**You will need to login from the Alexa companion app with a valid NBA League Pass subscription in order to listen to games.  Visit www.nba.com/leaguepass to sign up today.

description:

HOW TO USE:

Say "What is the current ranking of {player name}"
For example "What is the current ranking of Rafael Nadal"

{player name} - Player Name (ex. Rafael Nadal, Roger Federer, Novak Djokovic etc)

Say "Who is the current number {ranking} player"
For example "Who is the current number one player"

{ranking} - No (1 - 500)

Say "Who are the current top {index} players in the world"
For example "Who are the current top 10 players in the world"

{index} - No (1 - 25)

For any of the above interactions, you can also use the one-shot phrasing.

For example 
"Open a. t. p. Rankings and get me the current ranking of Rafael Nadal"
"Open a. t. p. Rankings and get me the current number three player"
"Open a. t. p. Rankings and get the top 5 players"
comment heading: This is so awesome. Come quite handy whenever I want to know ...
review: This is so awesome. Comes quite handy whenever I want to know the ratings of any of my favorite players.

name: Coach Harbaugh

Need to get fired up? Of course you don't - you are already attacking today with an enthusiasm unknown to mankind. But how about having your own personal Jim Harbaugh to entertain you on game day? Or on Mondays. Or every single morning while you wash down your steak breakfast with whole milk. 

You can say:
1. Alexa, ask Coach Harbaugh for a quote
2. Alexa, ask Coach Harbaugh to play "The Victors"
3. Alexa, ask Coach Harbaugh WHO'S GOT IT BETTER THAN US!?

Please note that this skill is not affiliated with the University of Michigan in any way. I'm just a fan with the constitutional right to share Jim Harbaugh's wisdom with you.

Special thanks to Sibish Basheer for making this possible.

– player scores and injury updates.

name: NCAA March Madness
description:
NCAA March Madness for Alexa delivers real-time tournament scores, schedules, information about your Bracket Picks, and live radio for each game.

To ask for help or give feedback on this skill please contact mmlivehelp@turner.com
