name: Utah Fishing
description:
Are you headed out the door to your favorite Utah fishing spot and need to know what the fishing is like? Utah Fishing gives you the most up-to-date fishing report including: status, species, and full report!
Open the skill by saying, “Alexa, open Utah Fishing.” Next, simply ask for the specific fishing spot. You can say, “Alexa, what’s the fishing report for Strawberry Reservoir?” Or, without opening the skill, simply ask Alexa for the report all in one command. You can say, “Alexa, ask Utah Fishing for the fishing report at Lake Powell.”
If at any point you need help simply ask Alexa for possible commands by saying, “Alexa help.”
For an interactive fishing reports map visit: https://wildlife.utah.gov/hotspots/
comment heading: Makes you want to go fishing this weekend
review: This skill gives you regular updates to fishing information across the state of Utah. Really comprehensive and well done!

name: 90-Second Drill
description: This twice-daily podcast is for fans that want the story behind the scores. Dan Schwartzman, noted NBC sports radio host, joins Otto Radio to break the most important stories in the world of sports. When the buzzer sounds, you’re 90 seconds from being in the know.

name: theScore Sports
description: Whether a casual or hardcore sports fan, theScore skill gives you all the information you need to be kept up to date. You'll get top news, trade rumors, stats and scores for all of the leagues you care about.
review:
In the fall this app gave a summery of the final scores of major league games from the night before. It was quick, simple, and relevant. Now, the talk radio style is both irrelevant in its presentation of information and poorly executed. Some of these people sound like they’ve never been on air. The volume balance between the lead in/ tail out music and the “news” is horrible. The music blares and the voices are so soft I can hardly hear.
Bring back the old format. Work on your sound balance so this app is actually useable.

name: StatMuse
description:
StatMuse lets you explore sports statistics, schedules and scores in a whole new way, straight from your favorite players and personalities. Say "Alexa, ask StatMuse who has the most career receiving yards?" and hear Jerry Rice tell you about his record. Then try "Who had the most touchdowns last season?" to hear from David Johnson. Ask "When are the Falcons playing next?" to have Devonta Freeman give you his game schedule.



StatMuse provides instant answers to your NBA, NFL, MLB & NHL questions and features the authentic voices of Peyton Manning, Le'Veon Bell, Drew Brees, Terrell Owens, Jerry Rice and other players, plus Scott Van Pelt and Joe Buck. StatMuse is the officially licensed AI of the NFL Players Association.

Start by asking:
"Alexa, open Statmuse…"

“How did the Eagles do?”
"Who had the most passing yards in a season?"
After hearing Drew Brees answer, ask "Where did you go to college?" or "How many touchdowns did you have last season?"

"Who won the World Series in 1945?"
"Which pitcher had the most strikeouts last year?"
After hearing the answer, ask "What is his career ERA?"

"How did Steph Curry do last season?"
“Who do the Rockets play this week?”

“What hockey games are on tonight?”
“Tell me about the Golden Knights.”
StatMuse has comprehensive stats going back to 1947 for the NBA, 1920 for the NFL, 1876 for MLB and 1917 for the NHL.

Here are just a few of the stats now available to you, instantly: https://www.statmuse.com/getting-started/examples

name: Baseball Reference
description:
Welcome to the Baseball Reference Alexa application. This application makes finding out leaders in certain statistics as easy as just asking. As of right now this app can only return top ranking and you cannot make request by specific players or team statistics.

Users are able to request a multitude of different statistics that can be further specified by rank (1-10), top amount (top two, top three, top four, etc.) year (1871 - present), and league (All of Baseball, National League or American League). 

Here are some initial example requests:
-------------------------------------------
Alexa, ask Baseball Reference who is third in the National League in home runs.

Who leads the league in doubles?

Who lead the American League in wins in nineteen eighty six?

Who is the oldest player in the league?

Alexa, ask Baseball Reference, in nineteen ninety nine, who lead the league in home runs?

Who was top three in strikeouts?

Who was tenth in wins in the National League in nineteen seventy two
-------------------------------------------

Another feature available to users is that after a user makes a successful request and are prompted to ask another question, a user can build upon their previous request.


For Example:
-------------------------------------------
User Requests - "Alexa, ask Baseball Reference who was second in the National League in hits in nineteen eighty three"

Alexa Responds - "Rafael Ramirez was second in the National League with 185 Hits in 1983."

The user can now request a few things:

- Next -
User Requests - "Who was next?"
Alexa Responds -  "Al Oliver was third in the National League with 184 Hits in 1983."

- Previous -
User Requests - "Who was previous?"
Alexa Responds -  "Jose Cruz and Andre Dawson were tied for first in the National League with 189 Hits In 1983 ."

- Rank -
User Requests - "Who was sixth?"
Alexa Responds -  "Dickie Thon was sixth in the National League with 177 Hits In 1983."

- Top -
User Requests - "Who was top three?"
Alexa Responds -  "Jose Cruz and Andre Dawson were tied for first in the National League with 189 Hits In 1983. Rafael Ramirez was second in the National League with 185 Hits In 1983. Al Oliver was third in the National League with 184 Hits In 1983."
-------------------------------------------

Statistics To Request
-----------------------
// Hitting
Singles
Doubles
Triples
Home runs
RBIs
Runs
Stolen bases
Caught stealing
Batting average
Hits
Wins above replacement
Slugging percentage
Extra base hits
Total bases
On base percentage
Walks
Intentional walks
Sacrifice flies
At bats per home run
Grounded into double plays

// Pitching
Earned Run Average
Strikeouts
Strikes per walk
Strikeouts per nine innings
WHIP
Wins
Shutouts
Saves
Innings Pitches

//Misc
Oldest Player
Youngest Player

If you have any questions or comments regarding this application please feel free to reach out to us at ottomanellibaseball@gmail.com.

name: One Minute Workout Sensei
description:
UPDATE: Michael just added another workout because he wants you to get RIPPED fast! (workouts will play randomly so you never know what you're going to get)

Join Michael, your One Minute Workout Sensei, as he helps you gain muscle and lose weight--right from your very own kitchen! It only takes one minute per day for noticeable results. 

ABOUT YOUR SENSEI: Michael is a high-energy, over-the-top, passionate Navy SEAL-style instructor, who exercises 24/7. He wants to take YOU to the next level--and he'll make DARN SURE you get there.

review: PERFECT!

name: NASCAR
description:
Keep up to date on all the latest from NASCAR including the schedule, race results and live updates. 

Listen to the podcast, live broadcast radio and driver in-car audio. Note, in-car audio and podcast may contain profanity.

While using NASCAR, you can ask Alexa to play the Podcast, ask about the next race, who is winning the current race, and who won the previous race.
review: Race just ended and asked Alexa where Danica Patrick finished and she kept saying 'Danica Patrick did not qualify' when she ran the race and finished 26th. Stupid.

name: StatMuse
description:
StatMuse lets you explore sports statistics, schedules and scores in a whole new way, straight from your favorite players and personalities. Say "Alexa, ask StatMuse who has the most career receiving yards?" and hear Jerry Rice tell you about his record. Then try "Who had the most touchdowns last season?" to hear from David Johnson. Ask "When are the Falcons playing next?" to have Devonta Freeman give you his game schedule.



StatMuse provides instant answers to your NBA, NFL, MLB & NHL questions and features the authentic voices of Peyton Manning, Le'Veon Bell, Drew Brees, Terrell Owens, Jerry Rice and other players, plus Scott Van Pelt and Joe Buck. StatMuse is the officially licensed AI of the NFL Players Association.

Start by asking:
"Alexa, open Statmuse…"

“How did the Eagles do?”
"Who had the most passing yards in a season?"
After hearing Drew Brees answer, ask "Where did you go to college?" or "How many touchdowns did you have last season?"

"Who won the World Series in 1945?"
"Which pitcher had the most strikeouts last year?"
After hearing the answer, ask "What is his career ERA?"

"How did Steph Curry do last season?"
“Who do the Rockets play this week?”

“What hockey games are on tonight?”
“Tell me about the Golden Knights.”
StatMuse has comprehensive stats going back to 1947 for the NBA, 1920 for the NFL, 1876 for MLB and 1917 for the NHL.

Here are just a few of the stats now available to you, instantly: https://www.statmuse.com/getting-started/examples
review: It's crazy how realistic this is, did they record each possible line??

name: FanDuel: Pick 6
description:
Strap on your helmet and get ready for FanDuel: Pick 6! During the regular season, make six predictions about what you think will happen during the Sunday Night and Monday Night football games. Watch the game, all from the comfort of your couch, check in for updates, and see how many picks you can get right each time you play!

Simply say “Alexa, Open FanDuel” and get started today.
review: I played this weekend.  Made my picks in the morning, and checked how I was doing during the game.  Pretty fun experience, and the coach character was great.  Fanduel sent me an offer to enter a game on their website after, not sure if I will play there, but a pretty smooth experience relative to other Alexa games I have played.  It's cool that it changes every day based on the real games.  I also played the Trivia game, which I did well on.

name: SunUps
description:
SunUps is a 12 step mind and body exercise routine based on the ancient yogic practice of Surya Namaskar. The skill allows you to do the following:

BROWSE
Say Alexa, Ask Sunups to begin browse mode.
In this mode, you can browse through the steps by saying NEXT, REPEAT or START OVER. Listen to detailed instructions for each step and practice replicating each pose.

TRAIN
Say Alexa, Ask Sunups to begin training mode.
The skill provides a training module for those who are unaware of the steps involved in Surya Namaskar. Follow along with Alexa till you are comfortable doing SunUps on your own. Listen to detailed instructions to replicate each pose. Alexa will keep track of the number of sets you do.

TIP OF THE DAY!
Alexa, ask Sunups to tell me a tip/fact OR tip of the day.
The app provides detailed information about the various benefits of making SunUps a daily practice and the various ways to deepen your practice. 

DO
Alexa, ask Sunups to start expert mode.
Once you have learned how to do SunUps or are already familiar with them, you are ready to start doing them and let Alexa track your progress for you! Try to complete all levels to become a Sunups ninja! This mode provides Sun chants and Flute music accompaniment to elevate your experience.


SCORE
Alexa, ask Sunups for my score.
Alexa, ask Sunups to reset my score.

Alexa will tell you what level you are on and how many Sunups you will need to go to the next one! 

ALTERNATE NOSTRIL BREATHING/ BELLY BREATHING
Alexa, Ask Sunups to Begin breathing exercise.

Use calming flute music as an accompaniment for your daily 10-minute pranayama or breathing exercises. View the card for instructions.

MEDITATE

Alexa, ask Sunups to start guided relaxation.
Relax your body and mind with awareness using the 9-minute guided relaxation track provided. You may use the guided relaxation track to relax whenever you feel stressed or anxious.

Alexa, ask Sunups to start sun chants
You can use the 4-minute sun chants track for an energizing meditation experience.

*DISCLAIMER: Please seek your doctor's advice before you start these exercises. The information provided are tips and should be not considered as medical advice. *
review: I enjoyed the mind bo

name: Impossibly Hard Major League Baseball Quiz
description:
This skill quizzes you on a whole bunch of baseball records. These questions range from standard records to extremely obscure records. You'll be asked five questions at one time. You can play again simply by saying "play again". Right now, there are about twenty total questions (so four games), but we will be a adding more weekly. 

It's not meant to be beaten. It's meant to beat YOU down! I will constantly be adding new and more obscure questions. If you don't want feel badly about how little you really know about baseball, don't take this quiz. If you do take it, please don't blame me.

Content is pretty good, but pronunciations and inflexions are atrocious, making understanding way too difficult.
Whether this the Skill or Alexa's text to voice capability I don't know. However, pronunciations are terrible and even more problematic is the incorrect insertion and omission of pauses.

name: NBA
description:
Welcome to the new NBA Alexa Skill! You can interact with me in several ways:

(1) Open me by saying "Alexa, open NBA." You should always start your conversation with me this way.  This will trigger the welcome menu and tell you how to listen to live NBA action, check scores, and get schedule info. 

After you’ve opened the NBA skill…

(2) **To LISTEN TO A GAME**, tell me “Play the Cavs game" or “Stream the Atlanta game."  Most games have the home and away announcers, just say the team name for the announcers you want and we'll start streaming.  If Alexa has trouble recognizing your team name, be sure and use the city AND team name together, like “Houston Rockets.”

(3) To ask about the SCHEDULE, say “What games are on today?” OR “When do the Warriors play?”  Ask about a specific team to get broadcaster information for upcoming games.  

(4) Ask me about SCORES by saying, “What is the score of the Milwaukee Bucks game?” OR “What are the latest scores?"  

Additionally after opening the skill, you can say things to me like:

Who is playing now?
When do the Celtics play the Lakers?

**You will need to login from the Alexa companion app with a valid NBA League Pass subscription in order to listen to games.  Visit www.nba.com/leaguepass to sign up today.
comment heading: I'm really impressed with NBA's new skill. Most skills ...
review: I'm really impressed with NBA's new skill.  Most skills only work if I say something just right, and this thing can do so much and seems to always be able to do what I'm asking.  Tell me who's playing tonight or tomorrow, listen to the games themselves, or just give me the score.  Well done, NBA. You can tell they invested a lot of time, and they did it right.

name: Cricket Info
description:
You can ask for brief, detailed or quick score updates. You can ask for score or schedule for any team. Examples, 
“Alexa, ask cricket info to get score update” gets brief score update of all on going matches.
“Alexa, ask cricket info to get team India schedule” gets schedule of team India cricket matches.
"Alexa, ask cricket info to get IPL update" gets score updates for ongoing IPL matches. 
“Alexa, ask cricket info to get quick score update” gets score summary for all ongoing matches, you can optionally request quick score for a team.
“Alexa, ask cricket info to get team Australia detailed score” gets detailed score for ongoing match of team Australia.
review: Pretty neat Skill to have at Home.

name: White Sox Baseball Fan Trivia
description:
White Sox baseball trivia was amassed by a long time fan. This new skill brings Indians baseball trivia into your home year round.

White Sox baseball trivia is great for the entire family! Play with or against each other and see who really knows the Indians.

New trivia is constantly being added to the skill so keep coming back to play!

This skill is not sponsored by MLB or the Chicago White Sox. This is a fan created skill.

name: NBA
description:
Welcome to the new NBA Alexa Skill! You can interact with me in several ways:

(1) Open me by saying "Alexa, open NBA." You should always start your conversation with me this way.  This will trigger the welcome menu and tell you how to listen to live NBA action, check scores, and get schedule info. 

After you’ve opened the NBA skill…

(2) **To LISTEN TO A GAME**, tell me “Play the Cavs game" or “Stream the Atlanta game."  Most games have the home and away announcers, just say the team name for the announcers you want and we'll start streaming.  If Alexa has trouble recognizing your team name, be sure and use the city AND team name together, like “Houston Rockets.”

(3) To ask about the SCHEDULE, say “What games are on today?” OR “When do the Warriors play?”  Ask about a specific team to get broadcaster information for upcoming games.  

(4) Ask me about SCORES by saying, “What is the score of the Milwaukee Bucks game?” OR “What are the latest scores?"  

Additionally after opening the skill, you can say things to me like:

Who is playing now?
When do the Celtics play the Lakers?
What time are the Memphis Grizzlies on?
Did the Thunder win on Monday?

**You will need to login from the Alexa companion app with a valid NBA League Pass subscription in order to listen to games.  Visit www.nba.com/leaguepass to sign up today.
review: This skill really exceeded my expectations!  I can easily keep up with current scores and hear game schedules, and I have no issues getting the information I request.  I'll definitely continue to use this skill throughout the season.

name: Baseball Trivia
description: This is a trivia game that quizzes your knowledge about the Boston Baseball history.  Simple to use, listen to the question and if you need to repeat the question, say repeat question or repeat.  There are four choices, listen for all four answers and then answer 1,2,3,or 4.  Suggestions, comments and critiques are welcome.

Note: information is current as of the start of the season, if you find numbers have changed let me know as the teams sometimes shuffle those in the first week or so.

name: Baseball Reference
description:
Welcome to the Baseball Reference Alexa application. This application makes finding out leaders in certain statistics as easy as just asking. As of right now this app can only return top ranking and you cannot make request by specific players or team statistics.

Users are able to request a multitude of different statistics that can be further specified by rank (1-10), top amount (top two, top three, top four, etc.) year (1871 - present), and league (All of Baseball, National League or American League). 

Here are some initial example requests:
-------------------------------------------
Alexa, ask Baseball Reference who is third in the National League in home runs.

Who leads the league in doubles?

Who lead the American League in wins in nineteen eighty six?

Who is the oldest player in the league?

Alexa, ask Baseball Reference, in nineteen ninety nine, who lead the league in home runs?

Who was top three in strikeouts?

Who was tenth in wins in the National League in nineteen seventy two
-------------------------------------------

Another feature available to users is that after a user makes a successful request and are prompted to ask another question, a user can build upon their previous request.


For Example:
-------------------------------------------
User Requests - "Alexa, ask Baseball Reference who was second in the National League in hits in nineteen eighty three"

Alexa Responds - "Rafael Ramirez was second in the National League with 185 Hits in 1983."

The user can now request a few things:

- Next -
User Requests - "Who was next?"
Alexa Responds -  "Al Oliver was third in the National League with 184 Hits in 1983."

- Previous -
User Requests - "Who was previous?"
Alexa Responds -  "Jose Cruz and Andre Dawson were tied for first in the National League with 189 Hits In 1983 ."

- Rank -
User Requests - "Who was sixth?"
Alexa Responds -  "Dickie Thon was sixth in the National League with 177 Hits In 1983."

- Top -
User Requests - "Who was top three?"
Alexa Responds -  "Jose Cruz and Andre Dawson were tied for first in the National League with 189 Hits In 1983. Rafael Ramirez was second in the National League with 185 Hits In 1983. Al Oliver was third in the National League with 184 Hits In 1983."
-------------------------------------------

Statistics To Request
-----------------------
// Hitting
Singles
Doubles
Triples
Home runs
RBIs
Runs
Stolen bases
Caught stealing
Batting average
Hits
Wins above replacement
Slugging percentage
Extra base hits
Total bases
On base percentage
Walks
Intentional walks
Sacrifice flies
At bats per home run
Grounded into double plays

// Pitching
Earned Run Average
Strikeouts
Strikes per walk
Strikeouts per nine innings
WHIP
Wins
Shutouts
Saves
Innings Pitches

//Misc
Oldest Player
Youngest Player

If you have any questions or comments regarding this application please feel free to reach out to us at ottomanellibaseball@gmail.com.
review: Alexa doesn't know who the all time hit leader is, she doesn't know who won the 1918 World Series, she doesn't know who is in the Baseball Hall of Fame, etc., etc. Is this too much to ask?

  Recites the next game details like date and time according to the schedule.

• What are our standings? 
  Recites the progress of the selected team.

• What is our coach's phone number?
  Recites the selected teams coach's phone number.

• How many cards does our team have?
  Recites the cards issued to the selected team.

• What was the score of our last game?
  Recitest the score of the last game played by the selected team.
	
• What is the weather report for our next game?
  Recites the weather forecast for the location of next game.

• How long will it take to get to our next game or How many days to our next game? 
  Recites the number of days to next game.

• How many cards does {TEAM NAME} {GENDER} {YEAR} {BRACKET} have?
  Allows the user to specify custom Team , Gender , Year and Bracket to know the cards issued for the team.

• When does {TEAM NAME} {GENDER} {YEAR} [BRACKET} play next?
Allows the user to know next game time with respect to the choosen Team , Gender , Year and Bracket . 

More coming soon!!

This skill requires account linking.

name: Unofficial MLB Game Info
description:
Now you can get MLB game information for your favorite teams right in your Flash Briefing!  This Skill has one feed for every MLB team so be sure to enable the feeds for the teams you are interested in.  Data for all feeds is currently refreshed every few minutes.

This Skill currently tells you the following during your Flash Briefing:
* Result and score for today's game if already played or in progress
* Time for today's game if not yet played (time reported always in US Eastern timezone)
* Result and score for yesterday's game if there was one

Please note, Flash Briefing Skills must have a "Default" feed.  The Tampa Bay Rays feed will be enabled by default (the author's favorite team), so please remember to disable it in your Flash Briefing settings if you do not want Rays information.  Here's how you can enable a different feed:
  1. Open the Alexa App or go to https://alexa.amazon.com
  2. In the Menu, go to Settings
  3. In Settings, go to Flash Briefing under the Accounts section
  4. This will show you all the Flash Briefing "Feeds" you have turned On and Off.  You should see "Tampa Bay Rays Games" listed under the On section, as that is the default (Go Rays!).  Now under the Off section you should see "Unofficial MLB Game Info" with a little down arrow.  Tap that (it may take a few seconds to list them all, this appears to be a bug in Alexa App).
  5. You should now see all the other 29 MLB teams listed.  Find your team and click/tap on it and this will enable the "Feed".
  6. Now that team should show under the On section and you can turn off the Rays Feed (or keep it on and embrace them as your favorite AL team!).

You can contact me directly at josh@userdel.com, or https://github.com/irlrobot/mlb_game_info, for feedback and bug reports.  Enjoy!

This skill is not sponsored or endorsed by Major League Baseball (MLB) or any of its affiliates.

name: NBA
description:
Welcome to the new NBA Alexa Skill! You can interact with me in several ways:

(1) Open me by saying "Alexa, open NBA." You should always start your conversation with me this way.  This will trigger the welcome menu and tell you how to listen to live NBA action, check scores, and get schedule info. 

After you’ve opened the NBA skill…

(2) **To LISTEN TO A GAME**, tell me “Play the Cavs game" or “Stream the Atlanta game."  Most games have the home and away announcers, just say the team name for the announcers you want and we'll start streaming.  If Alexa has trouble recognizing your team name, be sure and use the city AND team name together, like “Houston Rockets.”

(3) To ask about the SCHEDULE, say “What games are on today?” OR “When do the Warriors play?”  Ask about a specific team to get broadcaster information for upcoming games.  

(4) Ask me about SCORES by saying, “What is the score of the Milwaukee Bucks game?” OR “What are the latest scores?"  

Additionally after opening the skill, you can say things to me like:

Who is playing now?
When do the Celtics play the Lakers?
What time are the Memphis Grizzlies on?
Did the Thunder win on Monday?

**You will need to login from the Alexa companion app with a valid NBA League Pass subscription in order to listen to games.  Visit www.nba.com/leaguepass to sign up today.
review: Are they playing this year

name: Running Clothes
description:
Wondering what to wear on your next run? 
The Running Clothes Advisor takes the guesswork out of getting dressed for your next outdoor run based on your local weather conditions. This simple guide may prompt you to enable location permissions in your Alexa app. If you do not wish to enable location permissions say, "My Inputs" for your personalized apparel recommendation.

Our exclusive apparel algorithm provides personalized apparel recommendations based on weather conditions and gender. This skill has been optimized with screen support for Echo Show and Echo Spot devices.

After your run, re-open the Running Clothes advisor and select "log my run." You can record your miles ran and how your run went. You can also tell Alexa if her recommendation was too hot or too cold and the algorithm will automatically adjust your recommendations going forward.

If you choose apparel advice based current weather conditions, Alexa will pull temperature, humidity, wind speed, and other weather conditions based on your zip code. Alexa will prompt you for your gender and create a personalized recommendation based on our exclusive apparel algorithm. Our exclusive algorithm is based on years of running experience and races including 5K, 10K, 10 Miler, Half Marathon, and Full Marathon distances. Caroline Dunn is a New York City Marathon 2018 Finisher.

If you select running outfit advice based on your inputs, Alexa will ask you for your gender, temperature, weather conditions (sunny, windy, cloudy, or raining), and your run intensity (easy run, or race), to create a personalized recommendation based on our exclusive algorithm. Feel free to adjust based on your personal preference. This is only intended to be a guide.

Disclaimer: Please consult a physician before beginning a new workout program.

Created by: Caroline Dunn - https://www.linkedin.com/in/carolinedunn/
https://twitter.com/thecarolinedunn
https://www.instagram.com/thecarolinedunn/
http://carolinedunn.org/
http://alexadevgroup.com/
review: easy/convenient way to figure out what i should wear before  my daily runs!

name: Surf Checker
description:
THE ROCK WAS ADDED AND MOST CALIFORNIA AND HAWAII SURF SPOTS ARE AVAILABLE!

Let Alexa give you the surf report for most California and Hawaii surf spots.  Also for each surf spot, let Alexa also give you the tide report, the water temperature and let you know when is the best day to surf for the upcoming week.

Using the streamlined commands structure, getting the surf report information for several spots is simple and easy.  

Here are examples to try: 
 
"Alexa, Ask Surf Checker for Salt Creek on Tuesday"
"When is the best day to surf Lowers"
"What is the tide report for San Clemente State Beach on Wednesday"
"What is the water temperature at Lihaina Harbor"
"When is the best day to surf Pipeline"

For surf reports, just say the surf spot name for quick results:
For example, just say "Sunset Beach" for the Sunset Beach surf report. Or say, "Sunset Beach on Thursday" to get the report for the upcoming Thursday.        

Alexa also remembers the last surf report you requested so that additional reports do not have to include the spot name.   For example once you ask for a report like:
"What is the surf report for Pismo Beach Pier"

You can get the tide, water temperature, and best day to surf at Pismo Beach Pier by saying:
"What is the tide report" or just "tide report?"
"When is the best day to surf"
"What is the water temperature" or just "water temperature"

If you want to find the tide activity later in the week for Pismo Beach just say:
"Tide report for tomorrow" or "Tide report on Friday"

Listed below are JUST SOME of the surf spots available.  There were too many to list here.  The complete list is at www.surfncircuits.com.  New locations soon!!   If you want your surf spot added please mention it in comment below or at www.surfncircuits.com

name: Baseball Reference
description:
Welcome to the Baseball Reference Alexa application. This application makes finding out leaders in certain statistics as easy as just asking. As of right now this app can only return top ranking and you cannot make request by specific players or team statistics.

Users are able to request a multitude of different statistics that can be further specified by rank (1-10), top amount (top two, top three, top four, etc.) year (1871 - present), and league (All of Baseball, National League or American League). 

Here are some initial example requests:
-------------------------------------------
Alexa, ask Baseball Reference who is third in the National League in home runs.

Who leads the league in doubles?

Who lead the American League in wins in nineteen eighty six?

Who is the oldest player in the league?

Alexa, ask Baseball Reference, in nineteen ninety nine, who lead the league in home runs?

Who was top three in strikeouts?

Who was tenth in wins in the National League in nineteen seventy two
-------------------------------------------

Another feature available to users is that after a user makes a successful request and are prompted to ask another question, a user can build upon their previous request.


For Example:
-------------------------------------------
User Requests - "Alexa, ask Baseball Reference who was second in the National League in hits in nineteen eighty three"

Alexa Responds - "Rafael Ramirez was second in the National League with 185 Hits in 1983."

The user can now request a few things:

- Next -
User Requests - "Who was next?"
Alexa Responds -  "Al Oliver was third in the National League with 184 Hits in 1983."

- Previous -
User Requests - "Who was previous?"
Alexa Responds -  "Jose Cruz and Andre Dawson were tied for first in the National League with 189 Hits In 1983 ."

- Rank -
User Requests - "Who was sixth?"
Alexa Responds -  "Dickie Thon was sixth in the National League with 177 Hits In 1983."

- Top -
User Requests - "Who was top three?"

comment heading: The audio flash briefing is dune but would really like if ESPN did a video version of flash briefing ...
review: The audio flash briefing is dune but would really like if ESPN did a video version of flash briefing for Echo Show similar to other news outlets.

name: NBA
description:
Welcome to the new NBA Alexa Skill! You can interact with me in several ways:

(1) Open me by saying "Alexa, open NBA." You should always start your conversation with me this way.  This will trigger the welcome menu and tell you how to listen to live NBA action, check scores, and get schedule info. 

After you’ve opened the NBA skill…

(2) **To LISTEN TO A GAME**, tell me “Play the Cavs game" or “Stream the Atlanta game."  Most games have the home and away announcers, just say the team name for the announcers you want and we'll start streaming.  If Alexa has trouble recognizing your team name, be sure and use the city AND team name together, like “Houston Rockets.”

(3) To ask about the SCHEDULE, say “What games are on today?” OR “When do the Warriors play?”  Ask about a specific team to get broadcaster information for upcoming games.  

(4) Ask me about SCORES by saying, “What is the score of the Milwaukee Bucks game?” OR “What are the latest scores?"  

Additionally after opening the skill, you can say things to me like:

Who is playing now?
When do the Celtics play the Lakers?
What time are the Memphis Grizzlies on?
Did the Thunder win on Monday?

**You will need to login from the Alexa companion app with a valid NBA League Pass subscription in order to listen to games.  Visit www.nba.com/leaguepass to sign up today.
comment heading: Can't Link NBA League Pass & Can't Find Games After Midnight
review:
I have a few problems.
1. I cannot link my NBA League Pass International account (maybe it only works with US-based League Pass accounts.
2. Once the clock strikes midnight, it seems like the NBA skill acts like there are no games going on any more (whereas if you ask Alexa without invoking the NBA skill, it knows that the game is still going on)

name: World Cup Daily
description:
Makes it easier for you to be in the know with fresh content about the World Cup.

Get to know everything before the World Cup starts: the teams, the players and all the necessary information for you to become a World Cup expert. 

Get daily updates twice a day about scores, teams , interesting facts and best player of the day once the World Cup starts. 

Give it a try!  

If you love this skill, please let us know by giving us a 5-star rating!
review: I added this skill to my echo not knowing what to expect and it turned out a great addition. It gives a quick update on interesting facts about the World Cup in a fun way, there is a new update every day and it’s supposed to remain like that during the World Cup as well. Definitely recommend it as a skill if you are into this big sports event

name: Daybreak CrossFit
description: From one of the highest-tech CrossFits in the Northeast! Now you can get your daily dose of Daybreak news and workouts easily through your Alexa device by simply saying "Alexa, open Daybreak CrossFit." We will post daily news and workouts each evening around 7pm ET. You can pause and play by saying "Alexa, pause" and "Alexa, resume." Or just say "Alexa, stop" when you're done. You can also ask for the previous or next post by saying "Alexa, previous" or "Alexa, next".

description:

Optionally "and let's beat the {mascot}" or "and let's beat {college}"  can be included at the end of the launch command.

"Alexa, Start calling the hogs and beat the bulldogs"
"Alexa, Start calling the hogs and beat Alabama"
review:
It's thanks to mindless 'apps' like this we begin to realize that anyone can create an Alexa skill.

I can't wait for Alexa to empower us with a trash bin category for stuff like this.

I mean, it's great that adolescents can play with the tech but, please don't approve such nonsense for broad distribution. This skill was presented at the top of my Alexa skills list today with only two reviews!

Team Alexa: please improve relevance and quality of the skills you promote. Thx

skills-rest: Real Runs - Running Tips for Runners
name: Real Runs - Running Tips for Runners
description: Discover how to be like the fittest and healthiest runners in the world with only small changes. We give you scientifically-tested running tips from famous running coaches like Bill Bowerman, Terrence Mahon, Jack Daniels, Joan Benoit, Clyde Hart, and others.  This briefing will help you naturally improve your runs, from beginners to more advanced runners. We will guide you to get more energy for runs and show you the secrets that top runners share with each other, including Olympic athletes.  Our daily dose will make you a better runner and help you optimize your runs.  Caution: The information in this skill is provided for informational and educational purposes only.  Please consult a doctor before starting a running workout.
review: These tips on running are really helpful and I can feel my endurance and speed improving as I incorporate these daily tips to my everyday running routine! Would recommend to anyone who loves to run!

name: Ski Conditions Buddy
description:
*** Please note that due to a change in policy, weatherunlocked.com will no longer provide this information for free.  Therefore this skill will cease to function as of March 1, 2018. 

If I can find another source of data, I will update this skill to use it.  ***

This Ski Buddy skill provides current weather and ski conditions for some NY ski resorts.

Currently, conditions for the Bristol Mountain ski resort in Canandaigua, NY, Holiday Valley ski resort in Ellicottville, NY, Swain Resort in Swain NY, and Greek Peak mountain resort in Cortland, NY are supported.

This skill is neither endorsed or sponsored by any ski resort.

Note: Occasionally Ski Buddy has trouble getting the conditions and will report an error.  Waiting a minute and trying again will generally be successful.

Weather and ski condition data provided by MyWeather2.com.

review: unable to find my location even though its a beach at a major city in Florida

name: theScore eSports
description:
heScore esports Flash Briefing is the ultimate esports experience!

On a daily basis, you'll get breaking news, live scores, in-depth analyses and more from across the world of competitive gaming.

We deliver breaking news and live scoring coverage of major games including:
• League of Legends (NA LCS, EU LCS, LCK, LPL, and many more!)
• Dota 2
• Counter-Strike: GO (CS:GO)
• Heroes of the Storm
• Call of Duty (CoD)
• StarCraft II
• Hearthstone
• Street Fighter
• Super Smash Bros. 
• Overwatch

Add theScore esports to your Flash Briefing by going to Settings in the Alexa app. You can manage your Flash Briefing under Account.

After adding theScore esports, you can say “Alexa, what’s my Flash Briefing?” or “Alexa, what’s in the news?” to hear the latest.
review: Seems to keep relatively up to date

name: FootballLive
description:
This skill is used primarily to listen to live scores of football matches from all around the globe. One can listen to the score line of the live matches and recently finished matches. Upcoming matches which are just about to start can also be found. We bring you access to everything from the football action from the popular countries like England, Germany, Spain,Italy etc to your favourite league from your own country supporting about 100 different countries. We will also provide live scores for the upcoming football world cup 2018 ,other international events like confederations cup. This include playoffs, country friendlies, qualifiers etc. Also apart from increasing the number of countries supported we also provide support for alternate football tournaments like FA Cup, championship league, 2nd division football, World Cup U-20. In total you have access to around 100 different countries with total supported number of tournaments/leagues/play offs/friendlies/international etc.. more than 750!!!

To invoke the skill say football live.

After invoking the skill one can get the live score of a match in the league of a country by saying just the country name or saying football country name. By default, this will  search for live scores in the top divsion leagues  and if not found will search in the other leagues. For example if I say England, the skill will check for live matches happening now in the English Premier League and provide me with the live score if any match is going on.
If there is no match currently ongoing in that country, we show a sample list of few countries for which live scores are available now.

Many more new features are planned to also provide other information like league standings, upcoming fixtures, events like Red Cards, Goals Scored by Players etc.

name: Cricket Feeds
description:
This skill provides the latest cricket feeds from CricInfo. You can get the feeds by country, mark a particular country as a favorite, remove favorite, list all supported categories, get more details of a particular feed.

Invocation Name - cricket feeds
Just say "Open cricket feeds" or "Start cricket feeds"

To open the feeds for a particular category

Just say "Open category India" or "Open Cricket Feeds for {country}"

For example "Open Cricket Feeds for India"

To mark a particular country as favorite

Just say "mark {Country} as favorite"

for example "mark India as favorite"

To Remove a particular country from favorites

Just say "remove {country} as favorite"

for example "remove India as favorite"

To get supported categories
Just say "list categories" or "get category list"
review: Infor

name: Fantasy Football ADP
description:
Are you starting to prep for your 2018 fantasy football draft? Of course, you are.

By now you're probably dreading having to look up the average draft position (ADP) of the different guys you're evaluating. 

Don't sweat it. We've built the ultimate fantasy football prep machine.

Now, simply ask Alexa what the ADP is of a certain player is and she'll tell you. 

It's literally talking fantasy football.

Here's an example of what you need to ask to get the ADP you're looking for:
- What is the ADP of Tom Brady?
- What is the average draft position of Drew Brees?
- Alex Smith

Using one of those variants (with your player's name swapped out) will give you exactly what you're looking for!

Note: 
All ADP's come courtesy of Fantasy Football Calculator and are based on 10-team standard scoring leagues.

name: Baseball Odds
description:
Baseball Odds gives the money line odds for up to 10 MLB games currently on the roster for the next 24 hours.  Baseball Odds is updated hourly for all games, unless they are currently in play, or have been played, then information will not be given. Baseball Odds provides the "MoneyLine" odds for both teams and the "Total" Over/Under. This information is taken from an average of online sports books and is not guaranteed to be accurate.
Baseball Odds is sponsored by TheVegasBook.win

name: StatMuse
description:
StatMuse lets you explore sports statistics, schedules and scores in a whole new way, straight from your favorite players and personalities. Say "Alexa, ask StatMuse who has the most career receiving yards?" and hear Jerry Rice tell you about his record. Then try "Who had the most touchdowns last season?" to hear from David Johnson. Ask "When are the Falcons playing next?" to have Devonta Freeman give you his game schedule.



StatMuse provides instant answers to your NBA, NFL, MLB & NHL questions and features the authentic voices of Peyton Manning, Le'Veon Bell, Drew Brees, Terrell Owens, Jerry Rice and other players, plus Scott Van Pelt and Joe Buck. StatMuse is the officially licensed AI of the NFL Players Association.

Start by asking:
"Alexa, open Statmuse…"

“How did the Eagles do?”
"Who had the most passing yards in a season?"
After hearing Drew Brees answer, ask "Where did you go to college?" or "How many touchdowns did you have last season?"

"Who won the World Series in 1945?"
"Which pitcher had the most strikeouts last year?"
After hearing the answer, ask "What is his career ERA?"

"How did Steph Curry do last season?"
“Who do the Rockets play this week?”

“What hockey games are on tonight?”
“Tell me about the Golden Knights.”
StatMuse has comprehensive stats going back to 1947 for the NBA, 1920 for the NFL, 1876 for MLB and 1917 for the NHL.

Here are just a few of the stats now available to you, instantly: https://www.statmuse.com/getting-started/examples
review: Incredible! There's nothing else like it on Alexa. It should really come pre-installed to answer every sports question. It's so cool to hear the player voices actually answer them.

name: OH - IO
description:
Show off your Buckeye pride! 
When you say "OH" Alexa says "IO"!
review: Awesome!

name: Coach Harbaugh
description:
Need to get fired up? Of course you don't - you are already attacking today with an enthusiasm unknown to mankind. But how about having your own personal Jim Harbaugh to entertain you on game day? Or on Mondays. Or every single morning while you wash down your steak breakfast with whole milk. 

You can say:
1. Alexa, ask Coach Harbaugh for a quote
2. Alexa, ask Coach Harbaugh to play "The Victors"
3. Alexa, ask Coach Harbaugh WHO'S GOT IT BETTER THAN US!?

Please note that this skill is not affiliated with the University of Michigan in any way. I'm just a fan with the constitutional right to share Jim Harbaugh's wisdom with you.

Special thanks to Sibish Basheer for making this possible.
comment heading: Who's got it better than us?
review: Nobody!

name: Packers News

name: World Cup Soccer Trivia
description:
If you are a soccer fan and you like keeping up to date with world cup tournaments and players, this is the quiz to put your knowledge to the test. 

If you don't know that much, this quiz will help you to learn more about the world of soccer. In every quiz, you will get 5 questions to answer, testing your knowledge. 

Keep coming back for more, because each set of 5 questions are randomly selected from a large pool of questions!

You can answer the questions with phrases like:
"The answer is <one>"
"My answer is <two>"
"Is it <three>"
"<four> is my answer"

name: NCAA March Madness
description:
NCAA March Madness for Alexa delivers real-time tournament scores, schedules, information about your Bracket Picks, and live radio for each game.

Example Phrases:

“Alexa, ask March Madness what games are on right now?”

“Alexa, ask March Madness for today's scores.”

“Alexa, ask March Madness for today's schedule.”

“Alexa, ask March Madness what games can I listen to on the radio?”

“Alexa, ask March Madness for the score of the North Carolina game.”

“Alexa, ask March Madness to play the Duke versus Kentucky game.”

“Alexa, ask March Madness what time the Kansas game starts.”

“Alexa, ask March Madness how my bracket is doing.”

“Alexa, ask March Madness who I picked to win it all.”

“Alexa, ask March Madness which teams I picked today.”

To ask for help or give feedback on this skill please contact mmlivehelp@turner.com

*Note: The live radio feature is currently not supported on Fire TV.

*Note: Must sign-in with a valid Capital One NCAA March Madness Bracket Challenge account in order to get information about your bracket picks.

name: Surf Checker
description:
THE ROCK WAS ADDED AND MOST CALIFORNIA AND HAWAII SURF SPOTS ARE AVAILABLE!

Let Alexa give you the surf report for most California and Hawaii surf spots.  Also for each surf spot, let Alexa also give you the tide report, the water temperature and let you know when is the best day to surf for the upcoming week.

Using the streamlined commands structure, getting the surf report information for several spots is simple and easy.  

Here are examples to try: 
 
"Alexa, Ask Surf Checker for Salt Creek on Tuesday"
"When is the best day to surf Lowers"
"What is the tide report for San Clemente State Beach on Wednesday"
"What is the water temperature at Lihaina Harbor"
"When is the best day to surf Pipeline"

For surf reports, just say the surf spot name for quick results:
For example, just say "Sunset Beach" for the Sunset Beach surf report. Or say, "Sunset Beach on Thursday" to get the report for the upcoming Thursday.        

Alexa also remembers the last surf report you requested so that additional reports do not have to include the spot name.   For example once you ask for a report like:
"What is the surf report for Pismo Beach Pier"

You can get the tide, water temperature, and best day to surf at Pismo Beach Pier by saying:
"What is the tide report" or just "tide report?"
"When is the best day to surf"
"What is the water temperature" or just "water temperature"

If you want to find the tide activity later in the week for Pismo Beach just say:
"Tide report for tomorrow" or "Tide report on Friday"

Listed below are JUST SOME of the surf spots available.  There were too many to list here.  The complete list is at www.surfncircuits.com.  New locations soon!!   If you want your surf spot added please mention it in comment below or at www.surfncircuits.com

name: NBA
description:
Welcome to the new NBA Alexa Skill! You can interact with me in several ways:

(1) Open me by saying "Alexa, open NBA." You should always start your conversation with me this way.  This will trigger the welcome menu and tell you how to listen to live NBA action, check scores, and get schedule info. 

After you’ve opened the NBA skill…

(2) **To LISTEN TO A GAME**, tell me “Play the Cavs game" or “Stream the Atlanta game."  Most games have the home and away announcers, just say the team name for the announcers you want and we'll start streaming.  If Alexa has trouble recognizing your team name, be sure and use the city AND team name together, like “Houston Rockets.”

(3) To ask about the SCHEDULE, say “What games are on today?” OR “When do the Warriors play?”  Ask about a specific team to get broadcaster information for upcoming games.  

(4) Ask me about SCORES by saying, “What is the score of the Milwaukee Bucks game?” OR “What are the latest scores?"  

Additionally after opening the skill, you can say things to me like:

Who is playing now?
When do the Celtics play the Lakers?
What time are the Memphis Grizzlies on?
Did the Thunder win on Monday?

**You will need to login from the Alexa companion app with a valid NBA League Pass subscription in order to listen to games.  Visit www.nba.com/leaguepass to sign up today.
comment heading: Not worth the cost for season pass.
review: I paid $200 for league pass.  Local games are not available until 4 days later. Unable to pause, forward or Reverse playback. Expecting more features for the high cost. Dissatisfied customer.

skills-rest: Real Runs - Running Tips for Runners
name: Real Runs - Running Tips for Runners
description: Discover how to be like the fittest and healthiest runners in the world with only small changes. We give you scientifically-tested running tips from famous running coaches like Bill Bowerman, Terrence Mahon, Jack Daniels, Joan Benoit, Clyde Hart, and others.  This briefing will help you naturally improve your runs, from beginners to more advanced runners. We will guide you to get more energy for runs and show you the secrets that top runners share with each other, including Olympic athletes.  Our daily dose will make you a better runner and help you optimize your runs.  Caution: The information in this skill is provided for informational and educational purposes only.  Please consult a doctor before starting a running workout.

name: Baseball BASIQs
description:
Baseball BASIQs helps develop your players' baseball IQ. 

Ask Alexa for a "situation" for any position and she will give you a setup (runners on base, # of outs) and tell you where and how the ball is hit.  She then takes a brief pause before explaining what should be done in the given situation.

An example would be:
 - "You are playing shortstop"
 - "There are runners on First and Third"
 - "There is one out"
 - "There is a hard-ground ball to Second Baseman"
 - "What is your play?"
 - "Your play is to hustle to Second Base to take the toss from Second Baseman for one out and then make quick throw to First Base to complete the double play!"

Baseball BASIQs contains over 7,000 situations to learn from! Give us a try today! 

Check us out at www.BASIQs.com
review: My son has played dozens of middle infield games and hasn't had the same situation twice yet... seems like a ton of content. Really, really cool!

You can say:
1. Alexa, ask Coach Harbaugh for a quote
2. Alexa, ask Coach Harbaugh to play "The Victors"
3. Alexa, ask Coach Harbaugh WHO'S GOT IT BETTER THAN US!?

Please note that this skill is not affiliated with the University of Michigan in any way. I'm just a fan with the constitutional right to share Jim Harbaugh's wisdom with you.

Special thanks to Sibish Basheer for making this possible.

This site also serves as a community for like-minded fans to come together to catch up on the latest news and to discuss their passion.

name: Cowboys Fan

name: Baseball Mania
description:
This is a game based on traditional American baseball.

Baseball Mania is a game of strategy and skill that includes pitching, hitting, fielding, and many of the other exciting things you've come to know and love about the game of baseball.

Take to the diamond and see if you have what it takes to earn a Baseball Mania pennant...it just takes practice!
comment heading: The best baseball game on Alexa
review:
Another fun sports game for the Alexa (I'm a big fan of Football Mania for the Alexa as well)!

Takes a while to play a full game, but I really dig the strategy of pitching and how realistic all the game scenarios I got into were. This will give me hours of entertainment!

name: Baseball Reference
description:
Welcome to the Baseball Reference Alexa application. This application makes finding out leaders in certain statistics as easy as just asking. As of right now this app can only return top ranking and you cannot make request by specific players or team statistics.

Users are able to request a multitude of different statistics that can be further specified by rank (1-10), top amount (top two, top three, top four, etc.) year (1871 - present), and league (All of Baseball, National League or American League). 

Here are some initial example requests:
-------------------------------------------
Alexa, ask Baseball Reference who is third in the National League in home runs.

Who leads the league in doubles?

Who lead the American League in wins in nineteen eighty six?

Who is the oldest player in the league?

Alexa, ask Baseball Reference, in nineteen ninety nine, who lead the league in home runs?

Who was top three in strikeouts?

Who was tenth in wins in the National League in nineteen seventy two
-------------------------------------------

Another feature available to users is that after a user makes a successful request and are prompted to ask another question, a user can build upon their previous request.


For Example:
-------------------------------------------
User Requests - "Alexa, ask Baseball Reference who was second in the National League in hits in nineteen eighty three"

Alexa Responds - "Rafael Ramirez was second in the National League with 185 Hits in 1983."

The user can now request a few things:

- Next -
User Requests - "Who was next?"
Alexa Responds -  "Al Oliver was third in the National League with 184 Hits in 1983."

- Previous -
User Requests - "Who was previous?"
Alexa Responds -  "Jose Cruz and Andre Dawson were tied for first in the National League with 189 Hits In 1983 ."

- Rank -
User Requests - "Who was sixth?"
Alexa Responds -  "Dickie Thon was sixth in the National League with 177 Hits In 1983."

- Top -
User Requests - "Who was top three?"
Alexa Responds -  "Jose Cruz and Andre Dawson were tied for first in the National League with 189 Hits In 1983. Rafael Ramirez was second in the National League with 185 Hits In 1983. Al Oliver was third in the National League with 184 Hits In 1983."
-------------------------------------------

Statistics To Request
-----------------------
// Hitting
Singles
Doubles
Triples
Home runs
RBIs
Runs
Stolen bases
Caught stealing
Batting average
Hits
Wins above replacement
Slugging percentage
Extra base hits
Total bases
On base percentage
Walks
Intentional walks
Sacrifice flies
At bats per home run
Grounded into double plays

// Pitching
Earned Run Average
Strikeouts
Strikes per walk
Strikeouts per nine innings
WHIP
Wins
Shutouts
Saves
Innings Pitches

//Misc
Oldest Player
Youngest Player

If you have any questions or comments regarding this application please feel free to reach out to us at ottomanellibaseball@gmail.com.
review: I love this app! I dont follow baseball too much but with this app I can stay up to date with what's going on!

name: NCAA March Madness
description:
NCAA March Madness for Alexa delivers real-time tournament scores, schedules, information about your Bracket Picks, and live radio for each game.

Example Phrases:

“Alexa, ask March Madness what games are on right now?”

“Alexa, ask March Madness for today's scores.”

“Alexa, ask March Madness for today's schedule.”

“Alexa, ask March Madness what games can I listen to on the radio?”

“Alexa, ask March Madness for the score of the North Carolina game.”

“Alexa, ask March Madness to play the Duke versus Kentucky game.”

“Alexa, ask March Madness what time the Kansas game starts.”

“Alexa, ask March Madness how my bracket is doing.”

“Alexa, ask March Madness who I picked to win it all.”

“Alexa, ask March Madness which teams I picked today.”

To ask for help or give feedback on this skill please contact mmlivehelp@turner.com

*Note: The live radio feature is currently not supported on Fire TV.

*Note: Must sign-in with a valid Capital One NCAA March Madness Bracket Challenge account in order to get information about your bracket picks.
review: This is awesome . I recommend that you get the app.

name: UGA Roster
description:
UGA Roster is the perfect gameday companion! If you have ever wanted to identify a player by jersey number or name, the answer is now just one Alexa command away. 

UGA Roster lets you ask questions like "Who is Jacob Eason?", or "Who is number 27?". You can also ask about a player's position, height, weight, class, and hometown. 



*This skill pulls information from ESPN. The skill was created by a UGA student who is in no way affiliated with ESPN or UGA Athletics.

name: NBC Sports Update
description:
The NBC Sports Update brings you national sports news, every hour, 24/7. 

Add the NBC Sports Update to your Flash Briefing and move it to the top of your news by going to Settings in the Alexa app. You can manage your Flash Briefing under Account. After adding the NBC Sports Update, you can say “Alexa, what’s my Flash Briefing?” or “Alexa, what’s in the news?” to hear the latest.

description:

skills-rest: The Rookie's Guide to the NFL
name: The Rookie's Guide to the NFL
description:
The Rookie's Guide to the NFL is your official way to learn about the National Football League. Become an expert by asking about the rules, penalties, scoring plays, commentator lingo, previous Super Bowls, team formations, and more.

After enabling the skill, say 'Open NFL' or 'Launch NFL' to use The Rookie's Guide.

Once you've opened the skill, you can say things like:
-What is defensive pass interference?
-How many players are on a team?
-Who won Super Bowl 35?
-What's the difference between a running back and a wide receiver?
-Tell me about the Music City Miracle
-How tall is Aaron Rodgers?
-What does ‘move the chains’ mean?
Or, just say 'Surprise me' to hear a new definition

If you get stuck within the skill, say 'Alexa, what does this skill do?' to hear more options.
review: I've asked Alexa to open it about 10 times and was successful once. A few other times she brought up a page of football related apps on my Kindle. Sometimes nothing happened or she said "I don't know that."  But when it did open it was helpful. I see how it could be helpful if it would just open consistently.

name: Unofficial MLB Game Info
description:
Now you can get MLB game information for your favorite teams right in your Flash Briefing!  This Skill has one feed for every MLB team so be sure to enable the feeds for the teams you are interested in.  Data for all feeds is currently refreshed every few minutes.

This Skill currently tells you the following during your Flash Briefing:
* Result and score for today's game if already played or in progress
* Time for today's game if not yet played (time reported always in US Eastern timezone)
* Result and score for yesterday's game if there was one

Please note, Flash Briefing Skills must have a "Default" feed.  The Tampa Bay Rays feed will be enabled by default (the author's favorite team), so please remember to disable it in your Flash Briefing settings if you do not want Rays information.  Here's how you can enable a different feed:
  1. Open the Alexa App or go to https://alexa.amazon.com
  2. In the Menu, go to Settings
  3. In Settings, go to Flash Briefing under the Accounts section
  4. This will show you all the Flash Briefing "Feeds" you have turned On and Off.  You should see "Tampa Bay Rays Games" listed under the On section, as that is the default (Go Rays!).  Now under the Off section you should see "Unofficial MLB Game Info" with a little down arrow.  Tap that (it may take a few seconds to list them all, this appears to be a bug in Alexa App).
  5. You should now see all the other 29 MLB teams listed.  Find your team and click/tap on it and this will enable the "Feed".
  6. Now that team should show under the On section and you can turn off the Rays Feed (or keep it on and embrace them as your favorite AL team!).

You can contact me directly at josh@userdel.com, or https://github.com/irlrobot/mlb_game_info, for feedback and bug reports.  Enjoy!

This skill is not sponsored or endorsed by Major League Baseball (MLB) or any of its affiliates.
review: Great skill, even though I had some trouble getting it to work. But Josh Campbell was kind enough to email instructions.

name: Let's Go!!!
description:
Stuck at home watching the VT game?  Miss being in the stands?  Alexa is here to help!  Say "Lets Go" to Alexa and she and her friends respond like true fans.

Losing track of how long its been since VT lost to that other team in Virginia?  Just ask Lets Go, and Alexa will let you know just how many days it has been.
review: Fix the day counter please!

name: Six Pack Abs
description:
Work out with Alexa throughout the week. Once you open the skill, just ask Alexa to start the workout. You can also ask Alexa for your progress.
This skill was created using a Skill Blueprint. Your requests to this skill are not shared with the skill developer.
review: after saying any command Alexa responds “you are done with your workout for today, great job” but i didnt get to do one

name: Mizzou Chant
description: Bring the Tiger Pride to Alexa by doing the "MIZ' - "ZOU" chant with her.

name: Grandstand Podcasts
description: Giving you the Quick Sports Minute Update covering the biggest headlines in sports.
review: Great team that keeps you updated on the biggest news in sports

name: NASCAR
description:
Keep up to date on all the latest from NASCAR including the schedule, race results and live updates. 

Listen to the podcast, live broadcast radio and driver in-car audio. Note, in-car audio and podcast may contain profanity.

While using NASCAR, you can ask Alexa to play the Podcast, ask about the next race, who is winning the current race, and who won the previous race.
review: DL NASCAR for Alexa and it worked just fine for me - knew when the Daytona 500 was and where I could tune in.

name: Sachin Sachin Chanting
description:
Crowd Chanting Sachin Sachin! Goosebumps grantee. 

Try another skill Dhoni Dhoni Chanting. (to find the skill enter "dhoni chant' in the search bar)
review: Nice!

name: NBA Flash Briefing
description: Follow the latest news and game recaps from around the NBA within Alexa's Flash Briefing. After enabling the skill, say things like "Alexa, what's my flash briefing?" Or, "Alexa, what's in the news" to hear your flash briefings. Go to Settings in your Alexa app and find "Flash Briefing" to move NBA Flash Briefing to the top of your news brief.
review: It just ok

name: ESPN Flash Briefing
description:
Want to stay up to date on the latest sports news? From Aaron Rodgers to Zlatan Ibrahimović, your ESPN Flash Briefings bring you the hottest stories in sports, updated throughout the day.
 
Add ESPN to your Flash Briefing, then say "Alexa, what's my Flash Briefing?" to tune in.
review: On a day with a lot of Baseball news, ESPN just talked about Basketball and Golf.

name: Cowboys Fan
description:
Get unofficial to-the-minute stats & fun facts on the Cowboys by Fresh Digital Group. This skill isn’t sponsored or endorsed by the Cowboys.

Here’s some ways you can use the skill. We have given you many different ways for you to talk to Alexa:



General Updates:


Alexa, ask Cowboys Fan how are the Cowboys doing? 

Alexa, ask Cowboys Fan who do the Cowboys play next?

Alexa, ask Cowboys Fan Roger Staubach (or any player's First name, Last name) touchdown update. 



Fun Facts about the Cowboys:


Alexa, ask Cowboys Fan to tell me some trivia about the Cowboys. 

Alexa, ask Cowboys Fan how many Super Bowls have the Cowboys won?
review: It's cool to play around with and discover Cowboys facts.

name: FanDuel: Pick 6
description:
Strap on your helmet and get ready for FanDuel: Pick 6! During the regular season, make six predictions about what you think will happen during the Sunday Night and Monday Night football games. Watch the game, all from the comfort of your couch, check in for updates, and see how many picks you can get right each time you play!

Simply say “Alexa, Open FanDuel” and get started today.
review: While I'm not yet a member of Fanduel, I heard about this through a friend and I love the trivia games. I went 4/6 so there is some room for improvement. Great game and fun in an entertainment scenario!

name: GolfNow
description: GolfNow is the world's first tee-time marketplace, golfers have the ability to search and book tee times anywhere in the United States.  Golfers wishing to book tee times should link their GolfNow account from within the Alexa app.
review: just tell alexa the city you want and she shows you courses and pricing really fast! its as easy to use as the actual app, but i wont need my phone near me to do it!

name: ESPN Radio (via TuneIn)
description: As part of your Flash Briefing, hear the latest sports news from the ESPN Radio SportsCenter.
review: Boo

name: Missouri Football Trivia
description: Ask Alexa to open Missouri football and see if you can correctly answer five questions. Play by yourself or test your knowledge against others.

description:
NHL News
Unofficial

name: The Thirteen Run Pool
description: The thirteen run pool provides updates on the game of thirteen runs for users to track their team and what runs are left to check off.
comment heading: Great for keeping track of teams in 13 run pool
review: The app is great for keeping track of the 13 run pool.

name: Yahoo Fantasy Football
description:
Does your line-up have what it takes? Login and link one of your existing Yahoo Fantasy Football head-to-head leagues to the Alexa Skill to track your team as they make their play for the championship. Competing in multiple Head-2-Head leagues? No problem, just say ‘Change league’ to easily switch to another league. 

Use the Alexa skill to get: 
– an overview of your team’s weekly matchup and score.
– your team’s injury/bye status. 
– player scores and injury updates.
All without ever putting your hands on the ball.

——

NOTE: This skill currently SUPPORTS Head-to-Head fantasy leagues only. It DOES NOT support Points leagues or Pick’Em.
review: Add fantasy hockey and make it easier to see the scores for owners of multiple teams

name: NBA
description:
Welcome to the new NBA Alexa Skill! You can interact with me in several ways:

(1) Open me by saying "Alexa, open NBA." You should always start your conversation with me this way.  This will trigger the welcome menu and tell you how to listen to live NBA action, check scores, and get schedule info. 

After you’ve opened the NBA skill…

(2) **To LISTEN TO A GAME**, tell me “Play the Cavs game" or “Stream the Atlanta game."  Most games have the home and away announcers, just say the team name for the announcers you want and we'll start streaming.  If Alexa has trouble recognizing your team name, be sure and use the city AND team name together, like “Houston Rockets.”

(3) To ask about the SCHEDULE, say “What games are on today?” OR “When do the Warriors play?”  Ask about a specific team to get broadcaster information for upcoming games.  

(4) Ask me about SCORES by saying, “What is the score of the Milwaukee Bucks game?” OR “What are the latest scores?"  

Additionally after opening the skill, you can say things to me like:

Who is playing now?
When do the Celtics play the Lakers?
What time are the Memphis Grizzlies on?
Did the Thunder win on Monday?

**You will need to login from the Alexa companion app with a valid NBA League Pass subscription in order to listen to games.  Visit www.nba.com/leaguepass to sign up today.
review: App works as it should! Great job NBA!

name: Marshawn Lynch's BeastMode
description:
The BeastMode Skill is a fun and informative skill. This skill allows you to say things like: 

Press Conference Questions

Alexa, Ask BeastMode... 

how was that defense?
how was the game?
what are you going to do after the game?
how are you feeling?
what's next for you?

You can also ask for facts about Marshawn:

Alexa, Ask BeastMode when he was drafted
Alexa, Ask BeastMode what NFL teams he played on
Alexa, Ask BeastMode where the nickname BeastMode came from 
Alexa, Ask BeastMode where he grew up
Alexa, Ask BeastMode what sports he was good at in high school
Alexa, Ask BeastMode where he went to college
Alexa, Ask BeastMode what jersey number did he wear in college
Alexa, Ask BeastMode what awards did you win in college
Alexa, Ask BeastMode when did you announce your retirement
Alexa, Ask BeastMode What’s your favorite candy

For more information visit us at http://beastmodeonline.com
review: Must have skill!

Any true ‘bama fan should have this installed.
I lost my kids after yelling roll tide for hours...

name: FantasyMetrix
description:
Alexa will provide past and present, weekly and season-long, statistics along with advanced metrics derived from NFL players using the Yahoo Fantasy Sports API

How To Use For Metrics:
1. Name of a current NFL player who has played in at least one game
2. Valid football metric pertaining to that player's position (See list below)
3. Year of an NFL season ranging from 2001 – Present
4. Week number is merely optional (Week 1 – 17)
5. Target metrics are only available beginning from year 2014 – Present

How To Use For Schedule:
1. Name of an NFL team
2. Year of an NFL season ranging from 2002 – Present
3. Week number ranging from Week 1 – 17

Quick Example Phrases:
Alexa, ask FantasyMetrix Rob Gronkowski, season stats, 2010
Alexa, ask FantasyMetrix Julio Jones, yards per reception, 2011
Alexa, ask FantasyMetrix Marshawn Lynch, rushing yards, 2012
Alexa, ask FantasyMetrix Russell Wilson, completions, twenty thirteen
Alexa, ask FantasyMetrix Oakland Raiders, week 10, twenty fourteen

Football Metrics:
Carries
Catch Rate
Completions
Completion Percentage
Fantasy Points
Fantasy Points Per Game
Fumbles
Game Log
Games Played
Half PPR Points
Half PPR Points Per Game
Interceptions
Passing Attempts
Passing Attempts Per Game
Passing Touchdowns
Passing Yards
Passing Yards Per Game
PPR Points
PPR Points Per Game
Receiving Touchdowns
Receiving Yards
Receiving Yards Per Game
Receptions
Receptions Per Game
Return Touchdowns
Rushing Attempts
Rushing Attempts Per Game
Rushing Touchdowns
Rushing Yards
Rushing Yards Per Game
Season Stats
Targets
Targets Per Game
Total Touchdowns
Two Point Conversions
Yards From Scrimmage
Yards From Scrimmage Per Game
Yards Per Attempt
Yards Per Carry
Yards Per Reception
Yards Per Target

name: Cubs Baseball Unauthorized Trivia
description:

Cubs Baseball  Trivia is great for the entire family. Play with or against each other and see who really knows their Cubbies.

New trivia is constantly being added to the skill so keep coming back and playing.

If you have questions or comments please let us know:
Steve@dwilsys.com.

This skill is not sponsored or endorsed by Major League Baseball or the Chicago Cubs. This is a fan created game.

name: Soccer Drills
description:
**Version 2.0 Update**
If you are interested in improving your soccer skills, this is the Skill for you! Soccer Drills is a skill that was designed to improve soccer skills using several common drills, in a fun manner. Drills include tick tocks, toe touches, juggling, and more. 

To get started, say "Alexa, Start Soccer Drills", and you will be prompted to select a drill, and can immediately start to improve your soccer game.

Please share any feedback, as we are anxious to make this a great aid to your soccer game!

name: NHL
description:
The Official NHL Skill is the best way for hockey fans using Alexa to get detailed information on NHL scores, schedules, standings and current players.

Open the skill by saying, “Alexa, open NHL.”

To check scores, you can ask Alexa questions such as “Ask NHL, what is the score of the Red Wings game?”  You can ask for game previews and recaps as well as real-time updates during every NHL game.

To get team schedules, you can ask Alexa questions such as “Ask NHL, when is the next Sharks game?” or “Who do the Maple Leafs play tomorrow?

You can also ask for biographical and statistical information on every current NHL player.
 
To set reminders 30 minutes before the start of your favorite team’s game, “Ask NHL, reminders”  

The Official NHL Skill is available on the Echo Dot, Echo Spot, Echo Show, Fire TV and all Alexa enabled devices 

Created by the National Hockey League
review: NHL needs to add Favorite Team, and live game updates like ESPN and Fox Sports have on their Apps. Love hearing my teams goal horn on my cell phone when they score. Id love to hear it louder in my home via Alexa!

name: Audio Goal
description: Celebrate a goal - or anything else - with a classic audio "GOOOOOL" sound.  Try different languages too (Currently supports French and Spanish)
review: Every time the Sounders score a goal, and we are watching the match at home, we ask Audio Goal for a GOAL!  Works every time, wonder if it will work with the Fire TV Cube...  Will have to try that next.

name: Calling the Hogs
description:
Have Alexa call the razorbacks hogs by saying

"Alexa, start calling the hogs"

Optionally "and let's beat the {mascot}" or "and let's beat {college}"  can be included at the end of the launch command.

"Alexa, Start calling the hogs and beat the bulldogs"
"Alexa, Start calling the hogs and beat Alabama"

name: Coach Harbaugh
description:
Need to get fired up? Of course you don't - you are already attacking today with an enthusiasm unknown to mankind. But how about having your own personal Jim Harbaugh to entertain you on game day? Or on Mondays. Or every single morning while you wash down your steak breakfast with whole milk. 

You can say:
1. Alexa, ask Coach Harbaugh for a quote
2. Alexa, ask Coach Harbaugh to play "The Victors"
3. Alexa, ask Coach Harbaugh WHO'S GOT IT BETTER THAN US!?

Please note that this skill is not affiliated with the University of Michigan in any way. I'm just a fan with the constitutional right to share Jim Harbaugh's wisdom with you.

Special thanks to Sibish Basheer for making this possible.
review: Completely useless.
