name: Baseball Reference
description:
Welcome to the Baseball Reference Alexa application. This application makes finding out leaders in certain statistics as easy as just asking. As of right now this app can only return top ranking and you cannot make request by specific players or team statistics.

Users are able to request a multitude of different statistics that can be further specified by rank (1-10), top amount (top two, top three, top four, etc.) year (1871 - present), and league (All of Baseball, National League or American League). 

Here are some initial example requests:
-------------------------------------------
Alexa, ask Baseball Reference who is third in the National League in home runs.

Who leads the league in doubles?

Who lead the American League in wins in nineteen eighty six?

Who is the oldest player in the league?

Alexa, ask Baseball Reference, in nineteen ninety nine, who lead the league in home runs?

Who was top three in strikeouts?

Who was tenth in wins in the National League in nineteen seventy two
-------------------------------------------

Another feature available to users is that after a user makes a successful request and are prompted to ask another question, a user can build upon their previous request.


For Example:
-------------------------------------------
User Requests - "Alexa, ask Baseball Reference who was second in the National League in hits in nineteen eighty three"

Alexa Responds - "Rafael Ramirez was second in the National League with 185 Hits in 1983."

The user can now request a few things:

- Next -
User Requests - "Who was next?"
Alexa Responds -  "Al Oliver was third in the National League with 184 Hits in 1983."

- Previous -
User Requests - "Who was previous?"
Alexa Responds -  "Jose Cruz and Andre Dawson were tied for first in the National League with 189 Hits In 1983 ."

- Rank -
User Requests - "Who was sixth?"
Alexa Responds -  "Dickie Thon was sixth in the National League with 177 Hits In 1983."

- Top -
User Requests - "Who was top three?"
Alexa Responds -  "Jose Cruz and Andre Dawson were tied for first in the National League with 189 Hits In 1983. Rafael Ramirez was second in the National League with 185 Hits In 1983. Al Oliver was third in the National League with 184 Hits In 1983."
-------------------------------------------

Statistics To Request
-----------------------
// Hitting
Singles
Doubles
Triples
Home runs
RBIs
Runs
Stolen bases
Caught stealing
Batting average
Hits
Wins above replacement
Slugging percentage
Extra base hits
Total bases
On base percentage
Walks
Intentional walks
Sacrifice flies
At bats per home run
Grounded into double plays

// Pitching
Earned Run Average
Strikeouts
Strikes per walk
Strikeouts per nine innings
WHIP
Wins
Shutouts
Saves
Innings Pitches

//Misc
Oldest Player
Youngest Player

If you have any questions or comments regarding this application please feel free to reach out to us at ottomanellibaseball@gmail.com.
review: Once you say "Alexa, baseball reference," you'll be prompted to ask you question and it will work but you have to ask generic stat type questions, such as "who is leading the league in home runs" or "who had the best batting average in 1946?" It does a great job with this. But once you stray at all from this it goes off the rails.  It won't be able to answer individual questions, such as "what was Babe Ruth's average in 1923?". It won't even be able to answer a question like "who won the World Series in 1970?"  So it appears that it has to be specifically generic questions about individual stats which makes it limited.  If they can broaden the scope of questions it is able to answer it will be an impressive application.

name: Game Day Nutrition
description: Youth athletes need to focus on game day nutrition in order to excel athletically.  These tips will help get your youth athlete game day ready.  Whether it is soccer, swimming, basketball, or any other sport, athletes need to fuel their bodies for game day readiness. What foods are best for mental focus? When should I eat between races? What protein should I eat the day before a big track meet? Is Chocolate Milk better than Gatorade for performance and repair?  These are just some of the questions and tips that you can find on Game Day Nutrition.

name: ESPN Flash Briefing
description:
Want to stay up to date on the latest sports news? From Aaron Rodgers to Zlatan Ibrahimović, your ESPN Flash Briefings bring you the hottest stories in sports, updated throughout the day.
 
Add ESPN to your Flash Briefing, then say "Alexa, what's my Flash Briefing?" to tune in.
review: The background music is just added noise and the news has to be YELLED!  This is VERY annoying.

name: Diamondbacks Daily Dose
description: This is not an official Dbacks brieifing, but a daily briefing about what is happening with your Arizona Diamondbacks baseball team.

name: Reiki Music
description:
Reiki Music is a skill to give you music for healing, chakra balance, or meditation. Or listen to all for a true healing experience. You can choose one or any combination. These musical selections have been specifically selected to be wonderful for each application. 

Included:
Zen Garden by Sound Healing Center
Ananda by Anne Brunson
Chakra Healing Tones for each chakra by Kaleah
Weightless by Marconi Union


You can say:

"Alexa, open Reiki Music"
"Alexa, start Reiki Music"
"Alexa, launch Reiki Music"

Please leave a 5-star review if you love this skill, or send us an email with your suggestions at ReikiAwakening.com. Your 5-star reviews encourage us to keep making more great skills, thanks!
review: I used to love this skill. However now after I tell it what type of music to play nothing happens.

name: Games Back
description: This skill will give you an up-to-date count of how many games back your favorite baseball team is from first place.  It also tells you what place they are in their division, and what their current win-loss record is.
review: Nice example of self-build skills by Jeff

name: NCAA March Madness
description:
NCAA March Madness for Alexa delivers real-time tournament scores, schedules, information about your Bracket Picks, and live radio for each game.

Example Phrases:

“Alexa, ask March Madness what games are on right now?”

“Alexa, ask March Madness for today's scores.”

“Alexa, ask March Madness for today's schedule.”

“Alexa, ask March Madness what games can I listen to on the radio?”

“Alexa, ask March Madness for the score of the North Carolina game.”

“Alexa, ask March Madness to play the Duke versus Kentucky game.”

“Alexa, ask March Madness what time the Kansas game starts.”

“Alexa, ask March Madness how my bracket is doing.”

“Alexa, ask March Madness who I picked to win it all.”

“Alexa, ask March Madness which teams I picked today.”

To ask for help or give feedback on this skill please contact mmlivehelp@turner.com

*Note: The live radio feature is currently not supported on Fire TV.

*Note: Must sign-in with a valid Capital One NCAA March Madness Bracket Challenge account in order to get information about your bracket picks.
review: Alexa understands nothing about college basketball ill have to try Google home

name: NBC Sports Update
description:
The NBC Sports Update brings you national sports news, every hour, 24/7. 

Add the NBC Sports Update to your Flash Briefing and move it to the top of your news by going to Settings in the Alexa app. You can manage your Flash Briefing under Account. After adding the NBC Sports Update, you can say “Alexa, what’s my Flash Briefing?” or “Alexa, what’s in the news?” to hear the latest.
review: Updates for basketball, loves NBA and forgets other sports

name: Jets Fan
description:
Get unofficial to-the-minute stats & fun facts on the Jets by Fresh Digital Group. This skill isn’t sponsored or endorsed by the Jets.

Here’s some ways you can use the skill. We have given you many different ways for you to talk to Alexa:



General Updates:


Alexa, ask Jets Fan how are the Jets doing? 

Alexa, ask Jets Fan who do the Jets play next?

Alexa, ask Jets Fan Muhammad Wilkerson (or any player's First name, Last name) touchdown update. 



Fun Facts about the Jets:


Alexa, ask Jets Fan to tell me some trivia about the Jets. 

Alexa, ask Jets Fan how many Super Bowls have the Jets won?

description:

All without ever putting your hands on the ball.

Unfortunately it always cuts off before the update is over and moves to my next flash briefing. It really stinks because is often right at #1. I'm fairly new to the echo so I don't know if it an issue with the echo or the this particular briefing.

name: Coach Harbaugh
description:
Need to get fired up? Of course you don't - you are already attacking today with an enthusiasm unknown to mankind. But how about having your own personal Jim Harbaugh to entertain you on game day? Or on Mondays. Or every single morning while you wash down your steak breakfast with whole milk. 

You can say:
1. Alexa, ask Coach Harbaugh for a quote
2. Alexa, ask Coach Harbaugh to play "The Victors"
3. Alexa, ask Coach Harbaugh WHO'S GOT IT BETTER THAN US!?

Please note that this skill is not affiliated with the University of Michigan in any way. I'm just a fan with the constitutional right to share Jim Harbaugh's wisdom with you.

Special thanks to Sibish Basheer for making this possible.
review: So good

name: ESPN Flash Briefing
description:

Add ESPN to your Flash Briefing, then say "Alexa, what's my Flash Briefing?" to tune in.
review: Everyday it is 2 minutes long. First minute and a half is in-depth look at all games NBA. Every game is who beat who. Lebron sound clip. Mentions injuries and updates. Last 30 seconds is baseball, hockey, golf, and football if in season. Even during playoff hockey it's 1.5 minute NBA and 5 second update on 1 NHL Playoff game even though there were 4 games the night before. Hate this skill. Probably going to delete it.

name: The Times Sport
description:

In this bitesize briefing, Natalie will bring you the thoughts of our award-winning writers including Henry Winter, Oliver Kay, Matt Dickinson and Alyson Rudd on the big games and deliver her own Premier League predictions.

She will also test your knowledge by bringing you Times statistician Bill Edgar's Premier League teaser.
If you want to hear more from Natalie then you can subscribe to The Game podcast, which she will present every Monday and Thursday.

For more football news, comment and analysis from The Times visit www.thetimes.co.uk/sport

name: Hockey Updates
description:
Hockey Updates provides live score and audio updates for NHL games. Hockey Updates will let you know when the puck drops, a penalty is incurred or a goal scored.

To use Hockey Updates ask Alexa to open the skill.

'Alexa, open Hockey Updates'

Tell Alexa which game you'd like to follow.

'The Canadiens'

If you'd like live audio updates, just say yes!

'Yes'

You'll hear the faint sound of a hockey practice to let you know that Hockey Updates is running. Once the game starts you'll hear regular updates, live from the rink.

To stop Hockey Updates, ask Alexa to cancel or stop at any time.

'Alexa, stop'

name: NCAA March Madness
description:
NCAA March Madness for Alexa delivers real-time tournament scores, schedules, information about your Bracket Picks, and live radio for each game.

Example Phrases:

“Alexa, ask March Madness what games are on right now?”

“Alexa, ask March Madness for today's scores.”

“Alexa, ask March Madness for today's schedule.”

“Alexa, ask March Madness what games can I listen to on the radio?”

“Alexa, ask March Madness for the score of the North Carolina game.”

“Alexa, ask March Madness to play the Duke versus Kentucky game.”

“Alexa, ask March Madness what time the Kansas game starts.”

“Alexa, ask March Madness how my bracket is doing.”

“Alexa, ask March Madness who I picked to win it all.”

“Alexa, ask March Madness which teams I picked today.”

To ask for help or give feedback on this skill please contact mmlivehelp@turner.com

*Note: The live radio feature is currently not supported on Fire TV.

*Note: Must sign-in with a valid Capital One NCAA March Madness Bracket Challenge account in order to get information about your bracket picks.
review: Would be nice if you could ask for the current and final scores, as if you're looking at the score ticker at the bottom of your tv screen. I don't know all of the specific teams or games being played. If your team is out, you don't care about specific teams. Just want all scores for the current round.

name: Running Outfit Advisor
description:
The Running Outfit Advisor provides running apparel recommendations based on current weather conditions in your area or based on your inputs. Choosing current weather conditions may prompt you to enable location permissions in your Alexa app. 
Our exclusive apparel algorithm provides personalized apparel recommendations based on weather conditions and gender.

If you choose apparel advice based current weather conditions, Alexa will pull temperature, humidity, wind speed, and other weather conditions based on your zip code. Alexa will prompt you for your gender and create a personalized recommendation based on our exclusive apparel algorithm.

If you select running outfit advice based on your inputs, Alexa will ask you for your gender, temperature, weather conditions (sunny, windy, cloudy, or raining), and your run intensity (easy run, or race) and create a personalized recommendation based on our exclusive apparel algorithm. Feel free to adjust based on your personal preference. This is only intended to be a guide.
comment heading: Interesting idea...but could be a lot better
review: I like the idea of having an Alexa skill help you figure out what to wear for a run. And this skill does do that...after some work. You basically have to tell it everything--eg male/female, temperature, kind of run, etc. and then it gives you a canned recommendation, which isn't bad. The only thing that would be really cool is if it could remember your stats, and if it could incorporate a live weather feed so that you don't have to tell it that. For example, "Alexa, ask running outfit advisor for a recommendation for Mark in Denver Colorado today at 2pm". If it could remember that Mark is a male and look up the weather, that would be very cool. This is a great idea that could/should be built upon. Nice start!

name: NBA
description:
Welcome to the new NBA Alexa Skill! You can interact with me in several ways:

(1) Open me by saying "Alexa, open NBA." You should always start your conversation with me this way.  This will trigger the welcome menu and tell you how to listen to live NBA action, check scores, and get schedule info. 

After you’ve opened the NBA skill…

(2) **To LISTEN TO A GAME**, tell me “Play the Cavs game" or “Stream the Atlanta game."  Most games have the home and away announcers, just say the team name for the announcers you want and we'll start streaming.  If Alexa has trouble recognizing your team name, be sure and use the city AND team name together, like “Houston Rockets.”

(3) To ask about the SCHEDULE, say “What games are on today?” OR “When do the Warriors play?”  Ask about a specific team to get broadcaster information for upcoming games.  

(4) Ask me about SCORES by saying, “What is the score of the Milwaukee Bucks game?” OR “What are the latest scores?"  

Additionally after opening the skill, you can say things to me like:

Who is playing now?
When do the Celtics play the Lakers?
What time are the Memphis Grizzlies on?
Did the Thunder win on Monday?

**You will need to login from the Alexa companion app with a valid NBA League Pass subscription in order to listen to games.  Visit www.nba.com/leaguepass to sign up today.
comment heading: Great addition to my NBA League Pass subscription
review: I’m a huge Cavs fan and love listening to John, Jim and Mike. Streaming radio is included with my LP subscription and it’s very easy to set up and use. Great job, NBA!

name: Fort Collins Trail Buddy
description: This skill uses data provided by the city of Fort Collins and Larimer County to provide information on which natural areas are open to biking and hiking.  The information is updated every morning.
comment heading: This app has been great, particularly in the spring when there are a ...
review: This app has been great, particularly in the spring when there are a lot of trails closed for muddy conditions.

name: Metcon Workouts
description:
MetCon® Nutrition is committed to creating Innovative; All Natural, Paleo Friendly, Pharmacist, and Athlete designed Sports Nutrition Supplements focused on Increasing muscle Endurance, Speed, Power and overall Performance. We produce the most effective Sports Nutrition supplements without any fillers, artificial sweeteners, flavors or colors.

MetCon® Nutrition Supplements are made to deliver concentrated nutrients at specific times of exercise to help Athletes push themselves to their optimal performance limits to get the most out of their training, races, and competitions. MetCon® is designed to optimize Conditioning, CrossFit, Triathlons, MMA, Team Sports, Interval Weight Training and any other activities requiring increased Muscle Endurance.

MetCon Nutrition's founder, Dan Cox, has over a decade of experience in the Nutrition and Healthy Beverage industries.

Cox talks regularly on this podcast / flash briefing about how to maximize your fitness and nutrition.
review: These are exactly what I need when I wake up.  Have taken the products for over a year and love their new workout platform.

name: Fantasy Football ADP
description:
Are you starting to prep for your 2018 fantasy football draft? Of course, you are.

By now you're probably dreading having to look up the average draft position (ADP) of the different guys you're evaluating. 

Don't sweat it. We've built the ultimate fantasy football prep machine.

Now, simply ask Alexa what the ADP is of a certain player is and she'll tell you. 

It's literally talking fantasy football.

Here's an example of what you need to ask to get the ADP you're looking for:
- What is the ADP of Tom Brady?
- What is the average draft position of Drew Brees?
- Alex Smith

Using one of those variants (with your player's name swapped out) will give you exactly what you're looking for!

Note: 
All ADP's come courtesy of Fantasy Football Calculator and are based on 10-team standard scoring leagues.
review: Getting the ADP of fantasy players has never been easier. Simply ask and Alexa answers.

name: UFC Octagon News
description:
Have you ever asked yourself when is the next UFC event? Or what were the fights in the upcoming UFC main event? Now with this new UFC Octagon News skill, one can get the answer to these questions through Alexa. The UFC Octagon News was created for UFC fans to receive UFC related information easily through an Alexa device.

One can invoke this skill by saying "Alexa, open UFC Octagon".

Once the skill starts, it will prompt the listener to say something like "news", "next event", "previous event" or "men ranking". Then, the listener can choose the desired option to receive the related information back from Alexa.

Please note that this skill will continue growing based on the feedback and support we receive back from listeners. Currently, below are the main features:

1.	Say "news" to get more information about trending news relating to UFC. This option will also provide any other 
        update or new feature messages about this skill.

2.	Say "next event" to get more information about the next UFC main event such as date, place, main card fights.

3.	Say "previous event" to get more information about the results of the previous UFC main card fights.

4.	Say "men ranking" to get more information about all the UFC ranking categories for men. Please note that only the 
        champion and the top 3 ranked men fighters will be listed for each category.

5.	Say "women ranking" to get more information about all the UFC ranking categories for women. Please note that 
        only the champion and the top 3 ranked women fighters will be listed for each category.

6.	Say "stop" if you wish to exit the skill.

7.	Say "help" to get more information about how to use this Alexa skill.

Please feel free to contact us at quizmemore@yahoo.com for any issues or feedback you might have. We would love to hear from you about this skill to help us make this a better experience for everyone.

skills-rest: The Rookie's Guide to the NFL
name: The Rookie's Guide to the NFL
description:
The Rookie's Guide to the NFL is your official way to learn about the National Football League. Become an expert by asking about the rules, penalties, scoring plays, commentator lingo, previous Super Bowls, team formations, and more.

After enabling the skill, say 'Open NFL' or 'Launch NFL' to use The Rookie's Guide.

Once you've opened the skill, you can say things like:
-What is defensive pass interference?
-How many players are on a team?
-Who won Super Bowl 35?
-What's the difference between a running back and a wide receiver?
-Tell me about the Music City Miracle
-How tall is Aaron Rodgers?
-What does ‘move the chains’ mean?
Or, just say 'Surprise me' to hear a new definition

If you get stuck within the skill, say 'Alexa, what does this skill do?' to hear more options.
review: It couldn't answer the first three questions I had.

name: Prime Light Meditation
description:
Prime Light Meditation is a 20 minutes guided meditation narrated by "Jesse Elder" for the exclusive use of his private "Legacy Community" members.  This skill provides a convenient way for Legacy members to listen to the guided meditation without having to physically interact with other playback devices and to have a less distracted and more natural enjoyable experience.

To get started with the skill, you can say:

"Alexa, open Prime Light Meditation"
"Alexa, start Prime Light Meditation"
"Alexa, launch Prime Light Meditation"

Please leave a 5-star review if you love this skill, or send us an email with your suggestions at feedback@aialchemy.com. Your 5-star reviews encourage us to keep making more great skills, thanks!

This skill is inspired by the teachings of "Jesse Elder" and is created by "Amir Harouni" in deep appreciation and the desire to further the reach of Jesse's teachings.
review: This skill is powerful in that it truly helps you to get in touch with your true self.

name: Baseball BASIQs
description:
Baseball BASIQs helps develop your players' baseball IQ. 

Ask Alexa for a "situation" for any position and she will give you a setup (runners on base, # of outs) and tell you where and how the ball is hit.  She then takes a brief pause before explaining what should be done in the given situation.

An example would be:
 - "You are playing shortstop"
 - "There are runners on First and Third"
 - "There is one out"
 - "There is a hard-ground ball to Second Baseman"
 - "What is your play?"
 - "Your play is to hustle to Second Base to take the toss from Second Baseman for one out and then make quick throw to First Base to complete the double play!"

Baseball BASIQs contains over 7,000 situations to learn from! Give us a try today! 

Check us out at www.BASIQs.com
comment heading: Great teaching tool for young baseball players
review: My kids have been playing this for days. Really helpful.

name: New England Patriots
description:
Meet the Patriots!

Say “Alexa, open Patriots” to hear daily news updates, discover fun facts, and learn about coming to a game at Gillette Stadium.

You may ask:
What's new with the Patriots?
Play Patriots Radio.
What time is the game?
What is the Patriots schedule?
Tell me a fun fact about the Patriots.
Can bring a blanket to the game?
review: awesome for updates and content! Absolutely love this!!!

name: Yahoo Fantasy Football
description:
Does your line-up have what it takes? Login and link one of your existing Yahoo Fantasy Football head-to-head leagues to the Alexa Skill to track your team as they make their play for the championship. Competing in multiple Head-2-Head leagues? No problem, just say ‘Change league’ to easily switch to another league. 

Use the Alexa skill to get: 
– an overview of your team’s weekly matchup and score.
– your team’s injury/bye status. 
– player scores and injury updates.
All without ever putting your hands on the ball.

——

NOTE: This skill currently SUPPORTS Head-to-Head fantasy leagues only. It DOES NOT support Points leagues or Pick’Em.
review: Tried several times to get it to link... Alexa states I'm linked but when I ask any questions it states I'm not linked and directs me back to the main link page. Frustrat

name: FIFA World Cup Live
description: Your instant access voice companion for your favorite team. Hear how your country's doing with live updates and our in-game stats. Listen to schedules and each team’s standings so you never miss a game.
review: firat question she asks is what country want to know anout? You give her a country and she doesnt recognize any of them. cant get past that queation.i

name: NASCAR Flash Briefing
description: Tune-in each Monday for Monster Energy NASCAR Cup Series news updates & race highlights.
comment heading: waste of time does not work
review: don't work

name: My daily exercise
description:
Work out with Alexa throughout the week. Once you open the skill, just ask Alexa to start the workout. You can also ask Alexa for your progress.
This skill was created using a Skill Blueprint. Your requests to this skill are not shared with the skill developer.
review: It starts a routine telling me to do "burpees" or something and launches directly into a timer. What in the world is burpees?  Gave me this same unknown exercise the second time I tried it too with no explanation and I am uninstalling.

name: Utah Fishing
description:
Are you headed out the door to your favorite Utah fishing spot and need to know what the fishing is like? Utah Fishing gives you the most up-to-date fishing report including: status, species, and full report!
Open the skill by saying, “Alexa, open Utah Fishing.” Next, simply ask for the specific fishing spot. You can say, “Alexa, what’s the fishing report for Strawberry Reservoir?” Or, without opening the skill, simply ask Alexa for the report all in one command. You can say, “Alexa, ask Utah Fishing for the fishing report at Lake Powell.”
If at any point you need help simply ask Alexa for possible commands by saying, “Alexa help.”
For an interactive fishing reports map visit: https://wildlife.utah.gov/hotspots/
review:
No matter what variation of the name I try, Alexa won’t tell me how the fishing is at Otter Creek. Or Otter “Crick.” Or “Otter Creek Reservoir.”
Or .  . . You get the idea.

She did tell me the weather in Otter Creek, Florida. Not exactly what I was after.

name: ESPN
description:
Get your sports radio fix with the ESPN skill. From Mike and Mike to Dan Le Batard and Stu Gotz, this skill brings you live ESPN Radio, several ESPN affiliate stations, and hourly news updates.  

Say, "Tell me the news," "Play the radio," or ask for your local ESPN radio station to access the best in sports radio content.

Supported radio stations include:
- ESPN Radio
- ESPN Deportes Radio
- ESPN Chicago (WMVP 1000 AM)
- ESPN Los Angeles (KSPN 710 AM)
- ESPN New York (WEPN 98.7 FM)
- ESPN Deportes New York (WEPN 1050 AM)
review: Just dead air even though Alexa says its playing.

name: 92.3 The Fan
description: The sports news that matters to Cleveland sports fans from 92.3 The Fan
review: Not working - Alexa will give you 92.3 the beat station on iheartradio.

name: Cubbies Crib
description:
Are you a huge Chicago Cubs fan? Then you need the Cubbies Crib Flash Briefing Skill by FanSided to get the latest news, opinions and rumors on the Cubs. 

Cubbies Crib is the Chicago Cubs news and opinions site brought to you by the FanSided Network. Cubbies Crib is dedicated to providing top-notch Cubs news, views, and original content. This site also serves as a community for like-minded fans to come together to catch up on the latest news and to discuss their passion.

name: Baseball Archive
description: Baseball Archive provides information and statistics for any of the 18000+ players in Major League Baseball History. Just ask about any player for a quick summary, or ask for a specific statistic for a player. Currently, Baseball Archive supports asking for a batter's career hits, home runs, and a pitcher's career wins, losses and strike outs. The Baseball Archive will add support for many more stats in subsequent versions.
review: I got the wrong stats about Pedro Martinez, for example. I don't trust this app.

name: Soccer Nerd
description:
Ask Alexa all about previous and upcoming soccer games with much more functionality coming soon.
"Alexa, ask Soccer Nerd who does Chelsea FC play next?".
"Alexa, ask Soccer Nerd who did Barcelona play last?".
For now, Footballer answers queries about the Premier League (United Kingdom), Primera Division (Spain) and Primeira Liga (Portugal) and respective teams.
If you have any questions or would like to see more features get in touch at soccer_nerd@henriquedantas.com.

description:

name: NewsChest: Unofficial FC Barcelona news
description:
Interested on FC Barcelona football team? With this skill you can get the latest news, it gathers and filters the news for you.

Say Get Headlines and then move forward (next) or backward (previous) through the article headlines.
Say Read to read the article
Say Get News to get the latest article.
You can use standards intents: Repeat, StartOver, Help, Cancel, Stop.
review: Perfect

name: Let's Talk Soccer
description: Football. Soccer. Futbol.  Wherever you're from and whatever you call it, you love The Beautiful Game.  So do we. We're a father and son team that lives the sport. Our daily briefings will focus primarily on the Premier League and Fantasy Premier League.  On the Fantasy side, we offer information and tips - everything you'll need to put manage your best FPL team.  But, we go further and deeper with the content to include major news events, such as player transfer, as well as big stories from other domestic leagues, the big tournaments (think: Champions League), and all the notable and newsworthy players.  We provide insights and perspectives that you won't find anywhere else.  We know our stuff and deliver it in a passionate and fun way. Also, check us out on Instagram - @ LetsTalkSoccer - where you'll find even more information and entertainment related to the game.  We hope you enjoy!
review: Very informative and fun. Love listening!

name: NBA
description:
Welcome to the new NBA Alexa Skill! You can interact with me in several ways:

(1) Open me by saying "Alexa, open NBA." You should always start your conversation with me this way.  This will trigger the welcome menu and tell you how to listen to live NBA action, check scores, and get schedule info. 

After you’ve opened the NBA skill…

(2) **To LISTEN TO A GAME**, tell me “Play the Cavs game" or “Stream the Atlanta game."  Most games have the home and away announcers, just say the team name for the announcers you want and we'll start streaming.  If Alexa has trouble recognizing your team name, be sure and use the city AND team name together, like “Houston Rockets.”

(3) To ask about the SCHEDULE, say “What games are on today?” OR “When do the Warriors play?”  Ask about a specific team to get broadcaster information for upcoming games.  

(4) Ask me about SCORES by saying, “What is the score of the Milwaukee Bucks game?” OR “What are the latest scores?"  

Additionally after opening the skill, you can say things to me like:

Who is playing now?
When do the Celtics play the Lakers?
What time are the Memphis Grizzlies on?
Did the Thunder win on Monday?

**You will need to login from the Alexa companion app with a valid NBA League Pass subscription in order to listen to games.  Visit www.nba.com/leaguepass to sign up today.
comment heading: You have to be a League Pass Customer.
review: Just found out that you have to be a full NBA League Pass customer to use this service. Which costs ~$200.00. I would do this if they allowed for an audio only account at a significantly lower cost.

name: Football Teams
description:
Ask Alexa for the name of a random football team. 

This is an unofficial skill. This skill is not sponsored or endorsed by NFL Enterprises LLC.
review: This skill horrible

name: NCAA March Madness
description:
NCAA March Madness for Alexa delivers real-time tournament scores, schedules, information about your Bracket Picks, and live radio for each game.

Example Phrases:

“Alexa, ask March Madness what games are on right now?”

“Alexa, ask March Madness for today's scores.”

“Alexa, ask March Madness for today's schedule.”

“Alexa, ask March Madness what games can I listen to on the radio?”

“Alexa, ask March Madness for the score of the North Carolina game.”

“Alexa, ask March Madness to play the Duke versus Kentucky game.”

“Alexa, ask March Madness what time the Kansas game starts.”

“Alexa, ask March Madness how my bracket is doing.”

“Alexa, ask March Madness who I picked to win it all.”

“Alexa, ask March Madness which teams I picked today.”

To ask for help or give feedback on this skill please contact mmlivehelp@turner.com

*Note: The live radio feature is currently not supported on Fire TV.

*Note: Must sign-in with a valid Capital One NCAA March Madness Bracket Challenge account in order to get information about your bracket picks.
review: Worthless. Won't find anything, not even the local IHeart radio station is was previously able to find.

name: Overwatch League
description:
Recent additions:
Ask for today's games, yesterday's results or tomorrow's games. Also, ask for the record of your favorite team to get overall match wins and losses for the season. Also included are a few more Overwatch "Hello" emotes when launching the skill.

With the Overwatch League skill you can keep track of when your favorite teams are playing and always know the current league standings. Or, if you simply just want to know when the next game is you can ask Overwatch League to tell you when the next match is. In order to get match start times in your local timezone this skill requests permissions to access device country and postal code. Be sure to ask for help to hear an explanation for the available commands.
review: The Easter eggs are great! Glad this app is a thing!

name: One Minute Workout Sensei
description:
UPDATE: Michael just added another workout because he wants you to get RIPPED fast! (workouts will play randomly so you never know what you're going to get)

Join Michael, your One Minute Workout Sensei, as he helps you gain muscle and lose weight--right from your very own kitchen! It only takes one minute per day for noticeable results. 

ABOUT YOUR SENSEI: Michael is a high-energy, over-the-top, passionate Navy SEAL-style instructor, who exercises 24/7. He wants to take YOU to the next level--and he'll make DARN SURE you get there. 

You can say:

"Alexa, start one minute workout"
"Alexa, open one minute workout"
"Alexa, play one minute workout"

Please leave a 5-star review if you love this skill and Michael will add more FREE workouts! Send us an email with your suggestions at k@app316.com.

*The information in this skill is provided for informational and educational purposes only.
comment heading: Perfect for motivating your work team
review: Downloaded this to our Echo at work to get our hourly workouts in and found it hilariously amazing. Keep up the good work.

name: Audio Goal
description: Celebrate a goal - or anything else - with a classic audio "GOOOOOL" sound.  Try different languages too (Currently supports French and Spanish)
review: Hilarious.  Exceeded expectations

review: I would like to just get NFL scores..it would be a cool feature...

name: Games Back
description: This skill will give you an up-to-date count of how many games back your favorite baseball team is from first place.  It also tells you what place they are in their division, and what their current win-loss record is.
review: I asked Alexa for the Indians, the response, "I'm sorry, I don't think the Indians is a baseball team."  Tried several others, same response

name: Coach Harbaugh
description:
Need to get fired up? Of course you don't - you are already attacking today with an enthusiasm unknown to mankind. But how about having your own personal Jim Harbaugh to entertain you on game day? Or on Mondays. Or every single morning while you wash down your steak breakfast with whole milk. 

You can say:
1. Alexa, ask Coach Harbaugh for a quote
2. Alexa, ask Coach Harbaugh to play "The Victors"
3. Alexa, ask Coach Harbaugh WHO'S GOT IT BETTER THAN US!?

Please note that this skill is not affiliated with the University of Michigan in any way. I'm just a fan with the constitutional right to share Jim Harbaugh's wisdom with you.

Special thanks to Sibish Basheer for making this possible.

name: Calling the Hogs
description:
Have Alexa call the razorbacks hogs by saying

"Alexa, start calling the hogs"

Optionally "and let's beat the {mascot}" or "and let's beat {college}"  can be included at the end of the launch command.

"Alexa, Start calling the hogs and beat the bulldogs"
"Alexa, Start calling the hogs and beat Alabama"
review: Impressed to see it as an option. The delivery is comical.

name: BDGE Fantasy Football | 2018
description:
Brought to you live from the BDGE HQ, Nick Ercolano is tackling everything 2018 Fantasy Football with some wit, grit & (being?) lit. Draft prep, waiver-wire advice, sit/start questions, it's all here my fellow big dogs. *barks twice*

New briefings go live at 9:30 AM (EST) every morning, 7 days a week.

Find more content from BDGE Fantasy Football
YouTube: Nick Ercolano
Instagram: @bdge_fantasyfootball
Twitter: @nick_bdge
Blog: www.BigDogsFantasy.com

Contact Email: nick@bigdogsfantasy.com

name: Cricket Info
description:
You can ask for brief, detailed or quick score updates. You can ask for score or schedule for any team. Examples, 
“Alexa, ask cricket info to get score update” gets brief score update of all on going matches.
“Alexa, ask cricket info to get team India schedule” gets schedule of team India cricket matches.
"Alexa, ask cricket info to get IPL update" gets score updates for ongoing IPL matches. 
“Alexa, ask cricket info to get quick score update” gets score summary for all ongoing matches, you can optionally request quick score for a team.
“Alexa, ask cricket info to get team Australia detailed score” gets detailed score for ongoing match of team Australia.
review: This skill is amazing. I now can get an update of my favorite games instantly

name: Baseball Reference
description:
Welcome to the Baseball Reference Alexa application. This application makes finding out leaders in certain statistics as easy as just asking. As of right now this app can only return top ranking and you cannot make request by specific players or team statistics.

Users are able to request a multitude of different statistics that can be further specified by rank (1-10), top amount (top two, top three, top four, etc.) year (1871 - present), and league (All of Baseball, National League or American League). 

Here are some initial example requests:
-------------------------------------------
Alexa, ask Baseball Reference who is third in the National League in home runs.

Who leads the league in doubles?

Who lead the American League in wins in nineteen eighty six?

Who is the oldest player in the league?

Alexa, ask Baseball Reference, in nineteen ninety nine, who lead the league in home runs?

Who was top three in strikeouts?

Who was tenth in wins in the National League in nineteen seventy two
-------------------------------------------

Another feature available to users is that after a user makes a successful request and are prompted to ask another question, a user can build upon their previous request.


For Example:
-------------------------------------------
User Requests - "Alexa, ask Baseball Reference who was second in the National League in hits in nineteen eighty three"

Alexa Responds - "Rafael Ramirez was second in the National League with 185 Hits in 1983."

The user can now request a few things:

- Next -
User Requests - "Who was next?"
Alexa Responds -  "Al Oliver was third in the National League with 184 Hits in 1983."

- Previous -
User Requests - "Who was previous?"
Alexa Responds -  "Jose Cruz and Andre Dawson were tied for first in the National League with 189 Hits In 1983 ."

- Rank -
User Requests - "Who was sixth?"
Alexa Responds -  "Dickie Thon was sixth in the National League with 177 Hits In 1983."

- Top -
User Requests - "Who was top three?"
Alexa Responds -  "Jose Cruz and Andre Dawson were tied for first in the National League with 189 Hits In 1983. Rafael Ramirez was second in the National League with 185 Hits In 1983. Al Oliver was third in the National League with 184 Hits In 1983."
-------------------------------------------

Statistics To Request
-----------------------
// Hitting
Singles
Doubles
Triples
Home runs
RBIs
Runs
Stolen bases
Caught stealing
Batting average
Hits
Wins above replacement
Slugging percentage
Extra base hits
Total bases
On base percentage
Walks
Intentional walks
Sacrifice flies
At bats per home run
Grounded into double plays

// Pitching
Earned Run Average
Strikeouts
Strikes per walk
Strikeouts per nine innings
WHIP
Wins
Shutouts
Saves
Innings Pitches

//Misc
Oldest Player
Youngest Player

If you have any questions or comments regarding this application please feel free to reach out to us at ottomanellibaseball@gmail.com.
review: I just asked her the same questions and got them.... eyed to start with ask baseball reference.

name: Reiki Music

Reiki Music is a skill to give you music for healing, chakra balance, or meditation. Or listen to all for a true healing experience. You can choose one or any combination. These musical selections have been specifically selected to be wonderful for each application.

User Requests - "Who was sixth?"
Alexa Responds -  "Dickie Thon was sixth in the National League with 177 Hits In 1983."

- Top -
User Requests - "Who was top three?"
Alexa Responds -  "Jose Cruz and Andre Dawson were tied for first in the National League with 189 Hits In 1983. Rafael Ramirez was second in the National League with 185 Hits In 1983. Al Oliver was third in the National League with 184 Hits In 1983."

skills-rest: The Rookie's Guide to the NFL
name: The Rookie's Guide to the NFL
description:
The Rookie's Guide to the NFL is your official way to learn about the National Football League. Become an expert by asking about the rules, penalties, scoring plays, commentator lingo, previous Super Bowls, team formations, and more.

After enabling the skill, say 'Open NFL' or 'Launch NFL' to use The Rookie's Guide.

Once you've opened the skill, you can say things like:
-What is defensive pass interference?
-How many players are on a team?
-Who won Super Bowl 35?
-What's the difference between a running back and a wide receiver?
-Tell me about the Music City Miracle
-How tall is Aaron Rodgers?
-What does ‘move the chains’ mean?
Or, just say 'Surprise me' to hear a new definition

If you get stuck within the skill, say 'Alexa, what does this skill do?' to hear more options.
review: Seems to do what it says. Voice is different and it's answered my questions.

name: Mt. Bachelor Update
description: Stay up to date with what is going on at Mt. Bachelor. With over 4,300 acres of lift-accessible terrain, you won’t want to pass up a trip to the ski resort with the highest skiable elevation in all of Oregon and Washington! Mt. Bachelor, located on the eastern flanks of Oregon’s Central Cascades, is known for its light, dry snow, diverse terrain, family-friendliness and long seasons.
review: I love Mt. Bachelor and being able to get updates on my alexa!

name: Josh Allen Facts
description: Get to know the potential #1 overall pick in this year's NFL Draft. Josh Allen Facts includes over 50 facts about the former Wyoming quarterback.
review: Heheheh

Hosted by Jerod Morris, this short flash briefing will keep you up-to-date on what's going on with your Hoosiers on the court and on the recruiting trail, with occasional nods to important historical events as well.

description:

Add ESPN to your Flash Briefing, then say "Alexa, what's my Flash Briefing?" to tune in.

skills-rest: Gratitude Power for Runners and Walkers
name: Gratitude Power for Runners and Walkers
description:
Your level of gratitude affects your happiness, which affects your performance as a runner or walker.

Gratitude Power for Runners and Walkers helps you to raise your gratitude level as a runner or walker by giving you a random statement of gratitude related to running or walking from a bank of more than 900 statements.

Gratitude Power for Runners and Walkers is an Alexa skill based on the SpryFeet.com book of the same name. To learn more about the gratitude statements in this skill, get the book, which is available in Kindle and paperback formats.

Go to http://www.spryfeet.com/books/gratitudepower/ to learn more.

Copyright © 2016 Kirk Mahoney, Ph.D. All rights reserved.
Icon graphic © Dejan Jovanovic - Fotolia.com.
review: Love the gratitude statements!  Encouraging and thoughtful!

name: The Times Sport
description:
Natalie Sawyer delivers the key news, stats and analysis in the build-up to the Premier League weekend. In this bitesize briefing, Natalie will bring you the thoughts of our award-winning writers including Henry Winter, Oliver Kay, Matt Dickinson and Alyson Rudd on the big games and deliver her own Premier League predictions.

She will also test your knowledge by bringing you Times statistician Bill Edgar's Premier League teaser.
If you want to hear more from Natalie then you can subscribe to The Game podcast, which she will present every Monday and Thursday.

For more football news, comment and analysis from The Times visit www.thetimes.co.uk/sport

review: good stuff!

name: NBA
description:
Welcome to the new NBA Alexa Skill! You can interact with me in several ways:

(1) Open me by saying "Alexa, open NBA." You should always start your conversation with me this way.  This will trigger the welcome menu and tell you how to listen to live NBA action, check scores, and get schedule info. 

After you’ve opened the NBA skill…

(2) **To LISTEN TO A GAME**, tell me “Play the Cavs game" or “Stream the Atlanta game."  Most games have the home and away announcers, just say the team name for the announcers you want and we'll start streaming.  If Alexa has trouble recognizing your team name, be sure and use the city AND team name together, like “Houston Rockets.”

(3) To ask about the SCHEDULE, say “What games are on today?” OR “When do the Warriors play?”  Ask about a specific team to get broadcaster information for upcoming games.  

(4) Ask me about SCORES by saying, “What is the score of the Milwaukee Bucks game?” OR “What are the latest scores?"  

Additionally after opening the skill, you can say things to me like:

Who is playing now?
When do the Celtics play the Lakers?
What time are the Memphis Grizzlies on?
Did the Thunder win on Monday?

**You will need to login from the Alexa companion app with a valid NBA League Pass subscription in order to listen to games.  Visit www.nba.com/leaguepass to sign up today.
review: Just recently there has been a glitch where I ask to play a certain game but it says that team is not playing today but they actual are. Hope they can get this fixed because I loved this skill up to this point.

comment heading: Good little news outlet for multisports
review: Great little news outlet for multisport and triathlon news.

name: Overwatch League Standings
description:
New feature: initial support for Echo devices with a display! For example, the Echo Show. Check it out by asking for the "top 3 teams".

New feature: Recent Results. Just say "recent results" to hear the most recent match results!

New feature: Lots of stuff behind the scenes! If a game is live, you’ll get the current score of the match, as well as much more info! Be sure to open the skill often, since the updates will keep on coming!

New feature: Now you can ask: "Alexa, when is the next game?" to find out when the next game will be on, regardless of team. 

New feature: Added game schedule. Now you can find out when your favorite team is playing next! Just say "when are the Los Angeles Gladiators playing next". Note: match times will be in UTC unless you allow the skill to access your device's location (country and postal code only!)

—
Now you can check the current standings of your favorite team (or the whole league), right from your Alexa device. Just ask the rank of your favorite team!

review: Alexa doesn’t recognize this when I ask to open NFL. She lists NFL Quiz and NFL in 60. I can’t use it! Boo! I was looking forward to using it during the playoffs.

name: Israel Football
description:
Israel Football lets you get Israel premier league (ligat-haal) table - latest standings, live scores, or next scheduled games of the 14 teams which play in the Israeli premier league.

To Get Started: Say "Alexa, open Israel Football". 
To get Israel premier league table - latest standings, say "league table". 
To get Israel premier league live scores, say "live scores". 
To get Israel premier league  next games, say "next games".
review: Great source of information about Israeli football

name: ESPN Radio (via TuneIn)
description: As part of your Flash Briefing, hear the latest sports news from the ESPN Radio SportsCenter.
review: This app is loud enough to kill small animals and children. I took it off my flash briefing because I'm pretty sure it's giving me a brain tumor. I can't express how much you should not turn this on.

name: Jammin' Jon's Wrestling News.
description: Need your daily dose of what's going on in the WWE, TNA, ROH, NJPW, and the Indies? Don't want to check the dirtsheets? Leave it up to Jammin' Jon! He will provide you every single day with the latest news in Professional Wrestling. Don't miss out on this! It's better than a bodyslam!
review: Gives you a lot of information-great for wrestling fans

name: RollTide
description: Say Roll Tide to Alexa and she will respond like a proper Alabam fan.
review: Haha! Our family thought this was great.

name: NCAA March Madness
description:

name: StatMuse
description:
StatMuse lets you explore sports statistics, schedules and scores in a whole new way, straight from your favorite players and personalities. Say "Alexa, ask StatMuse who has the most career receiving yards?" and hear Jerry Rice tell you about his record. Then try "Who had the most touchdowns last season?" to hear from David Johnson. Ask "When are the Falcons playing next?" to have Devonta Freeman give you his game schedule.



StatMuse provides instant answers to your NBA, NFL, MLB & NHL questions and features the authentic voices of Peyton Manning, Le'Veon Bell, Drew Brees, Terrell Owens, Jerry Rice and other players, plus Scott Van Pelt and Joe Buck. StatMuse is the officially licensed AI of the NFL Players Association.

Start by asking:
"Alexa, open Statmuse…"

“How did the Eagles do?”
"Who had the most passing yards in a season?"
After hearing Drew Brees answer, ask "Where did you go to college?" or "How many touchdowns did you have last season?"

"Who won the World Series in 1945?"
"Which pitcher had the most strikeouts last year?"
After hearing the answer, ask "What is his career ERA?"

"How did Steph Curry do last season?"
“Who do the Rockets play this week?”

“What hockey games are on tonight?”
“Tell me about the Golden Knights.”
StatMuse has comprehensive stats going back to 1947 for the NBA, 1920 for the NFL, 1876 for MLB and 1917 for the NHL.

Here are just a few of the stats now available to you, instantly: https://www.statmuse.com/getting-started/examples
review: Sometimes has error but works well

name: 93.7 The Fan Pittsburgh
description: The latest sports news and interview cuts from Pittsburgh hometown sports leader, 93-7 The Fan.
review: A great add on to my other news briefings.

name: 'We Are' Cheer
description: Alexa leads you in the iconic 'We Are' cheer. She says 'We Are' and you say 'Penn State.' You'll even end with 'Thank you' and 'You're welcome,' just like the real thing.
review: unbelievable setting. so much fun to use, and has invigorated our house with this opportunity

name: RollTide

This skill was created by Lenin Kumar. Your requests to this skill are not shared with the skill developer.
Its a quick 5 minute workout for people with desk jobs and busy life and not able to make it to Gym

name: AltBrains Basketball
description:
For everyone who has ever made a buzzer-beating miracle shot at a lonely hoop in a cold, dark gymnasium or on an icy asphalt court.

The skill sets up the situation and gives you the ball. With everything on the line, it's up to you to call your shot.

Example play:

"Your team is down by one with time almost elapsed. Call your shot."

"Jump shot."

"It is contested... Short. A heart-breaking outcome."

No hardware or software requirements.
review: Addictive and fun

description: Useful information about the next or last Formula 1 races, the last race results, and drivers championship standings.
review: It'd be much better if Alexa also gave the race start time along with the date of the next grand Prix. Also add a question for the next Qualifying session (and its starting time). And the times should either be in local timezone or the race locations timezone.

name: New England Patriots
description:
Meet the Patriots!

Say “Alexa, open Patriots” to hear daily news updates, discover fun facts, and learn about coming to a game at Gillette Stadium.

You may ask:
What's new with the Patriots?
Play Patriots Radio.
What time is the game?
What is the Patriots schedule?
Tell me a fun fact about the Patriots.
Can bring a blanket to the game?
review: Everyone who isnt a Pats fan are just jealous that we have Brady & Belicheck& 5 SuperBowl rings.

name: Coach Harbaugh
description:
Need to get fired up? Of course you don't - you are already attacking today with an enthusiasm unknown to mankind. But how about having your own personal Jim Harbaugh to entertain you on game day? Or on Mondays. Or every single morning while you wash down your steak breakfast with whole milk. 

You can say:
1. Alexa, ask Coach Harbaugh for a quote
2. Alexa, ask Coach Harbaugh to play "The Victors"
3. Alexa, ask Coach Harbaugh WHO'S GOT IT BETTER THAN US!?

Please note that this skill is not affiliated with the University of Michigan in any way. I'm just a fan with the constitutional right to share Jim Harbaugh's wisdom with you.

Special thanks to Sibish Basheer for making this possible.
review: Great skill.  Please keep updating and adding features.  Our Go Blue family love it

name: NFL in :60
description:
The NFL in :60 is your official daily NFL news update on the top stories from around the League. From the latest headlines to the NFL storylines you need to know on your favorite team and playmakers. Multiple updates throughout the day keep you up to speed on all the latest, straight from the NFL Network News Desk.

Go to Settings in your Alexa app and find “Flash Briefing” to move NFL in :60 to the top of your news brief!

After enabling NFL in :60, you can say "Alexa, what's my Flash Briefing?" or "Alexa, what's the news?" to hear the latest from the NFL.

Make sure to also enable The Rookie's Guide to the NFL for scores, schedules, football facts, and more.
review: Love the quick-hit recap of the most important games and match-ups.

name: Yahoo Fantasy Football
description:
Does your line-up have what it takes? Login and link one of your existing Yahoo Fantasy Football head-to-head leagues to the Alexa Skill to track your team as they make their play for the championship. Competing in multiple Head-2-Head leagues? No problem, just say ‘Change league’ to easily switch to another league. 

Use the Alexa skill to get: 
– an overview of your team’s weekly matchup and score.
– your team’s injury/bye status. 
– player scores and injury updates.

NOTE: This skill currently SUPPORTS Head-to-Head fantasy leagues only. It DOES NOT support Points leagues or Pick’Em.

review: good to catch up on any big news at the end of the day.

name: Let's Talk Soccer
description: Football. Soccer. Futbol.  Wherever you're from and whatever you call it, you love The Beautiful Game.  So do we. We're a father and son team that lives the sport. Our daily briefings will focus primarily on the Premier League and Fantasy Premier League.  On the Fantasy side, we offer information and tips - everything you'll need to put manage your best FPL team.  But, we go further and deeper with the content to include major news events, such as player transfer, as well as big stories from other domestic leagues, the big tournaments (think: Champions League), and all the notable and newsworthy players.  We provide insights and perspectives that you won't find anywhere else.  We know our stuff and deliver it in a passionate and fun way. Also, check us out on Instagram - @ LetsTalkSoccer - where you'll find even more information and entertainment related to the game.  We hope you enjoy!

name: SunUps
description:
SunUps is a 12 step mind and body exercise routine based on the ancient yogic practice of Surya Namaskar. The skill allows you to do the following:

BROWSE
Say Alexa, Ask Sunups to begin browse mode.
In this mode, you can browse through the steps by saying NEXT, REPEAT or START OVER. Listen to detailed instructions for each step and practice replicating each pose.

TRAIN
Say Alexa, Ask Sunups to begin training mode.
The skill provides a training module for those who are unaware of the steps involved in Surya Namaskar. Follow along with Alexa till you are comfortable doing SunUps on your own. Listen to detailed instructions to replicate each pose. Alexa will keep track of the number of sets you do.

TIP OF THE DAY!
Alexa, ask Sunups to tell me a tip/fact OR tip of the day.
The app provides detailed information about the various benefits of making SunUps a daily practice and the various ways to deepen your practice. 

DO
Alexa, ask Sunups to start expert mode.
Once you have learned how to do SunUps or are already familiar with them, you are ready to start doing them and let Alexa track your progress for you! Try to complete all levels to become a Sunups ninja! This mode provides Sun chants and Flute music accompaniment to elevate your experience.


SCORE
Alexa, ask Sunups for my score.
Alexa, ask Sunups to reset my score.

Alexa will tell you what level you are on and how many Sunups you will need to go to the next one! 

ALTERNATE NOSTRIL BREATHING/ BELLY BREATHING
Alexa, Ask Sunups to Begin breathing exercise.

Use calming flute music as an accompaniment for your daily 10-minute pranayama or breathing exercises. View the card for instructions.

MEDITATE

Alexa, ask Sunups to start guided relaxation.
Relax your body and mind with awareness using the 9-minute guided relaxation track provided. You may use the guided relaxation track to relax whenever you feel stressed or anxious.

Alexa, ask Sunups to start sun chants
You can use the 4-minute sun chants track for an energizing meditation experience.

*DISCLAIMER: Please seek your doctor's advice before you start these exercises. The information provided are tips and should be not considered as medical advice. *

name: Baseball Archive
description: Baseball Archive provides information and statistics for any of the 18000+ players in Major League Baseball History. Just ask about any player for a quick summary, or ask for a specific statistic for a player. Currently, Baseball Archive supports asking for a batter's career hits, home runs, and a pitcher's career wins, losses and strike outs. The Baseball Archive will add support for many more stats in subsequent versions.

name: ATP Rankings
description:
This unofficial skill provides the current ATP rankings. You can say, what is the current ranking of a particular player, who is the current number one player, who are the current top 10 players.

HOW TO USE:

To Get Started: Say "Alexa Open a. t. p. Rankings". 

Say "What is the current ranking of {player name}"
For example "What is the current ranking of Rafael Nadal"

{player name} - Player Name (ex. Rafael Nadal, Roger Federer, Novak Djokovic etc)

Say "Who is the current number {ranking} player"
For example "Who is the current number one player"

{ranking} - No (1 - 500)

Say "Who are the current top {index} players in the world"
For example "Who are the current top 10 players in the world"

{index} - No (1 - 25)

For any of the above interactions, you can also use the one-shot phrasing.

For example 
"Open a. t. p. Rankings and get me the current ranking of Rafael Nadal"
"Open a. t. p. Rankings and get me the current number three player"
"Open a. t. p. Rankings and get the top 5 players"

name: 106.7 The Fan Sports Flash
description: Your latest DC sports news and info from 106.7 The Fan
review: Provides local DC sports updates as expected, but the report isn't updated regularly enough (once every other day or so), and its content can become outdated and irrelevant quickly. Plays an ad before and after each briefing which combined end up being longer than the actual breifing. If you keep up with sports news already, this is skill isn't worth the time.

name: Cricket Info
description:
You can ask for brief, detailed or quick score updates. You can ask for score or schedule for any team. Examples, 
“Alexa, ask cricket info to get score update” gets brief score update of all on going matches.
“Alexa, ask cricket info to get team India schedule” gets schedule of team India cricket matches.
"Alexa, ask cricket info to get IPL update" gets score updates for ongoing IPL matches. 
“Alexa, ask cricket info to get quick score update” gets score summary for all ongoing matches, you can optionally request quick score for a team.
“Alexa, ask cricket info to get team Australia detailed score” gets detailed score for ongoing match of team Australia.
comment heading: If you love cricket, you need this app!
review: I'm glad somebody wrote this app -- great stuff on Alexa. I wish they can add poll mechanism to get an update on the score after every over.

name: Philadelphia 76ers
description: The official Philadelphia 76ers skill is your guide to every NBA season. Whether you’re looking for a recap of last night’s action, or looking for the Sixers' next game and how to watch it, this skill has you covered. You can also get the latest team headlines, stat leaders for every game, and check the Sixers' current conference standing!

name: CBS Sports Minute
description: Boomer Esiason, John Feinstein, Doug Gottlieb and Jim Rome provide unique commentaries in the world of Sports news
review: It picks one random, often not timely, story (can be repeated over a few days) and plays a few jingles. Absolutely not what you'd expect in a sports update.

name: Therapy Tips
description:
Therapy Tips is a skill that provides motivational quotes.

You can say:

"Alexa, open Therapy Tips"
"Alexa, start Therapy Tips"
"Alexa, launch Therapy Tips"

Please leave a 5-star review if you love this skill. 
Your 5-star reviews encourage us to keep making more great skills, thanks!

name: Crashstappen
description:
Ask for crashstappen, for the last crash of Max.

At anytime, you can stop by saying "Alexa, stop" 

 Follow me on Twitter: @flexydev
review: most stupidest skill ever

name: Arsenal
description:
Get the most out of every match day with Arsenal FC’s official skill. With full support for pre-match build-up, live commentary and post-match analysis you can keep up to date with all the action. 
 
To get started, simply say "Alexa, open Arsenal."
 
Options include: 

Pre Match:
“Alexa, ask Arsenal for the match preview.” - receive an overview of the upcoming match.
“Alexa, ask Arsenal who’s injured?” - find out who is injured.
“Alexa, ask Arsenal for the team lineup.” - available approximately one hour before kick-off.
“Alexa, ask Arsenal for the pre-match build up.” - listen to the official pre-match commentary, available around 30 minutes before kick-off.

During Match:
“Alexa, ask Arsenal for the live commentary.” - listen to the official match commentary, available during a game.
“Alexa, ask Arsenal for the match summary.” - find out the score, bookings, injuries and substitutions.
“Alexa, ask Arsenal for the score.” - learn how we’re getting on in-play.

Post Match:
“Alexa, ask Arsenal for the post match analysis.” - listen to the official post-match commentary, available for around 30 minutes after the final whistle. 
“Alexa, ask Arsenal for the match report.” - hear the official Arsenal opinion of the game.
review: When you ask Alexa to play the live commentary during a match she says "Playing now" and then nothing happens. Not much good if you cannot hear the games.

name: Ab Workout
description:
Ab Workout is a skill that runs through a 5-minute ab workout.

This skill will run you through 5 different abdominal/core workouts, for 60 seconds each. Right now the workout consists of crunches, flutter kicks, mountain climber twists, core roll ups, and plank.

You can say:

"Alexa, open Ab Workout"
"Alexa, start Ab Workout"
"Alexa, launch Ab Workout"

Please leave a 5-star review if you love this skill, or leave comments or feedback to help us improve. Your 5-star reviews encourage us to keep making more great skills, thanks!
review: place a silent during the workout and basically starting and  basically STOPS... just goes silent. not acceptable... terrible app!!!

comment heading: No information available - waste of time
review: I asked Baseball Archive about Rube Waddell, George Waddell, Mike Shannon, Willie Mays and Mark McGuire. It told me it couldn't find any information about any of these people. This was a total waste of time.

name: Yahoo Fantasy Football
description:

Competing in multiple Head-2-Head leagues? No problem, just say ‘Change league’ to easily switch to another league. 

Use the Alexa skill to get: 
– an overview of your team’s weekly matchup and score.
– your team’s injury/bye status. 
– player scores and injury updates.
All without ever putting your hands on the ball.

——

NOTE: This skill currently SUPPORTS Head-to-Head fantasy leagues only. It DOES NOT support Points leagues or Pick’Em.

name: Indians Baseball Fan Trivia
description:

name: StatMuse
description:
StatMuse lets you explore sports statistics, schedules and scores in a whole new way, straight from your favorite players and personalities. Say "Alexa, ask StatMuse who has the most career receiving yards?" and hear Jerry Rice tell you about his record. Then try "Who had the most touchdowns last season?" to hear from David Johnson. Ask "When are the Falcons playing next?" to have Devonta Freeman give you his game schedule.



StatMuse provides instant answers to your NBA, NFL, MLB & NHL questions and features the authentic voices of Peyton Manning, Le'Veon Bell, Drew Brees, Terrell Owens, Jerry Rice and other players, plus Scott Van Pelt and Joe Buck. StatMuse is the officially licensed AI of the NFL Players Association.

Start by asking:
"Alexa, open Statmuse…"

“How did the Eagles do?”
"Who had the most passing yards in a season?"
After hearing Drew Brees answer, ask "Where did you go to college?" or "How many touchdowns did you have last season?"

"Who won the World Series in 1945?"
"Which pitcher had the most strikeouts last year?"
After hearing the answer, ask "What is his career ERA?"

"How did Steph Curry do last season?"
“Who do the Rockets play this week?”

“What hockey games are on tonight?”
“Tell me about the Golden Knights.”
StatMuse has comprehensive stats going back to 1947 for the NBA, 1920 for the NFL, 1876 for MLB and 1917 for the NHL.

Here are just a few of the stats now available to you, instantly: https://www.statmuse.com/getting-started/examples
review: This is a useful skill. Great knowledge,

Also, I am not a beginner archer and would like to be able to ask specific  advanced questions such as "Explain how to determine my proper arrow length" or "What types of mechanical releases are available?  Which mechanical release is best for competitive target shooting?".  This is my very first free Alexa app to load.  Very fun!  Thanks

name: Baseball Reference
description:
Welcome to the Baseball Reference Alexa application. This application makes finding out leaders in certain statistics as easy as just asking. As of right now this app can only return top ranking and you cannot make request by specific players or team statistics.

Users are able to request a multitude of different statistics that can be further specified by rank (1-10), top amount (top two, top three, top four, etc.) year (1871 - present), and league (All of Baseball, National League or American League). 

Here are some initial example requests:
-------------------------------------------
Alexa, ask Baseball Reference who is third in the National League in home runs.

Who leads the league in doubles?

Who lead the American League in wins in nineteen eighty six?

Who is the oldest player in the league?

Alexa, ask Baseball Reference, in nineteen ninety nine, who lead the league in home runs?

Who was top three in strikeouts?

Who was tenth in wins in the National League in nineteen seventy two
-------------------------------------------

Another feature available to users is that after a user makes a successful request and are prompted to ask another question, a user can build upon their previous request.


For Example:
-------------------------------------------
User Requests - "Alexa, ask Baseball Reference who was second in the National League in hits in nineteen eighty three"

Alexa Responds - "Rafael Ramirez was second in the National League with 185 Hits in 1983."

The user can now request a few things:

- Next -
User Requests - "Who was next?"
Alexa Responds -  "Al Oliver was third in the National League with 184 Hits in 1983."

- Previous -
User Requests - "Who was previous?"
Alexa Responds -  "Jose Cruz and Andre Dawson were tied for first in the National League with 189 Hits In 1983 ."

- Rank -
User Requests - "Who was sixth?"
Alexa Responds -  "Dickie Thon was sixth in the National League with 177 Hits In 1983."

- Top -
User Requests - "Who was top three?"
Alexa Responds -  "Jose Cruz and Andre Dawson were tied for first in the National League with 189 Hits In 1983. Rafael Ramirez was second in the National League with 185 Hits In 1983. Al Oliver was third in the National League with 184 Hits In 1983."
-------------------------------------------

Statistics To Request
-----------------------
// Hitting
Singles
Doubles
Triples
Home runs
RBIs
Runs
Stolen bases
Caught stealing
Batting average
Hits
Wins above replacement
Slugging percentage
Extra base hits
Total bases
On base percentage
Walks
Intentional walks
Sacrifice flies
At bats per home run
Grounded into double plays

// Pitching
Earned Run Average
Strikeouts
Strikes per walk
Strikeouts per nine innings
WHIP
Wins
Shutouts
Saves
Innings Pitches

//Misc
Oldest Player
Youngest Player

If you have any questions or comments regarding this application please feel free to reach out to us at ottomanellibaseball@gmail.com.

name: Unofficial MLB Game Info
description:
Now you can get MLB game information for your favorite teams right in your Flash Briefing!  This Skill has one feed for every MLB team so be sure to enable the feeds for the teams you are interested in.  Data for all feeds is currently refreshed every few minutes.

This Skill currently tells you the following during your Flash Briefing:
* Result and score for today's game if already played or in progress
* Time for today's game if not yet played (time reported always in US Eastern timezone)
* Result and score for yesterday's game if there was one

Please note, Flash Briefing Skills must have a "Default" feed.  The Tampa Bay Rays feed will be enabled by default (the author's favorite team), so please remember to disable it in your Flash Briefing settings if you do not want Rays information.  Here's how you can enable a different feed:
  1. Open the Alexa App or go to https://alexa.amazon.com
  2. In the Menu, go to Settings
  3. In Settings, go to Flash Briefing under the Accounts section
  4. This will show you all the Flash Briefing "Feeds" you have turned On and Off.  You should see "Tampa Bay Rays Games" listed under the On section, as that is the default (Go Rays!).  Now under the Off section you should see "Unofficial MLB Game Info" with a little down arrow.  Tap that (it may take a few seconds to list them all, this appears to be a bug in Alexa App).
  5. You should now see all the other 29 MLB teams listed.  Find your team and click/tap on it and this will enable the "Feed".
  6. Now that team should show under the On section and you can turn off the Rays Feed (or keep it on and embrace them as your favorite AL team!).

You can contact me directly at josh@userdel.com, or https://github.com/irlrobot/mlb_game_info, for feedback and bug reports.  Enjoy!

This skill is not sponsored or endorsed by Major League Baseball (MLB) or any of its affiliates.
review: This is baller

name: NCAA March Madness
description:
NCAA March Madness for Alexa delivers real-time tournament scores, schedules, information about your Bracket Picks, and live radio for each game.

Example Phrases:

“Alexa, ask March Madness what games are on right now?”

“Alexa, ask March Madness for today's scores.”

“Alexa, ask March Madness for today's schedule.”

“Alexa, ask March Madness what games can I listen to on the radio?”

“Alexa, ask March Madness for the score of the North Carolina game.”

“Alexa, ask March Madness to play the Duke versus Kentucky game.”

“Alexa, ask March Madness what time the Kansas game starts.”

“Alexa, ask March Madness how my bracket is doing.”

“Alexa, ask March Madness who I picked to win it all.”

“Alexa, ask March Madness which teams I picked today.”

To ask for help or give feedback on this skill please contact mmlivehelp@turner.com

*Note: The live radio feature is currently not supported on Fire TV.

*Note: Must sign-in with a valid Capital One NCAA March Madness Bracket Challenge account in order to get information about your bracket picks.
