name: NCAA March Madness
description:
NCAA March Madness for Alexa delivers real-time tournament scores, schedules, information about your Bracket Picks, and live radio for each game.

Example Phrases:

“Alexa, ask March Madness what games are on right now?”

“Alexa, ask March Madness for today's scores.”

“Alexa, ask March Madness for today's schedule.”

“Alexa, ask March Madness what games can I listen to on the radio?”

“Alexa, ask March Madness for the score of the North Carolina game.”

“Alexa, ask March Madness to play the Duke versus Kentucky game.”

“Alexa, ask March Madness what time the Kansas game starts.”

“Alexa, ask March Madness how my bracket is doing.”

“Alexa, ask March Madness who I picked to win it all.”

“Alexa, ask March Madness which teams I picked today.”

To ask for help or give feedback on this skill please contact mmlivehelp@turner.com

*Note: The live radio feature is currently not supported on Fire TV.

*Note: Must sign-in with a valid Capital One NCAA March Madness Bracket Challenge account in order to get information about your bracket picks.
comment heading: Good updates - Could get better if it knew more
review:
This skill is a fun way to keep up with the tourney. If you are hardcore, trying to get updates on multiple brackets, the short summary of games are not going to be enough. I've asked it on non-game days for an update though and it's good about letting me know when the next games are, who's recently had an upset, and the status of the Men's tourney.

The only downside is that it is hard to be subtle about following games in the office when I have to ask my tap: Alexa, Ask March Madness what's the score?

name: VSIN
description:
Welcome to this new Alexa Skill from the Vegas Stats & Information Network. VSiN is a sports betting news network broadcasting 24-7 on VSiN.com and SiriusXM 204. 

This skill provides you with the latest sports betting lines for today’s games from the oddsmakers at the South Point sports book in Las Vegas.

Here is how to interact with Alexa:

>>Always begin by saying "Alexa, ask Vegas Stats" You should always start your conversation with me this way.

>>To get the line for a specific game, say “Alexa, ask Vegas Stats for the line on the [city and team name] game.

Alexa will answer with the appropriate betting lines based on the sports provided: pro and college basketball, hockey, baseball and pro and college football.

The betting lines could include the point spread, the money line and the total depending on the sport
review: unlike the super radio and writing - This app never works. it always says “I dont Recognize that team name”

skills-rest: Real Runs - Running Tips for Runners
name: Real Runs - Running Tips for Runners
description: Discover how to be like the fittest and healthiest runners in the world with only small changes. We give you scientifically-tested running tips from famous running coaches like Bill Bowerman, Terrence Mahon, Jack Daniels, Joan Benoit, Clyde Hart, and others.  This briefing will help you naturally improve your runs, from beginners to more advanced runners. We will guide you to get more energy for runs and show you the secrets that top runners share with each other, including Olympic athletes.  Our daily dose will make you a better runner and help you optimize your runs.  Caution: The information in this skill is provided for informational and educational purposes only.  Please consult a doctor before starting a running workout.
review: Makes me want to run every morning...

name: Baseball Scores in 30 seconds
description: Just the score ma'am.  Daily scores in less than 30 seconds by SportDrum .  The must-have Alexa flash briefing for sports fans.  Say Alexa, enable Baseball Scores in 30 seconds.

description:
Have Alexa call the razorbacks hogs by saying

Optionally "and let's beat the {mascot}" or "and let's beat {college}"  can be included at the end of the launch command.

"Alexa, Start calling the hogs and beat Alabama"
comment heading: At least have her pronounce it right!

Start by saying, “Alexa, What’s the latest news?" or "Alexa, what's my flash briefing?

Created by the National Hockey League

name: TigerNet
description: Welcome to the TigerNet.com Alexa Skill!  You may ask TigerNet for the latest headline.  More functions will be added soon!
review: Woohoo great skill to have at breakfast.

skills-rest: San Francisco Giants Baseball Fan Trivia
name: San Francisco Giants Baseball Fan Trivia
description:
San Francisco baseball trivia was amassed by a long time fan. This new skill brings Indians baseball trivia into your home year round.

Giants baseball trivia is great for the entire family! Play with or against each other and see who really knows the Indians.

New trivia is constantly being added to the skill so keep coming back to play!

This skill is not sponsored by MLB or the San Francisco Giants. This is a fan created skill.
review: Works just as advertised no problems

name: NBA
description:
Welcome to the new NBA Alexa Skill! You can interact with me in several ways:

(1) Open me by saying "Alexa, open NBA." You should always start your conversation with me this way.  This will trigger the welcome menu and tell you how to listen to live NBA action, check scores, and get schedule info. 

After you’ve opened the NBA skill…

(2) **To LISTEN TO A GAME**, tell me “Play the Cavs game" or “Stream the Atlanta game."  Most games have the home and away announcers, just say the team name for the announcers you want and we'll start streaming.  If Alexa has trouble recognizing your team name, be sure and use the city AND team name together, like “Houston Rockets.”

(3) To ask about the SCHEDULE, say “What games are on today?” OR “When do the Warriors play?”  Ask about a specific team to get broadcaster information for upcoming games.  

(4) Ask me about SCORES by saying, “What is the score of the Milwaukee Bucks game?” OR “What are the latest scores?"  

Additionally after opening the skill, you can say things to me like:

Who is playing now?
When do the Celtics play the Lakers?
What time are the Memphis Grizzlies on?
Did the Thunder win on Monday?

**You will need to login from the Alexa companion app with a valid NBA League Pass subscription in order to listen to games.  Visit www.nba.com/leaguepass to sign up today.
review: After linking my account (not sure why I needed to), and allowing the skill to access my postal code/country, the game times are still reported in the wrong timezone. Also, you would think that a skill that tells you sports scores would show you a card with more info, but I have yet to see a card generated by this skill. I also encountered a bug in one of the responses I got after using the skill for the second time. Not a good experience.

name: CBS Sports Minute
description: Boomer Esiason, John Feinstein, Doug Gottlieb and Jim Rome provide unique commentaries in the world of Sports news
comment heading: Ads killed this once great skill
review:
I literally just timed the CBS Sports Minute...

60 second ad
15 seconds of Boomer Esiason saying who the update is sponsored by.
45 seconds of actual sports updates
30 second ad

So unless you want to hear more ads than actual content, skip this skill.

name: 49ers Fan
description:
Get unofficial to-the-minute stats & fun facts on the 49ers by Fresh Digital Group. This skill isn’t sponsored or endorsed by the 49ers.

Here’s some ways you can use the skill. We have given you many different ways for you to talk to Alexa:



General Updates:

Alexa, ask 49ers Fan who do the 49ers play next?

Alexa, ask 49ers Fan Carlos Hyde (or any player's First name, Last name) touchdown update.



Fun Facts about the 49ers:

description: This is a simple Alexa Skill that returns the NASCAR driver name for a given number or the number for a given driver in the 2016 NASCAR Sprint Cup Series.  The skill also returns the vehicle make of the car the driver drives.  Additionally, the driver's sponsor and car owner are displayed in a card in the Alexa App.

description:
How well do you know Manchester City? Test your knowledge of the clubs history, accomplishments, famous players and fun trivia facts.

To get started, just say "Alexa, Play Manchester City Trivia". The game will ask 4 different multi-choice questions. Give the answer you think is the right one and find out how much of a 'Citizen' you really are.

name: Who's on First?
description:
Who's on first? What's on second? For the first time ever, hear the world famous Abbott & Costello baseball themed comedy routine spoken by a virtual assistant. Play ball!

If you enjoyed this skill, please tell a friend and remember to leave it a 5 star review in your Alexa app. Thanks in advance!!!
review: Good to hear this classic routine again.

name: World Cup Soccer Trivia
description:
If you are a soccer fan and you like keeping up to date with world cup tournaments and players, this is the quiz to put your knowledge to the test. 

If you don't know that much, this quiz will help you to learn more about the world of soccer. In every quiz, you will get 5 questions to answer, testing your knowledge. 

Keep coming back for more, because each set of 5 questions are randomly selected from a large pool of questions!

You can answer the questions with phrases like:
"The answer is <one>"
"My answer is <two>"
"Is it <three>"
"<four> is my answer"
review: Good questions but if you don't answer fast enough the game ends. Having instructions of all available commands at launch would be helpful.

name: CBS Sports Minute

Have feedback? Please let us know how we can improve! Email us anytime at alexa@auberginesolutions.com.

name: Surf Checker
description:
THE ROCK WAS ADDED AND MOST CALIFORNIA AND HAWAII SURF SPOTS ARE AVAILABLE!

Let Alexa give you the surf report for most California and Hawaii surf spots.  Also for each surf spot, let Alexa also give you the tide report, the water temperature and let you know when is the best day to surf for the upcoming week.

Using the streamlined commands structure, getting the surf report information for several spots is simple and easy.  

Here are examples to try: 
 
"Alexa, Ask Surf Checker for Salt Creek on Tuesday"
"When is the best day to surf Lowers"
"What is the tide report for San Clemente State Beach on Wednesday"
"What is the water temperature at Lihaina Harbor"
"When is the best day to surf Pipeline"

For surf reports, just say the surf spot name for quick results:
For example, just say "Sunset Beach" for the Sunset Beach surf report. Or say, "Sunset Beach on Thursday" to get the report for the upcoming Thursday.        

Alexa also remembers the last surf report you requested so that additional reports do not have to include the spot name.   For example once you ask for a report like:
"What is the surf report for Pismo Beach Pier"

You can get the tide, water temperature, and best day to surf at Pismo Beach Pier by saying:
"What is the tide report" or just "tide report?"
"When is the best day to surf"
"What is the water temperature" or just "water temperature"

If you want to find the tide activity later in the week for Pismo Beach just say:
"Tide report for tomorrow" or "Tide report on Friday"

Listed below are JUST SOME of the surf spots available.  There were too many to list here.  The complete list is at www.surfncircuits.com.  New locations soon!!   If you want your surf spot added please mention it in comment below or at www.surfncircuits.com

name: StatMuse
description:
StatMuse lets you explore sports statistics, schedules and scores in a whole new way, straight from your favorite players and personalities. Say "Alexa, ask StatMuse who has the most career receiving yards?" and hear Jerry Rice tell you about his record. Then try "Who had the most touchdowns last season?" to hear from David Johnson. Ask "When are the Falcons playing next?" to have Devonta Freeman give you his game schedule.



StatMuse provides instant answers to your NBA, NFL, MLB & NHL questions and features the authentic voices of Peyton Manning, Le'Veon Bell, Drew Brees, Terrell Owens, Jerry Rice and other players, plus Scott Van Pelt and Joe Buck. StatMuse is the officially licensed AI of the NFL Players Association.

Start by asking:
"Alexa, open Statmuse…"

“How did the Eagles do?”
"Who had the most passing yards in a season?"
After hearing Drew Brees answer, ask "Where did you go to college?" or "How many touchdowns did you have last season?"

"Who won the World Series in 1945?"
"Which pitcher had the most strikeouts last year?"
After hearing the answer, ask "What is his career ERA?"

"How did Steph Curry do last season?"
“Who do the Rockets play this week?”

“What hockey games are on tonight?”
“Tell me about the Golden Knights.”
StatMuse has comprehensive stats going back to 1947 for the NBA, 1920 for the NFL, 1876 for MLB and 1917 for the NHL.

Here are just a few of the stats now available to you, instantly: https://www.statmuse.com/getting-started/examples

However that being said it's still pretty amazing overall

name: ADVrider.com (Unofficial) Dakar 2019 News
description:
The Dakar Rally is an annual rally raid organised by the Amaury Sport Organisation. Most events since the inception in 1978 were from Paris, France, to Dakar, Senegal, but due to security threats in Mauritania, which led to the cancellation of the 2008 rally, races since 2009 have been held in South America.

The 2019 Rally runs from 6 January 2019 -  17 January 2019. It covers 5,000 km of racing over 10 stages. 

ADVrider.com has been the internet's number one resource for adventure motorcycling on the internet for over a decade. Our team in South America is following the rally on the ground.

Subscribe to get the latest Dakar news and stage results.
comment heading: ADVRider Is My Go To Place For ADV Oriented Content
review: I've been an inmate at ADVRider for many years.  The content is excellent and the information very extensive.  I can get ride reports, GPX files, great pictures and participate in an interested and engaged community.

(3) To ask about the SCHEDULE, say “What games are on today?” OR “When do the Warriors play?”  Ask about a specific team to get broadcaster information for upcoming games.  

(4) Ask me about SCORES by saying, “What is the score of the Milwaukee Bucks game?” OR “What are the latest scores?"  

Additionally after opening the skill, you can say things to me like:

Who is playing now?
When do the Celtics play the Lakers?
What time are the Memphis Grizzlies on?
Did the Thunder win on Monday?

**You will need to login from the Alexa companion app with a valid NBA League Pass subscription in order to listen to games.  Visit www.nba.com/leaguepass to sign up today.

name: MTB Trails
description: Allows a user to query any city in the world and find mountain biking trails near that city. The default distance is set to 30 miles, but can be changed to any distance between one and 200 miles. More detailed information, including distance, difficulty, and elevation change is included for each trail. Trail conditions are also available.
review:
this is a good idea for mountain biking app. The ability to find trails around any given area is a pretty good thing. furthermore, being able to narrow down that search to a given radius? that would be helpful.

however, that second portion is where this scale falls flat. repeatedly I have attempted to narrow the search radius to 1 mile, or 6 miles, or 10 miles. I always get the same response. "Sorry, the distance you specified is not valid." this is true if I say one mile, 10 miles, three miles... you get the idea.

with the default search of 30 miles, this means if you're asking for an area that may be near a major city, you will get places that are 10, 15, 30 miles away from you.

if that could be adjusted, as in fixed, I would certainly bump up this review. however, as the skill stands as of today, I cannot give it any more than two stars.

hopefully your experience will be better than mine.

review: Wrong answer to where Red Sox played before Fenway park correct answer is Hunnington ave grounds. App said field at Boston common was correct.

name: ESPN Radio (via TuneIn)
description: As part of your Flash Briefing, hear the latest sports news from the ESPN Radio SportsCenter.
review:
Like others have said, I had to remove this from my flash briefing because it's absurdly loud.  I had this right after my CNN briefing, which conversely, is too quiet, so I would generally already have the volume higher than normal when ESPN would start screaming in my face.  The briefings are usually fast paced and high energy, so the volume just adds to the chaos.

This is a "one size fits all" skill, so you're at the mercy of the sports ESPN wants to include in the briefing.  Sometimes you'll only get a few seconds dedicated to the team or sport you want to hear about.  If they turned down the gain on the skill and made it quieter, I'd probably go back to using it.  But I'd love to see multiple skills for multiple sports all with a lot less screaming.

name: UFC Octagon News
description:
Have you ever asked yourself when is the next UFC event? Or what were the fights in the upcoming UFC main event? Now with this new UFC Octagon News skill, one can get the answer to these questions through Alexa. The UFC Octagon News was created for UFC fans to receive UFC related information easily through an Alexa device.

One can invoke this skill by saying "Alexa, open UFC Octagon".

Once the skill starts, it will prompt the listener to say something like "news", "next event", "previous event" or "men ranking". Then, the listener can choose the desired option to receive the related information back from Alexa.

Please note that this skill will continue growing based on the feedback and support we receive back from listeners. Currently, below are the main features:

1.	Say "news" to get more information about trending news relating to UFC. This option will also provide any other 
        update or new feature messages about this skill.

2.	Say "next event" to get more information about the next UFC main event such as date, place, main card fights.

3.	Say "previous event" to get more information about the results of the previous UFC main card fights.

4.	Say "men ranking" to get more information about all the UFC ranking categories for men. Please note that only the 
        champion and the top 3 ranked men fighters will be listed for each category.

5.	Say "women ranking" to get more information about all the UFC ranking categories for women. Please note that 
        only the champion and the top 3 ranked women fighters will be listed for each category.

6.	Say "stop" if you wish to exit the skill.

7.	Say "help" to get more information about how to use this Alexa skill.

Please feel free to contact us at quizmemore@yahoo.com for any issues or feedback you might have. We would love to hear from you about this skill to help us make this a better experience for everyone.
review: Just tested out this skill. Only complaint I have is that when I said previous event it pulled the results for UFC Bejing instead of the Ultimate Fighter Finale event from last night.

name: Patriots Fan
description:
Here are 38 interesting unofficial facts about the Patriots! The skill is not sponsored or endorsed by New England Patriots.
Facts were supplied by Will Gellman.
review: I love the patriots and I didn't know that you could use it with Alexa.

name: Unofficial MLB Game Info
description:
Now you can get MLB game information for your favorite teams right in your Flash Briefing!  This Skill has one feed for every MLB team so be sure to enable the feeds for the teams you are interested in.  Data for all feeds is currently refreshed every few minutes.

This Skill currently tells you the following during your Flash Briefing:
* Result and score for today's game if already played or in progress
* Time for today's game if not yet played (time reported always in US Eastern timezone)
* Result and score for yesterday's game if there was one

Please note, Flash Briefing Skills must have a "Default" feed.  The Tampa Bay Rays feed will be enabled by default (the author's favorite team), so please remember to disable it in your Flash Briefing settings if you do not want Rays information.  Here's how you can enable a different feed:
  1. Open the Alexa App or go to https://alexa.amazon.com
  2. In the Menu, go to Settings
  3. In Settings, go to Flash Briefing under the Accounts section
  4. This will show you all the Flash Briefing "Feeds" you have turned On and Off.  You should see "Tampa Bay Rays Games" listed under the On section, as that is the default (Go Rays!).  Now under the Off section you should see "Unofficial MLB Game Info" with a little down arrow.  Tap that (it may take a few seconds to list them all, this appears to be a bug in Alexa App).
  5. You should now see all the other 29 MLB teams listed.  Find your team and click/tap on it and this will enable the "Feed".
  6. Now that team should show under the On section and you can turn off the Rays Feed (or keep it on and embrace them as your favorite AL team!).

You can contact me directly at josh@userdel.com, or https://github.com/irlrobot/mlb_game_info, for feedback and bug reports.  Enjoy!

This skill is not sponsored or endorsed by Major League Baseball (MLB) or any of its affiliates.

name: San Diego Sockers News
description: The official San Diego Sockers Alexa Skill for the latest news and information.

name: Overwatch League
description:
Recent additions:
Ask for today's games, yesterday's results or tomorrow's games. Also, ask for the record of your favorite team to get overall match wins and losses for the season. Also included are a few more Overwatch "Hello" emotes when launching the skill.

With the Overwatch League skill you can keep track of when your favorite teams are playing and always know the current league standings. Or, if you simply just want to know when the next game is you can ask Overwatch League to tell you when the next match is. In order to get match start times in your local timezone this skill requests permissions to access device country and postal code. Be sure to ask for help to hear an explanation for the available commands.

name: Benchmark WOD by WIKIWOD
description:
Benchmark and Hero series workouts are used to track the performance of the CrossFit athletes.

There's three main categories of these workouts: Girls, New Girls, and Hero WODs. The total number of these workouts is over one hundred.

Since athletes do not perform these WODs as often, it is difficult to remember all of them.

With Benchmark WOD skill by WIKIWOD, you don't have to memorize these workouts anymore.

Simply ask Alexa "What is Grace?", or "What is Chelsea workout?"  Alexa will tell you what this WOD consists of.

More about Benchmark and Hero series workouts on www.wikiwod.com

name: NFL in :60
description:
The NFL in :60 is your official daily NFL news update on the top stories from around the League. From the latest headlines to the NFL storylines you need to know on your favorite team and playmakers. Multiple updates throughout the day keep you up to speed on all the latest, straight from the NFL Network News Desk.

Go to Settings in your Alexa app and find “Flash Briefing” to move NFL in :60 to the top of your news brief!

After enabling NFL in :60, you can say "Alexa, what's my Flash Briefing?" or "Alexa, what's the news?" to hear the latest from the NFL.

Make sure to also enable The Rookie's Guide to the NFL for scores, schedules, football facts, and more.

name: Surf Checker
description:
THE ROCK WAS ADDED AND MOST CALIFORNIA AND HAWAII SURF SPOTS ARE AVAILABLE!

Let Alexa give you the surf report for most California and Hawaii surf spots.  Also for each surf spot, let Alexa also give you the tide report, the water temperature and let you know when is the best day to surf for the upcoming week.

Using the streamlined commands structure, getting the surf report information for several spots is simple and easy.  

Here are examples to try: 
 
"Alexa, Ask Surf Checker for Salt Creek on Tuesday"
"When is the best day to surf Lowers"
"What is the tide report for San Clemente State Beach on Wednesday"
"What is the water temperature at Lihaina Harbor"
"When is the best day to surf Pipeline"

For surf reports, just say the surf spot name for quick results:
For example, just say "Sunset Beach" for the Sunset Beach surf report. Or say, "Sunset Beach on Thursday" to get the report for the upcoming Thursday.        

Alexa also remembers the last surf report you requested so that additional reports do not have to include the spot name.   For example once you ask for a report like:
"What is the surf report for Pismo Beach Pier"

You can get the tide, water temperature, and best day to surf at Pismo Beach Pier by saying:
"What is the tide report" or just "tide report?"
"When is the best day to surf"
"What is the water temperature" or just "water temperature"

If you want to find the tide activity later in the week for Pismo Beach just say:
"Tide report for tomorrow" or "Tide report on Friday"

Listed below are JUST SOME of the surf spots available.  There were too many to list here.  The complete list is at www.surfncircuits.com.  New locations soon!!   If you want your surf spot added please mention it in comment below or at www.surfncircuits.com

description:
Get unofficial to-the-minute stats & fun facts on the Seahawks by Fresh Digital Group. This skill isn’t sponsored or endorsed by the Seahawks.

Here’s some ways you can use the skill. We have given you many different ways for you to talk to Alexa:



General Updates:


Alexa, ask Seahawks Fan how are the Seahawks doing? 

Alexa, ask Seahawks Fan who do the Seahawks play next?

Alexa, ask Seahawks Fan Russell Wilson (or any player's First name, Last name) touchdown update. 



Fun Facts about the Seahawks:


Alexa, ask Seahawks Fan to tell me some trivia about the Seahawks. 

Alexa, ask Seahawks Fan how many Super Bowls have the Seahawks won?

name: The Great Odin
description: Summon your inner Norseman by asking The Great Odin to sound the Gjallarhorn! Skol Vikings!
review: Great Odin did not smile upon me. No horn was blown.

name: FanDuel: Pick 6
description:
Strap on your helmet and get ready for FanDuel: Pick 6! During the regular season, make six predictions about what you think will happen during the Sunday Night and Monday Night football games. Watch the game, all from the comfort of your couch, check in for updates, and see how many picks you can get right each time you play!

Simply say “Alexa, Open FanDuel” and get started today.
review: Made my picks, ready for the game

name: GolfNow
description: GolfNow is the world's first tee-time marketplace, golfers have the ability to search and book tee times anywhere in the United States.  Golfers wishing to book tee times should link their GolfNow account from within the Alexa app.

name: LFC News
description: The latest LFC news direct from Liverpool Football Club
comment heading: The best football family in the world
review: Fantastic! YNWA

name: College Football Roster Info
description:
The College Football Roster Info skill lets you get information about any player on any team in the FBS by name or number. Simply ask Alexa about players by using their full name, last name, or number and their team and she will tell you key information about them like their height, weight, class and hometown. 
Note: information is current as of the start of the season, if you find numbers have changed let me know as the teams sometimes shuffle those in the first week or so.
review: It says ole miss or university of Mississippi is not a fbs team

name: ESPN
description:
Get your sports radio fix with the ESPN skill. From Mike and Mike to Dan Le Batard and Stu Gotz, this skill brings you live ESPN Radio, several ESPN affiliate stations, and hourly news updates.  

Say, "Tell me the news," "Play the radio," or ask for your local ESPN radio station to access the best in sports radio content.

Supported radio stations include:
- ESPN Radio
- ESPN Deportes Radio
- ESPN Chicago (WMVP 1000 AM)
- ESPN Los Angeles (KSPN 710 AM)
- ESPN New York (WEPN 98.7 FM)
- ESPN Deportes New York (WEPN 1050 AM)
review: Espn is a cesspool of stupid sports announcers.  That's right Steven A Smith and Max Kellerman, you are both turds that need to be flushed. You all can take your politics and shove them up your Keith Olberman.  Sincerely and average American that just wants to watch sports.
